dfca8a65-dacf-4cd8-93b8-010fb42d63f2 Gather the ingredients.
dfca8a65-dacf-4cd8-93b8-010fb42d63f2 Place the salmon filet on a plate and freeze for about 20 minutes. It should be firm, but not frozen solid.
dfca8a65-dacf-4cd8-93b8-010fb42d63f2 Slice the salmon length wise into 1/8-inch wide planks. Cut each plank into 1/8-inch strips and then cut the strips into 1/8-inch cubes.
dfca8a65-dacf-4cd8-93b8-010fb42d63f2 Place the salmon into a small bowl and toss with the lime juice.
dfca8a65-dacf-4cd8-93b8-010fb42d63f2 In a larger bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, sesame oil, and lime zest. Then add all of the remaining ingredients and toss to combine.
620425a5-26cc-4e7a-966c-a6f86318b1cb Gather the ingredients.
620425a5-26cc-4e7a-966c-a6f86318b1cb Cut salmon fillets into 3 inch chunks and remove any skin or bones that remain. Place chunks into a food processor with white parts of the green onion. Add salt, white pepper, ginger, almond flour and rice wine vinegar.
620425a5-26cc-4e7a-966c-a6f86318b1cb Process ingredients until well combined. Mixture should have a little texture, so do not over process. Remove lid, add green portion of green onion, replace lid and pulse 5 times. Set aside while you prepare the grill.
620425a5-26cc-4e7a-966c-a6f86318b1cb Preheat grill for medium high heat. Once grill comes up to full heat (about 10-15 minutes later), oil grill grates with an oil soaked paper towel. Secure into a large pair of cooking tons and wipe across grill grate 3-4 times to create a non-stick cooking surface.
620425a5-26cc-4e7a-966c-a6f86318b1cb While grill is heating up, form salmon mixture into 5 equal sized patties. Place onto grill and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 145 degrees F/65 degrees C. Once cooked through, remove patties from heat and place onto a large plate. Tent with aluminum foil.
620425a5-26cc-4e7a-966c-a6f86318b1cb To prepare slaw: Add shredded radicchio and carrots to a marge bowl. Add soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, salt and black pepper. Toss to coat. Taste and add more soy sauce or salt to you liking. Add peanuts at the very end and toss to distribute through slaw. You can prepare the slaw before working on the salmon. Simply cover bowl and place into refrigerator until ready to use.
620425a5-26cc-4e7a-966c-a6f86318b1cb To prepare mayonnaise: Combine mayonnaise with sambal sauce, pepper, onion powder.
620425a5-26cc-4e7a-966c-a6f86318b1cb To assemble burgers: add a generous amount of sambal mayonnaise to bottom bun, place grilled salmon patty on top, then radicchio slaw and top bun. Serve with your favorite sides.
f3300a18-d7e0-4b81-aec5-4ee51c840b26 Gather the ingredients.
f3300a18-d7e0-4b81-aec5-4ee51c840b26 Place your salmon fillets in a large bowl. In another one, whisk together the soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic powder, ginger powder, and cornstarch in a bowl.
f3300a18-d7e0-4b81-aec5-4ee51c840b26 Add the marinade to the salmon and allow it to sit for at least 20 minutes in the refrigerator. You can marinate overnight if you want to.
f3300a18-d7e0-4b81-aec5-4ee51c840b26 Preheat the oven to 350 F. Place the salmon fillets on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Reserve the leftover marinade. Bake them in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through.
f3300a18-d7e0-4b81-aec5-4ee51c840b26 While the salmon is baking, place the rest of the marinade in a small saucepan and cook on medium heat until it has thickened. Add water if it gets too thick.
f3300a18-d7e0-4b81-aec5-4ee51c840b26 Remove the salmon fillets from the oven and spread the reduced marinade over the top of each piece.
f3300a18-d7e0-4b81-aec5-4ee51c840b26 Top the salmon with the sesame seeds and chopped scallions and serve with hot white rice or noodles.
6e985075-2073-41d4-95fc-8f2d3482f91c Gather your ingredients.
6e985075-2073-41d4-95fc-8f2d3482f91c Start by making the sauce. Put the sugar and water into a non-reactive saucepan, gently bring to a gentle boil stirring all the time. Once boiling, add the ginger, garlic and chilli. Stir and boil to reduce to a thick, glossy sauce. Do not want to walk away while this is happening as the sauce can burn quickly and easily; any slight smell of burning, remove the pan from the heat immediately. Let the pan cool then return to a lower heat to finish the cooking. Once syrupy, add the fish sauce and lime juice. Put to one side.
6e985075-2073-41d4-95fc-8f2d3482f91c Lay the fresh salmon fillets on a sheet of kitchen paper. Check the salmon over for any small bones taking care to remove them. Cut the fillets into 1-inch cubes and place into a bowl. Spoon over the caramel sauce and stir gently. Put to one side while you prepare the salad.
6e985075-2073-41d4-95fc-8f2d3482f91c Place the bean sprouts in a large bowl and pour over a pint of boiling water. Drain and then put to one side. Pick over the herbs and salad leaves to make sure they are clean, place in a large salad bowl and mix thoroughly. Add the chopped onion and the bean sprouts.
6e985075-2073-41d4-95fc-8f2d3482f91c Heat the olive oil in a non-stick frying pan until hot but not smoking. Add the salmon pieces coated in the sauce and fry in the hot oil for five minutes whilst moving the fish pieces around the pan with a spatula to prevent them from sticking and burning. Once cooked remove from the pan and keep warm. Add any remaining marinade to the frying pan, stir well over medium heat to warm through.
6e985075-2073-41d4-95fc-8f2d3482f91c Divide the salad into four bowls, lay the fish on the salad. Lightly crush the peanuts in a pestle and mortar and scatter over the dishes. Spoon the warm sauce over the fish and serve immediately with the lime quarters and rice if desired.
f1cf7591-982c-4cb6-9e58-cea1de2fce1c Cut the salmon into 1-inch pieces. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon of the butter. Add half the salmon and sauté just until the outside turns opaque, about 2 minutes. Remove from the skillet with a slotted spoon, melt the remaining tablespoon of butter, and repeat with the other half of the salmon.
f1cf7591-982c-4cb6-9e58-cea1de2fce1c Over medium-high heat, heat the olive oil in a stockpot or very large saucepan. Add the shallots and sauté until softened, about 3 minutes. Add the broth, increase the heat to high and bring to a simmer.
f1cf7591-982c-4cb6-9e58-cea1de2fce1c Reduce the heat to medium-high and add the potatoes. Partially cover the pot, keep the broth at a simmer, and cook until the potatoes are tender, 12 to 15 minutes.
f1cf7591-982c-4cb6-9e58-cea1de2fce1c In a blender or food processor, combine 1 cup of the corn kernels with the half-and-half, and use a slotted spoon to scoop out about 1/2 cup of cooked potatoes and add those to the blender; puree until smooth.
f1cf7591-982c-4cb6-9e58-cea1de2fce1c Add the pureed mixture, along with the remaining corn kernels, back into the pot, and return to just barely a simmer. Simmer gently for 2 minutes, add the partially cooked salmon and the dill, season with salt and pepper and simmer for another 2 minutes until the salmon is just cooked through. Use the back of the spoon to break up the salmon into smaller chunks. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed and serve hot, with whatever garnishes you like.
d5531da8-800b-4760-b95b-16f2717d1d36 Gather the ingredients.
d5531da8-800b-4760-b95b-16f2717d1d36 Turn the salmon and liquid into a medium-size bowl. Flake the salmon with a fork, removing any skin and bones. Smaller bones are edible and may be mashed. Add the grated onion, parsley, and pepper; blend thoroughly.
d5531da8-800b-4760-b95b-16f2717d1d36 Add the beaten eggs and blend well. Add enough breadcrumbs, about 1/2 to 3/4 cup, to make the mixture thick enough to shape into about 12 small patties.
d5531da8-800b-4760-b95b-16f2717d1d36 Roll the patties in the remaining breadcrumbs to coat thoroughly.
d5531da8-800b-4760-b95b-16f2717d1d36 In a large heavy skillet or sauté pan over low heat, melt 2 tablespoons of butter. When the butter is hot, add the salmon patties. Fry patties slowly on one side until browned. Add the remaining butter, turn the patties, and fry them until browned on the other side.
d5531da8-800b-4760-b95b-16f2717d1d36 Serve and enjoy!
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 Gather your ingredients.
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 Lay the salmon fillets on a piece of paper towel and dry carefully. Check the fish over for any bones (just in case). Remove with tweezers if you find any. Lay the fillets side by side in a glass or ceramic dish and put it to one side.
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 Combine the maple syrup, lemon juice, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger and mix thoroughly in a jug. Add the chili flakes and stir again.
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 Pour the marinade over the salmon. Cover and put to one side, but not in the refrigerator, for 20 minutes. Turn after 10 minutes, so all sides of the fillets come into contact with the marinade.
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 Heat a griddle or cast-iron frying pan with the oil until hot, but not smoking.
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 Take the fillets one at a time from the marinade and pop into the pan, taking care as this may sizzle and splash. Keep the heat high for 2 minutes after all the fillets are in the pan.
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 Reduce the heat to medium and cook the fillets for 4 minutes.
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 Then flip over and cook for a further 4. Remove from the pan and keep warm.
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 While the salmon is cooking, put the marinade into a small saucepan and bring to a gentle boil. Reduce to create a thick, syrupy sauce, then strain into a little jug.
690879f8-37d4-41a5-b24f-be9845077e58 Serve this hot, tasty salmon over brown or wild rice, or a bed of nutty grains with green vegetables, and the sauce on the side. The cold salmon is also super-delicious when cold and flaked onto a salad, or even stirred through pasta.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d Gather the ingredients.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the salmon fillet and reduce the heat to low.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d Cook, turning once, until the salmon is just cooked through; about 5 minutes on each side. The salmon's internal temperature should be at least 145 F.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d Remove the salmon from the saucepan and cool. Flake the salmon into small pieces.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d In a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese using a hand mixer until soft and fluffy.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d Gradually add the mayonnaise and lemon juice and beat well.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d Stir in the mustard, salt, pepper, and thyme.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d Fold in the flaked salmon.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours to blend the flavors.
0cb53b68-d507-4f49-af0e-d55d166ef29d Serve with crackers, fresh vegetables, or toasted French bread.
d7a277f6-4faa-493b-ac51-67a885e313f9 Gather your ingredients.
d7a277f6-4faa-493b-ac51-67a885e313f9 Lay the vegetables and fish on your greased sheet pan. Preheat the oven to 425 F.
d7a277f6-4faa-493b-ac51-67a885e313f9 Whisk together all of the other ingredients in a small bowl.
d7a277f6-4faa-493b-ac51-67a885e313f9 Drizzle half of the sauce over the top of the salmon and veggies. Use a brush to brush the sauce over the salmon too.
d7a277f6-4faa-493b-ac51-67a885e313f9 Bake the salmon in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes. While it is baking add the rest of the sauce to a saucepan and cook it on medium heat, whisk frequently until it has thickened, about 3 minutes.
d7a277f6-4faa-493b-ac51-67a885e313f9 Remove the sheet pan from the oven and pour the remainder of the sauce over the top of the salmon and veggies.
d7a277f6-4faa-493b-ac51-67a885e313f9 Garnish with the sesame seeds and dig in!
4b5d2d45-f6df-4559-803e-ba5b59e0f216 Gather the ingredients.
4b5d2d45-f6df-4559-803e-ba5b59e0f216 Preheat the oven to 500°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil, and spray with nonstick cooking spray.
4b5d2d45-f6df-4559-803e-ba5b59e0f216 In a container or dish large enough to hold the salmon combine the Ponzu sauce, sesame oil, and ginger syrup, and stir to combine. Place the salmon in the marinade, turn to coat well, and marinate at room temperature for 15 to 20 minutes, skin side up if your salmon has skin on it.
4b5d2d45-f6df-4559-803e-ba5b59e0f216 Roast the salmon for about 10 minutes, until it is cooked through and the top has a nice brown sheen. Serve hot, over rice
2de0ece2-cdf0-4697-a214-c7c626196018 Place a 2/3 cup of cooked rice in a small rice bowl. If using leftover rice, reheat the rice in the microwave first.
2de0ece2-cdf0-4697-a214-c7c626196018 Add a 1/4 cup of grilled salmon and desired garnishes.
2de0ece2-cdf0-4697-a214-c7c626196018 Pour a 1/2 to 2/3 cup of hot brewed green tea over the rice, salmon, and garnishes.
13870b5a-67a9-496a-92e0-0d783c484407 Rinse the salmon head halves and pat dry. Pry or scape off as much of the scales as you can without damaging the skin.
13870b5a-67a9-496a-92e0-0d783c484407 Heat the cooking oil in a wide frying pan.
13870b5a-67a9-496a-92e0-0d783c484407 Saute the shallots, garlic, ginger, tomato and chilis with a little fish sauce, until fragrant and softened, about two minutes.
13870b5a-67a9-496a-92e0-0d783c484407 Stir in the curry paste.
13870b5a-67a9-496a-92e0-0d783c484407 Pour in the coconut milk. Season with more fish sauce. Bring to the boil.
13870b5a-67a9-496a-92e0-0d783c484407 Lower the fish head halves into the sauce. Ladle some of the sauce over them
13870b5a-67a9-496a-92e0-0d783c484407 Cover the pan, lower the heat and simmer for 12 to 15 minutes or just until done. Taste the sauce occasionally and add more fish sauce, if needed.
13870b5a-67a9-496a-92e0-0d783c484407 Scoop out the fish head halves and transfer to a shallow bowl (or two shallow bowls). Pour the sauce over them. Garnish with fried onion slices, toasted garlic and snipped cilantro before serving.
97c26785-7e17-4a75-89ae-a0a4b6cc51f5 Cut the smoked salmon into small pieces and set aside. Use a sharp knife or kitchen shears.
97c26785-7e17-4a75-89ae-a0a4b6cc51f5 In a large bowl, beat the eggs with cream, salt, and pepper until combined.
97c26785-7e17-4a75-89ae-a0a4b6cc51f5 In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
97c26785-7e17-4a75-89ae-a0a4b6cc51f5 Add the egg mixture to the skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally with a heatproof spatula until the eggs are almost cooked but still shiny and moist. Scrape the bottom of the skillet with the spatula and turn the eggs over as they cook. This should take about 6 to 7 minutes for 12 eggs.
97c26785-7e17-4a75-89ae-a0a4b6cc51f5 Stir the salmon into the eggs; cook for another minute or two until the eggs are cooked to 160 F. Serve immediately.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Gather the ingredients.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Whisk together the garlic, 3 tablespoons of the extra-virgin olive oil, honey, turmeric, kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Season the salmon fillets with kosher salt and freshly ground pepper and place in a bowl.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Halve the marinade. Set one half aside. Use a pastry brush to coat the salmon fillets. Pour the excess marinade on top of the salmon fillets and gently toss to coat. Let the marinated salmon stand 15 minutes.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Preheat the oven to 400 F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Drain the can of beets. Use a heart cutter, if you like, to create heart shapes. Reserve the scraps for future use in salads, etc. or discard. You may want to use kitchen gloves when handling the beets to prevent staining your hands.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Peel the red onions and cut into rings.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Place the beet slices or hearts and the raw red onion rings in a bowl.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Pour the other half of the marinade over the beets and onions and toss to coat. Let stand 10 minutes.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Transfer the beets and onions to the baking sheet. Spread them out on the parchment paper and bake for 25 minutes.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 In the meantime, cut the blood orange in half. Cut each half into thin round slices, then cut the round slices in half.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Heat the remaining extra-virgin olive oil in a medium sides skillet over high heat. Add the marinated salmon fillets and reserve the marinade in the bowl. Sear the salmon pieces on both sides.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Remove the marinated roasted beets and onions from the oven. Lay the salmon on the baking sheet on top of the beets and onions. Pour the rest of the marinade over the top and bake for another 10 to 12 minutes, until the salmon has cooked through.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Roughly chop the almonds and place them in a naked frying pan over medium heat. Stir them around until they are lightly toasted. This happens fast so do not turn your back on the pan or get distracted. Remove and set aside.
aae65034-f244-45cc-abd7-d3188dcaaec3 Remove the salmon from oven, transfer everything to a serving platter, garnish with the toasted almonds and oranges. Tuck the cilantro leaves around the platter and serve.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Gather the ingredients.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Cut salmon into serving pieces.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Salt the salmon lightly and set it out at room temperature for 15 to 20 minutes before cooking.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Fire up the grill. Make sure the surface is clean. Get some vegetable oil ready to wipe on the grill later.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a After 15 to 20 minutes of setting out, pat the salmon dry and then use a butter knife to scrape the skin side to get any moisture or scales off. This makes the skin side drier so it will not stick to the grill.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Coat the salmon with oil.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a When the fire is good and hot, wipe down the grate with a paper towel that has been dipped in the oil.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Put the salmon on the grill skin side up. It seems counterintuitive, but do it anyway because you want a good sear on the fish, and you cannot do this well if you start skin-side down; the fish will cook too much and will fall apart when you try to flip it. The uncooked skin helps hold things together.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Leave the salmon on the grill for a solid 4 to 6 minutes, depending on thickness. A thin sockeye fillet might need closer to 3 minutes on one side. You will know it is ready when you can slide a spatula underneath the salmon. It might stick in one or two spots, but it should be mostly crusted over.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Gently flip the salmon onto the skin side and leave it again for at least 3 minutes, a bit longer if it is on the thick side. Exactly how long depends on thickness, but it'll never be less than 2 minutes on high heat. Watch the fish, and if the flakes begin to separate, you're done.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Take the salmon off the heat, sprinkle lemon juice on it, then let it rest for 2 to 3 minutes.
8a117ab3-844f-4491-96d3-5d96481ebb9a Serve with your favorite sauce.
02eb05e5-ddf2-4c63-b1a2-f701465fdfa1 Gather the ingredients.
02eb05e5-ddf2-4c63-b1a2-f701465fdfa1 Cut the salmon fillet into two halves cutting across the piece.
02eb05e5-ddf2-4c63-b1a2-f701465fdfa1 In a bowl, mix the sugar, salt, peppercorns, chili (if using), juniper berries, and dill.
02eb05e5-ddf2-4c63-b1a2-f701465fdfa1 Place one half of the salmon, skin side down, onto a long sheet of plastic wrap. Cover the flesh of the salmon with the sugar, salt, and pepper mix. Place the second fillet flesh side down on top to create a "salmon sandwich". Wrap the fish pieces tightly in the plastic wrap.
02eb05e5-ddf2-4c63-b1a2-f701465fdfa1 Put the "salmon sandwich" into a shallow baking dish, making sure the fish stands higher than the sides of the pan. Place a baking tray on top of the salmon and weigh it down with any heavy object, like canned beans, rice bags, or heavy books (covered in plastic wrap to avoid passing on fish smells).
02eb05e5-ddf2-4c63-b1a2-f701465fdfa1 Put the fish into the refrigerator and leave it to cure for 3 to 4 days, turning the salmon twice a day or at least once every day. If there is any accumulated liquid, pour it out and change the plastic wrap.
02eb05e5-ddf2-4c63-b1a2-f701465fdfa1 When ready to serve, remove the wrap, pour away any liquid and wipe away most of the sugar, salt, and peppercorns, leaving a little on the edges for decoration. Slice as desired: thin for bagels, thick if it's meant to be a main course.
02eb05e5-ddf2-4c63-b1a2-f701465fdfa1 The lox will keep well in the refrigerator for five days. If you bought frozen salmon or froze it before curing, do not refreeze.
02eb05e5-ddf2-4c63-b1a2-f701465fdfa1 Enjoy!
afd96b8f-4ea8-4a06-a833-4030608a54d7 Steam rice according to your rice cooker's instructions or on the stovetop.
afd96b8f-4ea8-4a06-a833-4030608a54d7 While the rice is cooking, boil green beans and slice on the diagonal into bite-sized pieces. Set aside.
afd96b8f-4ea8-4a06-a833-4030608a54d7 In a small bowl scramble eggs and add a pinch of salt. Heat medium size pan with olive oil and cook a thin layer of egg to make kinshi tamago (thin omelet). Remove from pan and let cool on cutting board. Cut into thin strips and set aside.
afd96b8f-4ea8-4a06-a833-4030608a54d7 Boil a small pot of water to cook the baby broccolini.
afd96b8f-4ea8-4a06-a833-4030608a54d7 Thaw cooked frozen shrimp, remove tails if desired, and then slice in half vertically to create 6 halved pieces of shrimp. Set aside.
afd96b8f-4ea8-4a06-a833-4030608a54d7 Mix in sushi rice vinegar powder with cooked rice. You may or may not use all of the cooked rice, as it will depend on how thick you make your rice layers, as well as the diameter of the cake pan. Be sure to use diagonal cutting motions with the side edge of the rice paddle (pre-moistened with water) to mix with the warm rice. This helps to prevent the rice from getting mashed.
afd96b8f-4ea8-4a06-a833-4030608a54d7 Line cake pan with a large sheet of plastic wrap. It will help you to remove the sushi with ease. If you are using a springform pan (with removable bottom), there's no need to line the pan with plastic wrap, but instead, make sure the pan is wet with water, to prevent the rice from sticking too much from the side of the pan.
afd96b8f-4ea8-4a06-a833-4030608a54d7 Add a layer of rice on the bottom of the pan. Top with pink sakura denbu shredded codfish. Layer more rice on top and then garnish with sliced green beans. Layer with the last layer of rice. Garnish top with thinly sliced egg, baby broccolini, shrimp, ikura (salmon roe caviar), and any optional garnishes.
afd96b8f-4ea8-4a06-a833-4030608a54d7 Remove from pan onto a plate and serve immediately.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 Gather the ingredients.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 Heat oven to 375 F.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 Lightly grease a 9-by-13-by-2-inch baking pan or line the pan with foil and lightly oil the foil.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 In a small bowl, combine the minced garlic, olive oil, and parsley. Blend the ingredients well.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 Arrange the salmon fillets in the prepared baking pan and spread the garlic and parsley mixture evenly over them. Sprinkle the fillets lightly with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 Bake the salmon for about 20 minutes, or until the fillets register 145 F or flake easily with a fork.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 Meanwhile, juice one of the lemons.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 Drizzle the baked salmon fillets with 2 tablespoons of lemon juice.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 Slice the remaining lemon into wedges and serve them with the salmon.
192b9cef-89b6-4e89-b290-57e584839c37 Enjoy!
e7d5a1a1-1129-4952-b132-ba5359c3c97b Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the pasta as directed on the package. Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a large skillet until crisp. Drain the bacon on paper towels and crumble; set aside. Discard the bacon fat.
e7d5a1a1-1129-4952-b132-ba5359c3c97b In a small bowl beat together the egg yolks with the cream; season with the salt and pepper. Set aside.
e7d5a1a1-1129-4952-b132-ba5359c3c97b In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over low heat and add the salmon, peas, and cooked bacon; gently heat. Shake the pan from time to time, so the food doesn't stick.
e7d5a1a1-1129-4952-b132-ba5359c3c97b When the pasta is done, drain well and add immediately to the skillet with the salmon; do not stir.
e7d5a1a1-1129-4952-b132-ba5359c3c97b Immediately pour the egg mixture over the hot pasta. Turn the heat under the skillet to medium. Using tongs, gently lift and turn the pasta, egg mixture, salmon, peas, and bacon together until creamy sauce forms on the pasta. The egg will cook on contact with hot pasta. Sprinkle the food with the cheese and toss gently. Serve immediately.
54b0fbec-9419-4b86-9523-7bbd6f9864ef Place salt, brown sugar, soy sauce, and water into a pot. Next, bring that to a boil and stir until the sugar has dissolved. Remove the pot from heat and let cool to room temperature.
54b0fbec-9419-4b86-9523-7bbd6f9864ef Slice the salmon lengthwise (not across the width) into strips 1/4- to 1/2-inch thick. Place the salmon strips in the cooled brine and refrigerate for 8 to 10 hours to marinate.
54b0fbec-9419-4b86-9523-7bbd6f9864ef Drain the brine. Rinse the salmon with clean water and let drain. Pat dry with paper towels.
54b0fbec-9419-4b86-9523-7bbd6f9864ef Spray dehydrator racks with vegetable oil. Place salmon strips on racks, not touching each other so air can circulate. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper to taste. Dry to the desired doneness according to dehydrator manufacturer's recommendations.
54b0fbec-9419-4b86-9523-7bbd6f9864ef The salmon jerky may also be dried in the oven on its lowest setting or in a smoker. The drying time could take 8 hours or more, depending on the method and how dry you like the jerky.
54b0fbec-9419-4b86-9523-7bbd6f9864ef Store salmon jerky in an airtight container or ziptop bag.
41440982-f72b-4585-860b-d2f5c414c3ca Grease a 9-by-13-by-2-inch baking pan.
41440982-f72b-4585-860b-d2f5c414c3ca Heat oven to 400 F/200 C/Gas 6.
41440982-f72b-4585-860b-d2f5c414c3ca Place the salmon fillets, skin-side down, in the prepared baking pan.
41440982-f72b-4585-860b-d2f5c414c3ca Combine the honey, lime juice, and orange juice; stir until well blended.
41440982-f72b-4585-860b-d2f5c414c3ca Sprinkle the salmon fillets with salt and pepper then spoon the honey and juice mixture over the fillets.
41440982-f72b-4585-860b-d2f5c414c3ca Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
e7d56a70-b821-4f93-95ca-c851d45e58b4 Gather the ingredients.
e7d56a70-b821-4f93-95ca-c851d45e58b4 Cut each nori sheet (if using) into 8 to 9 strips and put about a 1/2 cup of steamed rice in a rice bowl.
e7d56a70-b821-4f93-95ca-c851d45e58b4 Wet your hands with water so that the rice won't stick.
e7d56a70-b821-4f93-95ca-c851d45e58b4 Rub some salt on your wet hands.
e7d56a70-b821-4f93-95ca-c851d45e58b4 Place the steamed rice in your hand and form into a triangle, making sure it is dense and thick.
e7d56a70-b821-4f93-95ca-c851d45e58b4 Put your favorite filling, such as umeboshi or grilled salmon, on the rice and push the filling into the rice lightly.
e7d56a70-b821-4f93-95ca-c851d45e58b4 Hold the rice between your palms.
e7d56a70-b821-4f93-95ca-c851d45e58b4 Form the rice into a round, a triangle, or a cylinder by pressing lightly with your both palms, securing the filling in the middle. Roll the rice ball in your hands a few times, pressing lightly.
e7d56a70-b821-4f93-95ca-c851d45e58b4 Wrap the rice ball with a strip or two of nori (if using), or sprinkle some sesame seeds on them (if using).
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Gather the ingredients.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Heat the oven to 350 F/180 C/Gas 4. Butter the bottom of a shallow baking dish.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Arrange the salmon steaks or fillets in the buttered baking dish.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice and onion.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Sprinkle about 2 teaspoons of the lemon-onion mixture over each piece of salmon. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Bake, uncovered, for about 20 minutes (about 15 minutes for fillets), or until fish flakes easily with a fork or a minimum of 145 F.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Remove from oven and spread sour cream over salmon pieces.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Sprinkle with lemon zest and dill.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Return to the oven for 3 minutes.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Serve the salmon hot with lemon wedges.
c3e52cdb-50fb-4f10-aaea-fa36849777e6 Enjoy!
e764a2de-08d6-4ef7-ac80-5c3744921e8f Separate the salmon into individual slices. Heat butter in a medium skillet and sauté the salmon until it is done, turning once, for just a minute or so. You can skip this step if you prefer to use the salmon uncooked. Break the salmon into pieces. If you aren't cooking the salmon, cut it into pieces with a sharp knife.
e764a2de-08d6-4ef7-ac80-5c3744921e8f In a medium bowl, beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until soft and fluffy. Beat in mayonnaise until smooth.
e764a2de-08d6-4ef7-ac80-5c3744921e8f Stir in the salmon and dried basil.
e764a2de-08d6-4ef7-ac80-5c3744921e8f Make sandwiches with the salmon filling, the whole basil leaves, and croissants. Serve immediately.
e764a2de-08d6-4ef7-ac80-5c3744921e8f You can make the filling ahead of time; just cover it well and store it in the refrigerator up to 3 days. Use it when you want as a sandwich filling or for a snack with crackers.
9416f72b-4e32-4a75-b033-55f46a72e080 In a small mixing bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of brown sugar, spices, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, 1/8 teaspoon of pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon of grated orange rind. Mix until well combined.
9416f72b-4e32-4a75-b033-55f46a72e080 Rinse the salmon fillets and pat dry. Arrange the fillets skin-side-down on a baking sheet or a large dish. Divide the brown sugar-spice mixture amongst the four fillets, sprinkling the mixture evenly over top each.
9416f72b-4e32-4a75-b033-55f46a72e080 Squeeze juice from one orange over the salmon fillets. Set aside to marinate while the grill is pre-heating.
9416f72b-4e32-4a75-b033-55f46a72e080 Heat the grill over medium-high heat. Brush the grill grates with vegetable or canola oil. When the grill is hot, place the fillets skin-side-down on the grill grates.
9416f72b-4e32-4a75-b033-55f46a72e080 Cover and cook for 8 to 10 minutes for 1-inch fillets. If fillets are thicker than 1-inch, cook for additional 8 minutes, or until salmon flesh easily flakes apart.
9416f72b-4e32-4a75-b033-55f46a72e080 With a spatula, remove just the cooked salmon portion from the grill, leaving the skin on the grill or removing the skin and setting it aside once salmon is placed on a clean dish.
9416f72b-4e32-4a75-b033-55f46a72e080 Serve salmon immediately.
077c7213-50ce-49a9-aff1-805150a73d7b Place the salmon and cracker crumbs in a large bowl. Set aside.
077c7213-50ce-49a9-aff1-805150a73d7b In a heavy skillet over medium heat, cook onion and red bell pepper until tender in 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.
077c7213-50ce-49a9-aff1-805150a73d7b Add the cooked vegetables to the salmon and cracker crumbs in a bowl and mix gently. Add dill weed, egg, and lemon juice and mix gently.
077c7213-50ce-49a9-aff1-805150a73d7b Form the salmon mixture into four patties using your hands. At this point, you can cover the patties and refrigerate for a couple of hours before you finish cooking them.
077c7213-50ce-49a9-aff1-805150a73d7b When you are ready to cook, add the remaining olive oil and tablespoon of butter to the same skillet over medium heat.
077c7213-50ce-49a9-aff1-805150a73d7b Once the butter has melted, add the cold salmon patties to the skillet. Cook the patties for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until golden brown and hot. Serve immediately.
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Gather the ingredients.
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Heat the oven to 190 C/375 F/Gas 5
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Place the flour and salt into the bowl of a food processor. Add the butter and 2 tbsp of cold water. Pulse mix until all the ingredients are incorporated into a dough, add more water a tsp at a time if the mixture doesnt stick together and pulse again. Wrap in plastic wrap and rest in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Butter a 25cm/10-inch loose-bottomed tart tin. Unwrap the pastry, roll and line the tart dish making sure it is even on the bottom and sides and there are no holes. Prick the base of the dish using a fork. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Cover the pastry with baking parchment and fill with baking beans, or use long grain rice. Bake for 35 minutes in the preheated oven, remove the parchment and beans or rice and bake for a further 10 minutes until the crust is golden. Leave until completely cold.
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Lower the oven to 175 C/350 F/gas mark 4.
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Cut the broccoli into pieces, so that each floret end is about 7 to 8 cm in length. Roughly chop the stalk pieces. Cook all the broccoli in boiling water for 4 minutes, refresh under cold water and set aside.
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Mix the eggs, egg yolks, cream, spring onions, and parsley. Season with pepper and a little salt, if liked (the smoked salmon may add enough salt to your taste).
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Arrange the smoked salmon and the chopped broccoli stalks in the baked pastry case. Pour the egg and cream mixture over. Arrange the floret end pieces of Tenderstem broccoli in the tart like the spokes of a wheel, with the florets around the edge of the tart.
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Bake the tart in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes or until golden brown on top and just set.
a977bbb5-4c68-4dce-ba4b-8d9a7298d85d Serve the tart with a crisp green salad with a lemony dressing.
8ed90176-b523-4a21-92f1-127162dc1f99 Gather the ingredients.
8ed90176-b523-4a21-92f1-127162dc1f99 Place all marinade ingredients in a food processor or mini chopper. Process well to create a fragrant Thai spice paste (a pestle & mortar can also be used to make this paste).
8ed90176-b523-4a21-92f1-127162dc1f99 Rinse salmon pieces and pat dry. Place a bowl and slather the marinade/paste all over the fish, ensuring all surfaces are covered. Marinate 10 minutes or up to 24 hours.
8ed90176-b523-4a21-92f1-127162dc1f99 To make the side sauce, simply combine everything together in a cup, stirring well to dissolve the sugar. Then taste-test it, looking for a tangy flavor that is a balance between sweet, sour, spicy and salty. Add more lime juice if too salty or sweet for your taste. If too spicy, add more coconut milk. Set aside.
8ed90176-b523-4a21-92f1-127162dc1f99 Heat up your grill and brush with a little vegetable oil. Grill the salmon, allowing each piece to cook several minutes before disturbing/turning (this will prevent the flesh from tearing). Baste the first time you turn it with some of the leftover marinades. Salmon is cooked when inner flesh is no longer translucent.
8ed90176-b523-4a21-92f1-127162dc1f99 Serve the salmon with rice or salad, plus the sauce on the side (this sauce is usually served at room temperature). An easy salad that goes beautifully with this dish is Easy Thai Cucumber Salad.
8ed90176-b523-4a21-92f1-127162dc1f99 Enjoy!
ff148aea-28b7-4e16-b8c7-dd05832c4f9c Gather the ingredients.
ff148aea-28b7-4e16-b8c7-dd05832c4f9c Place salmon on a broiler rack that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.
ff148aea-28b7-4e16-b8c7-dd05832c4f9c In a small bowl, combine 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 2 tablespoons melted butter, salt, and pepper. Brush over salmon and set aside.
ff148aea-28b7-4e16-b8c7-dd05832c4f9c In a large saucepan, melt 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, about 6 to 7 minutes.
ff148aea-28b7-4e16-b8c7-dd05832c4f9c Add cranberries, brown sugar, granulated sugar, currant jelly, orange juice, and 2 tablespoons lemon juice to the onion mixture in the saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to low.
ff148aea-28b7-4e16-b8c7-dd05832c4f9c Simmer the sauce for 15 to 20 minutes until cranberries pop and sauce thickens. Remove from heat.
ff148aea-28b7-4e16-b8c7-dd05832c4f9c Preheat broiler.
ff148aea-28b7-4e16-b8c7-dd05832c4f9c Broil salmon 4 to 5 inches from the heat for 8 to 10 minutes, or until fish flakes when a fork is inserted and twisted.
ff148aea-28b7-4e16-b8c7-dd05832c4f9c Serve fish with sauce. Enjoy!
3a22042c-c463-4747-877d-866991aa5c88 Gather the ingredients.
3a22042c-c463-4747-877d-866991aa5c88 Soak the cedar plank in water for at least 30 minutes and up to four hours before you start the grill.
3a22042c-c463-4747-877d-866991aa5c88 Preheat the grill for medium-high heat.
3a22042c-c463-4747-877d-866991aa5c88 Remove the cedar plank from the water and place the salmon fillet in the middle of it, skin-side down. Brush the top of the salmon fillet with olive oil; squeeze the lemon juice over the salmon. Scatter the lemon zest and the dill on top, then season the fillet to taste with the salt and pepper.
3a22042c-c463-4747-877d-866991aa5c88 Place the plank on the grill in the center. Cover the grill and allow the salmon to cook, undisturbed, for about 20 minutes.
3a22042c-c463-4747-877d-866991aa5c88 Test the internal temperature at the thickest part of the fillet with an instant-read or meat thermometer. Pull it off to rest at about 138 to 140 F; the USDA recommends cooking salmon to an internal temperature of 145 F, but the temperature will continue to rise another 5 to 10 degrees after you pull it off the grill. Let it rest for 5 to 10 minutes before you serve it.
3a22042c-c463-4747-877d-866991aa5c88 Serve with your favorite sides and enjoy!
e29c8e24-62ba-4301-b523-8a47833175cd Gather the ingredients.
e29c8e24-62ba-4301-b523-8a47833175cd Heat butter over medium-low heat. Add celery, carrot, and onion and sauté, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes, until celery is tender.
e29c8e24-62ba-4301-b523-8a47833175cd Stir in the flour until well blended.
e29c8e24-62ba-4301-b523-8a47833175cd Stir in chicken broth and add potatoes. Bring to a simmer, stirring frequently.
e29c8e24-62ba-4301-b523-8a47833175cd Cover and simmer, stirring frequently, for 15 to 18 minutes, or until potatoes and carrots are tender.
e29c8e24-62ba-4301-b523-8a47833175cd Add the salmon and peas; cook, stirring, for 2 to 4 minutes, or until the peas are tender.
e29c8e24-62ba-4301-b523-8a47833175cd Add half-and-half or milk, along with the cheese and parsley. Taste test and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
e29c8e24-62ba-4301-b523-8a47833175cd Cook while stirring until cheese is melted and the soup just begins to bubble.
e29c8e24-62ba-4301-b523-8a47833175cd Serve in a bowl with some crackers and enjoy!
6e510284-2771-4c3b-a9ba-153bfde64b30 Briefly rinse salmon fillets or steaks under cool water. Shake off excess or pat dry and place pieces in a flat-bottomed baking dish (you will need a lid or foil to cover it).
6e510284-2771-4c3b-a9ba-153bfde64b30 In a separate bowl or container, combine the hoisin sauce, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, and chili flakes. Stir well to dissolve the honey. Add garlic and white parts of the green onion (save the green parts for serving).
6e510284-2771-4c3b-a9ba-153bfde64b30 Pour over salmon, turning pieces to saturate. Cover and allow to marinate in your refrigerator 30 minutes or up to 2 hours. When getting close to your desired cooking time, preheat oven to 350 F.
6e510284-2771-4c3b-a9ba-153bfde64b30 Spoon a little more sauce over each piece, then recover and bake at 350 F for 20 minutes, or until sauce is lightly bubbling and inner flesh of salmon has turned from translucent to opaque. If undercooked, cover and return salmon to the oven for another 5 to 10 minutes.
6e510284-2771-4c3b-a9ba-153bfde64b30 Remove from oven and taste-test the sauce, looking for the following flavors: sweet followed by sour, then spicy. If too sweet or too salty for your taste, add a few more squeezes of lime juice. If not sweet enough, add a little more honey. More chili can also be added.
6e510284-2771-4c3b-a9ba-153bfde64b30 Serve salmon with some of the sauce spooned over each piece, topping with a sprinkling of the reserved green onion.
3cb341e3-9c27-4401-9451-6668bae85b5c Gather the ingredients.
3cb341e3-9c27-4401-9451-6668bae85b5c Preheat the oven to 450 F. Line a baking sheet or baking pan with heavy-duty aluminum foil.
3cb341e3-9c27-4401-9451-6668bae85b5c Place the fillets on the prepared pan. Brush the salmon with the olive oil and sprinkle with the seasonings.
3cb341e3-9c27-4401-9451-6668bae85b5c Roast the fish for 8 to 10 minutes, then turn off the heat and let the fish sit in the closed oven for 3 to 5 minutes longer. Aim for an internal temperature of 125 to 130 F (measured with a meat thermometer) in order to prevent overcooking and drying out the salmon.
3cb341e3-9c27-4401-9451-6668bae85b5c Allow the fillets to rest, covered, for 5 minutes, before serving.
7ff92d02-5007-4fc0-9903-b02701d391b6 Coat the salmon in the vegetable oil and salt generously.
7ff92d02-5007-4fc0-9903-b02701d391b6 Get the grill good and hot, and make sure the grates are clean.
7ff92d02-5007-4fc0-9903-b02701d391b6 Cut the stick of butter into pieces and heat over medium heat in a small pot.
7ff92d02-5007-4fc0-9903-b02701d391b6 Lay the salmon down on the grill, skin facing up. Don't move it for at least 3 minutes, even for a thin sockeye fillet. For a big slab of king salmon, you might need 6 minutes. Watch the sides of the fish -- you want to see it turn opaque almost halfway up before you flip the fish. Test before flipping: The salmon might stick in a few places, but most of it should come right up when you try to flip with a spatula. Dislodge the sticky spots before you flip.
7ff92d02-5007-4fc0-9903-b02701d391b6 While the salmon is grilling, fry the sage leaves whole in the butter. When they're almost done sizzling, remove and let drain on paper towels. Add the thyme and parsley and turn off the heat.
7ff92d02-5007-4fc0-9903-b02701d391b6 Flip the salmon onto the skin side and cook for 2-5 minutes.
7ff92d02-5007-4fc0-9903-b02701d391b6 Get the plates ready by placing a bed of salad greens onto them. I prefer a mix of baby greens, like mesclun mix.
7ff92d02-5007-4fc0-9903-b02701d391b6 To serve, lay a piece of salmon onto each plate -- whichever side looks better, skin or meat. Pour some of the herb butter over the salmon and top with a fried sage leaf or two. Serve with the lemon wedges.
617d56e8-2f15-4cd4-b25e-612abecfdad7 Gather the ingredients.
617d56e8-2f15-4cd4-b25e-612abecfdad7 In a large pot filled with boiling, salted water, cook the pasta according to the package directions. Place the frozen peas in the colander, then drain and rinse the pasta (it will simultaneously thaw the peas). Shake well to remove excess water.
617d56e8-2f15-4cd4-b25e-612abecfdad7 In a medium mixing bowl, add the mayonnaise, yogurt, honey mustard, lemon juice, chives, paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix the dressing well and adjust to taste.
617d56e8-2f15-4cd4-b25e-612abecfdad7 Assemble the salad in the serving bowl you intend to use. Add the pasta and peas, then the salmon, bell pepper, and Havarti cheese. Top with the dressing.
617d56e8-2f15-4cd4-b25e-612abecfdad7 Gently toss to combine. Cover and chill for at least 1 or 2 hours in the refrigerator.
617d56e8-2f15-4cd4-b25e-612abecfdad7 Serve and enjoy!
6bd87a21-763a-483e-8222-4ad8cc457b32 Evenly spread shio koji on both sides of the salmon filets.
6bd87a21-763a-483e-8222-4ad8cc457b32 Store in a re-sealable plastic bag or (non-reactive) glass or plastic container.
6bd87a21-763a-483e-8222-4ad8cc457b32 Marinate a minimum of 30 minutes or up to four hours. Salmon can also be marinated overnight.
6bd87a21-763a-483e-8222-4ad8cc457b32 Prepare a baking sheet by lining it with foil and then placing a metal broiler rack on top.
6bd87a21-763a-483e-8222-4ad8cc457b32 Spray the broiler rack with cooking spray to prevent the fish from sticking.
6bd87a21-763a-483e-8222-4ad8cc457b32 Set the oven to broil on high and grill the fish for 6 to 8 minutes on one side.
6bd87a21-763a-483e-8222-4ad8cc457b32 Turn fish over and broil an additional 3 minutes until cooked through. Time may vary slightly depending on the thickness of the filets.
d1a597e5-2a46-4b13-b0ce-8dd549b14a2b Peel and finely chop the onion. Rinse the green peppers and remove the stems, seeds and veins. Finely chop parsley. Peel the garlic, but leave whole.
d1a597e5-2a46-4b13-b0ce-8dd549b14a2b Rinse and pat dry the salmon steaks. Place them in a glass baking dish, squeeze lemon juice over them and sprinkle with salt. Set aside to marinate in the juice for about 10 minutes.
d1a597e5-2a46-4b13-b0ce-8dd549b14a2b While the salmon is marinating, pour 2 to 3 tablespoons olive oil into a medium-size frying pan and heat on medium-low heat. Sauté the peppers and onions, stirring often until soft. Pour in the white wine and fish stock. Reduce the heat to low and add the chopped parsley. Using a stick blender, blend the vegetables and liquid into a smooth sauce. Remove from heat. Alternatively, you can use a standing blender.
d1a597e5-2a46-4b13-b0ce-8dd549b14a2b In a medium frying pan, heat approximately 2 tablespoons olive oil on medium. Brown the peeled garlic cloves in the oil and remove. Cook the salmon on both sides in the same olive oil, adding more oil if necessary.
d1a597e5-2a46-4b13-b0ce-8dd549b14a2b Ladle green sauce onto plates and place salmon steak on top. Serve each steak with a clove of garlic and garnish with a lemon wedge and parsley sprig if desired. Serve with rice or fried potatoes.
6e77801f-381c-4ee4-9b1c-a7f5da9955be Combine all ingredients except the salmon.
6e77801f-381c-4ee4-9b1c-a7f5da9955be Lay salmon fillets out on a tray or baking sheet. Top with the butter-rum mixture, spreading it evenly over salmon. Let sit for about 15 to 30 minutes.
6e77801f-381c-4ee4-9b1c-a7f5da9955be Preheat grill and prepare for indirect grilling. This recipe works particularly well with a charcoal grill.
6e77801f-381c-4ee4-9b1c-a7f5da9955be When grill is ready, gently place salmon fillets over the unheated part (indirect) of the grill. Keep the grill on low heat. You can add soaked mesquite chips for an extra smoky flavor. Close the lid and let salmon grill for 30 to 45 minutes depending on thickness.
6e77801f-381c-4ee4-9b1c-a7f5da9955be Check for doneness by flaking apart the fish at the thickest part. Cooked salmon flakes easily and evenly. The color should be light pink without any shine.
759d8dc0-bc61-4c92-b726-b23e5ba943b3 Preheat the broiler and coat pan with cooking spray.
759d8dc0-bc61-4c92-b726-b23e5ba943b3 Brush soy honey glaze on the flesh of salmon and let stand 15 minutes.
759d8dc0-bc61-4c92-b726-b23e5ba943b3 Place salmon on a pan with skin side down, drizzling any remaining sauce over fish.
759d8dc0-bc61-4c92-b726-b23e5ba943b3 Broil the fish on top rack for 6 to 8 minutes.
759d8dc0-bc61-4c92-b726-b23e5ba943b3 For grilled salmon, cook 5 minutes per side on a heated grill.
ead2a927-661e-4da0-8dc6-d2c6ded8e620 Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add salt.
ead2a927-661e-4da0-8dc6-d2c6ded8e620 Combine the sour cream, half and half, lemon peel and dill weed and mix well; set aside.
ead2a927-661e-4da0-8dc6-d2c6ded8e620 Cook the pasta according to package directions in the boiling water until al dente; drain, reserving 1/2 cup pasta cooking liquid.
ead2a927-661e-4da0-8dc6-d2c6ded8e620 Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat and add salmon.
ead2a927-661e-4da0-8dc6-d2c6ded8e620 Cook and stir very gently over medium-high heat until salmon's color lightens about 4 minutes.
ead2a927-661e-4da0-8dc6-d2c6ded8e620 Remove the salmon from the skillet and set aside on a plate.
ead2a927-661e-4da0-8dc6-d2c6ded8e620 Add the leeks to the skillet and sauté for 1 minute. Add the bell pepper and peas to skillet and cook for 3 minutes longer, stirring constantly.
ead2a927-661e-4da0-8dc6-d2c6ded8e620 Reduce the heat to medium-low and add cooked and drained pasta, salmon, sour cream/lemon mixture, and lemon juice to the skillet. Stir gently to coat and heat through, adding reserved pasta water if necessary to create a smooth sauce. Serve immediately.
c122af92-8b5f-4a25-9ed8-afef3125d19d Gather the ingredients.
c122af92-8b5f-4a25-9ed8-afef3125d19d Place salmon in a shallow, nonreactive dish.
c122af92-8b5f-4a25-9ed8-afef3125d19d In a separate bowl, combine marinade ingredients of lemon juice, lemon zest, vegetable oil, dill, and garlic. Stir to combine. If you don't have fresh dill, dried dill can be used.
c122af92-8b5f-4a25-9ed8-afef3125d19d Pour marinade over salmon. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours.
c122af92-8b5f-4a25-9ed8-afef3125d19d Remove the salmon from the marinade and set aside.
c122af92-8b5f-4a25-9ed8-afef3125d19d Pour the marinade into a saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat and set aside.
c122af92-8b5f-4a25-9ed8-afef3125d19d Grill salmon directly over medium coals, basting with the boiled marinade, for about 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily.
c122af92-8b5f-4a25-9ed8-afef3125d19d Serve and enjoy with white rice, a side green salad, or a minted pea puree.
ef5ffe06-9755-46f7-ae7f-48f5f999e701 Peel the potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch dice. You should have about 2 cups of diced potatoes. Put them in a saucepan and cover them with water and 1 teaspoon of salt. Place the pan over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pan, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender. Drain and set aside.
ef5ffe06-9755-46f7-ae7f-48f5f999e701 Steam the peas on the stovetop or in the microwave following the package directions. Drain and set aside.
ef5ffe06-9755-46f7-ae7f-48f5f999e701 Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the celery and saute until tender, stirring frequently.
ef5ffe06-9755-46f7-ae7f-48f5f999e701 Add the flour to the celery and butter mixture; blend well. Continue to cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
ef5ffe06-9755-46f7-ae7f-48f5f999e701 Remove the pan from the heat and gradually add the milk. Place the pan back over medium heat. Bring to a gentle boil, stirring constantly. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
ef5ffe06-9755-46f7-ae7f-48f5f999e701 Add the cooked potatoes, peas, and salmon. Heat through and then stir in cheese. Continue to cook until the cheese has melted.
091daa36-3a85-44f7-b220-89d4808faa8d Preheat the oven to 375 F. Spray a 13" x 9" glass baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Layer the potatoes, salmon, cheese, and peas in the prepared dish.
091daa36-3a85-44f7-b220-89d4808faa8d In a medium bowl, combine the cream, milk, mustard, salt, and pepper, making three layers so the food is evenly distributed.
091daa36-3a85-44f7-b220-89d4808faa8d Smooth out the top and sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese. At this point, you can cover the dish and refrigerate for 1 to 2 days if you'd like.
091daa36-3a85-44f7-b220-89d4808faa8d You can also bake the casserole immediately, covered, for 40 to 50 minutes or until hot. Uncover the dish and bake for 10 to 15 minutes longer until the potatoes are tender, the casserole is bubbly, and the top is browned. If you are baking this from the refrigerator, add another 10 to 15 minutes to the baking time.
d609d1e7-8988-4598-be26-cedc2bb2ba08 Gather the ingredients.
d609d1e7-8988-4598-be26-cedc2bb2ba08 Heat oven to 425 F.
d609d1e7-8988-4598-be26-cedc2bb2ba08 Clean, rinse, and pat dry the fillet.
d609d1e7-8988-4598-be26-cedc2bb2ba08 Place salmon filletskin side downon a piece of aluminum foil that is large enough to wrap around the whole fillet. Then place on a baking sheet or in a shallow pan.
d609d1e7-8988-4598-be26-cedc2bb2ba08 In a small bowl, mix together the lemon juice, oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
d609d1e7-8988-4598-be26-cedc2bb2ba08 Pour the seasonings over the fillet. Then wrap the foil around the fish. Seal edges well, but leave room for the fish to expand.
d609d1e7-8988-4598-be26-cedc2bb2ba08 Bake the fish for 10 minutes in order for the heat to penetrate the foil. Then cook another 10 minutes for each inch of fish thickness. The salmon is done when it flakes easily when tested with a fork.
d609d1e7-8988-4598-be26-cedc2bb2ba08 When done, remove from oven, unwrap, and discard salmon skin.
d609d1e7-8988-4598-be26-cedc2bb2ba08 Serve hot and enjoy!
2025a3d0-9fb6-44f0-ae05-d411c3c625e2 In saucepan cook green pepper and onion in 2 tablespoons of butter until tender.
2025a3d0-9fb6-44f0-ae05-d411c3c625e2 Add soup and milk; heat until bubbly, stirring constantly.
2025a3d0-9fb6-44f0-ae05-d411c3c625e2 Add cheese; stir until melted. Stir in salmon, drained noodles and olives.
2025a3d0-9fb6-44f0-ae05-d411c3c625e2 Transfer mixture to a 1 1/2-quart casserole and top with buttered bread crumbs.
2025a3d0-9fb6-44f0-ae05-d411c3c625e2 Bake at 350 F for 25 to 30 minutes.
d7ffb12d-8fd0-43b1-96a3-2984f584afe5 Gather the ingredients. Heat the oven to 450 F.
d7ffb12d-8fd0-43b1-96a3-2984f584afe5 Bake the crust in the heated oven for 5 minutes. Remove the crust from the oven and reduce the temperature to 350 F.
d7ffb12d-8fd0-43b1-96a3-2984f584afe5 Drain salmon liquid into a cup and set aside. Put salmon in a bowl and remove bones and skin. Flake the salmon.
d7ffb12d-8fd0-43b1-96a3-2984f584afe5 Add the salmon to the cooled pastry and then sprinkle with lemon juice.
d7ffb12d-8fd0-43b1-96a3-2984f584afe5 In a skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Cook the onion until translucent. Spoon the onions over the salmon and sprinkle with parsley.
d7ffb12d-8fd0-43b1-96a3-2984f584afe5 In a medium bowl, whisk the salmon liquid with eggs, milk, seasoned salt, and pepper. Pour over salmon.
d7ffb12d-8fd0-43b1-96a3-2984f584afe5 Bake the quiche at 350 F for 45 to 50 minutes, or until firm. Remove from oven and let rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.
d7ffb12d-8fd0-43b1-96a3-2984f584afe5 Serve this salmon quiche hot with a tossed salad and bread and butter if desired.
17a58ab6-da08-4f66-9290-ffccd53a0968 Combine 2 cups water, wine, onion, lemon, salt, peppercorns, dill and parsley in a large skillet. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
17a58ab6-da08-4f66-9290-ffccd53a0968 Add salmon steaks, cover and simmer gently for 5 minutes (a little longer for steaks thicker than 1/2-inch), or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
17a58ab6-da08-4f66-9290-ffccd53a0968 Lift steaks from cooking liquid with a slotted spatula and place on serving platter. Serve with cucumber sauce, hollandaise sauce, or any of your favorite sauces.
ddaf7f59-934c-4ab9-8df5-b5002a9a97a7 The recipe assumes that steamed rice is available. If you have not done so already, make rice according to your rice cookers instructions. Allow the rice to cool slightly.
ddaf7f59-934c-4ab9-8df5-b5002a9a97a7 Sprinkle Sushinoko brand sushi rice mix over the rice, mixing it in with the edge of the rice paddle in slashing motions. Note, this helps to prevent the rice from becoming smashed.
ddaf7f59-934c-4ab9-8df5-b5002a9a97a7 If you are not using powdered sushi vinegar mix, set aside the rice to cool towards room temperature. Meanwhile, make homemade sweet vinegar for the sushi. Recipe available here.
ddaf7f59-934c-4ab9-8df5-b5002a9a97a7 Slice avocado and cube into small pieces. Set aside.
ddaf7f59-934c-4ab9-8df5-b5002a9a97a7 Take the salmon sashimi pieces and cube them into small bite sized pieces.
ddaf7f59-934c-4ab9-8df5-b5002a9a97a7 The sushi rice shouldnt be hot when garnishing the chirashi toppings over the rice.
ddaf7f59-934c-4ab9-8df5-b5002a9a97a7 Scatter salmon sashimi pieces, avocado cubes, and masago (capelin roe/caviar) over the sushi rice.
ddaf7f59-934c-4ab9-8df5-b5002a9a97a7 Garnish the chirashi with Kewpie brand Japanese mayonnaise and kizaminori (thinly sliced dried seaweed). Serve immediately.
c90c4c70-e6f5-4375-ae71-1d5ce24d80de Place the olive oil and butter in a 4-quart crockpot. Add the onions, baby carrots, and garlic, stir, cover, and cook on low for 6 to 7 hours, stirring once during cooking time, until vegetables are beginning to caramelize. This mixture can cook up to 8 to 9 hours if you are away from home while the food is cooking.
c90c4c70-e6f5-4375-ae71-1d5ce24d80de Place the salmon filet (or the smaller individual fillets) over the vegetables in the crockpot and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and dill weed.
c90c4c70-e6f5-4375-ae71-1d5ce24d80de Cover and cook on low for 1 to 2 hours until salmon flakes when tested with a fork (test at one hour mark; if salmon is done, turn the crockpot off and keep covered until serving time). If you are cooking salmon fillets, cook them for 40 to 50 minutes at most.
c90c4c70-e6f5-4375-ae71-1d5ce24d80de When you're ready to eat, place the salmon on a serving plate and top with the onion mixture.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Heat the oven to 325 F.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Lightly butter a 1 1/2-quart casserole.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Drain the salmon and flake it lightly. Pick out any bits of skin and larger bones. Set aside.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Separate the eggs; set the whites aside.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Beat the egg yolks in a small bowl and set aside.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Melt the butter in a large saucepan over low heat; stir in flour. Cook, stirring, for two minutes.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Gradually add the milk to the flour and butter mixture, stirring constantly. Continue to cook until the sauce has thickened, stirring frequently.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Add about 1/4 cup of the hot mixture to the beaten egg yolks, and then return the egg yolk mixture to the sauce, stirring quickly to blend.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Add the parsley, chives, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Stir in the flaked salmon.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Beat the egg whites to stiff peaks; don't overbeat. They should be glossy and firm and should not look dry.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Gently fold the egg whites into the salmon mixture and then transfer the mixture to the prepared casserole.
6e94cad0-16e6-4c57-9c80-00c266aa4eb2 Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until golden brown and set. Do not open the oven door until it looks done.
56afaec4-d813-48a4-93dc-7e4f9d913082 Heat the butter in a medium saucepan until melted; add onion and saute for 4 to 5 minutes, until tender.
56afaec4-d813-48a4-93dc-7e4f9d913082 Blend the flour into the butter and onion mixture. Cook, constantly stirring, for 2 minutes. Add the bay leaf and gradually stir in broth. Cook, stirring until thickened and smooth.
56afaec4-d813-48a4-93dc-7e4f9d913082 Stir in wine and cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Discard the bay leaf.
56afaec4-d813-48a4-93dc-7e4f9d913082 Stir in tomato paste and salmon with juices. Process in the blender in batches until smooth, then return to the saucepan. Stir in the half-and-half and season with salt and pepper to taste.
56afaec4-d813-48a4-93dc-7e4f9d913082 Garnish with roasted red pepper strips, croutons, parsley, or sour cream.
6721b89c-312e-4b91-8653-2172b8bbb69b Combine the cream cheese, lemon juice, onion, horseradish, dill, salt, pepper, and garlic powder in a large bowl. Use a stand mixer or handheld electric mixer until the mixture is well-blended.
6721b89c-312e-4b91-8653-2172b8bbb69b Drain and flake salmon, removing skin and bone. Add it to the cream cheese mixture and beat at low speed until it's incorporated. Be careful not to overmix and shred the fish into unrecognizable pieces.
6721b89c-312e-4b91-8653-2172b8bbb69b Put the bowl in the refrigerator and chill until the mixture is firm enough to handle. If you need it to be done faster, put the mixture into the freezer for 30 minutes.
6721b89c-312e-4b91-8653-2172b8bbb69b Wash and dry your hands, leaving them a little damp. When the mixture is firm, use your hands to shape it into a ball.
6721b89c-312e-4b91-8653-2172b8bbb69b Combine the fresh chopped parsley and chopped walnuts or pecans on a large plate. Roll the ball in the mixture to coat the sides of the ball thoroughly.
6721b89c-312e-4b91-8653-2172b8bbb69b Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.
4e23a03f-1e3b-42ac-89a9-cd4c9e64a5c1 Gather the ingredients.
4e23a03f-1e3b-42ac-89a9-cd4c9e64a5c1 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
4e23a03f-1e3b-42ac-89a9-cd4c9e64a5c1 Cut the baguette into slices approximately 1/4-inch thick. Place slices on a baking sheet and lightly toast both sides, 5 to 7 minutes total. Allow them to cool 3 to 4 minutes.
4e23a03f-1e3b-42ac-89a9-cd4c9e64a5c1 Spread cheese over each piece of toast.
4e23a03f-1e3b-42ac-89a9-cd4c9e64a5c1 Cut salmon into toast-size pieces and place over cheese.
4e23a03f-1e3b-42ac-89a9-cd4c9e64a5c1 Serve with lemon slices, as your guests may wish to squeeze lemon over top.
4e23a03f-1e3b-42ac-89a9-cd4c9e64a5c1 Enjoy!
3e608a46-6f42-486c-aa8c-1a414ad26cc1 Use a rolling pin to roll the bread out flat and thin. The crust can be left on or cut off.
3e608a46-6f42-486c-aa8c-1a414ad26cc1 Spread a layer of cream cheese on the bread. Lay a thin layer of smoked salmon on top of the cream cheese.
3e608a46-6f42-486c-aa8c-1a414ad26cc1 Tightly roll up the slice of bread, rolling from the longest side. Squeeze the roll together gently to secure. Use a serrated knife then cut the roll into 4 or 5 pieces.
b55b7e7a-502e-42a4-81e5-34d6025e0d99 The day before serving (if possible, since this intensifies the flavors): To Make the basic smörgåstårta spread: Whip together the softened cream cheese, mayonnaise, and sour cream until light and creamy. Place in the refrigerator until ready to use.
b55b7e7a-502e-42a4-81e5-34d6025e0d99 To make the baby shrimp spread: Mix together 1 cup of the cream-cheese mixture, 2 cups cooked baby shrimp, 1 tablespoon chopped dill, and chopped sweet pepper. Place in the refrigerator until ready to use.
b55b7e7a-502e-42a4-81e5-34d6025e0d99 To make the avocado spread: Peel and lightly mash two avocadoes into a chunky spread. Combine with 1/2 cup cream-cheese mixture, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1/4 cup red onion, and 1 tablespoon chopped dill. Place in the refrigerator until ready to use.
b55b7e7a-502e-42a4-81e5-34d6025e0d99 To make the smoked salmon spread: Remove smoked salmon from skin (if present) and dice into small pieces. Fold into 1 cup cream-cheese mixture; mix in 1 tablespoon roughly chopped capers. Place in the refrigerator until ready to use.
b55b7e7a-502e-42a4-81e5-34d6025e0d99 To construct the smörgåstårta: Slice the crusts off of the bread. Arrange four slices in a square pattern on a serving plate and thinly butter this bottom layer. Cover completely with the shrimp spread. Thinly butter the bottoms of four more bread slices, then place on top of the shrimp layer. Thinly butter the tops of the slices. Cover completely with the chunky avocado spread. Thinly butter the bottoms of four more bread slices, then place on top of the avocado spread. Thinly butter the tops of the slices. Cover completely with the smoked salmon spread. Thinly butter the bottoms of the final four slices and place on top of the smoked salmon layer. Refrigerate any remaining cream-cheese spread.
b55b7e7a-502e-42a4-81e5-34d6025e0d99 If possible, cover the smörgåstårta with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
b55b7e7a-502e-42a4-81e5-34d6025e0d99 If not possible, refrigerate for at least three hours to allow the flavors to blend (it will still taste fabulous!).
b55b7e7a-502e-42a4-81e5-34d6025e0d99 One hour before serving, frost the top and sides of the smörgåstårta with the remaining cream cheese spread. Then, use your creativity to decorate with 1 cup cooked baby shrimp (pile it high for effect!), cucumber slices, lemon slices, halved cherry tomatoes, endive, chopped dill, capers, and caviar paste or anchovy paste.
4a6c4d38-cb97-4181-bc8c-5fe0b5709f1f Gather the ingredients.
4a6c4d38-cb97-4181-bc8c-5fe0b5709f1f Preheat oven to 400 F.
4a6c4d38-cb97-4181-bc8c-5fe0b5709f1f Boil peppers in boiling salted water for 5 minutes; drain well. Combine onion, 1/2 cup bread crumbs, egg, milk, salt and pepper, lemon juice, and salmon.
4a6c4d38-cb97-4181-bc8c-5fe0b5709f1f Fill pepper shells.
4a6c4d38-cb97-4181-bc8c-5fe0b5709f1f Mix melted butter with remaining 1/2 cup breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese; sprinkle over stuffed peppers.
4a6c4d38-cb97-4181-bc8c-5fe0b5709f1f Place in a shallow baking dish in preheated oven for 15 minutes.
4a6c4d38-cb97-4181-bc8c-5fe0b5709f1f Serve and enjoy!
a37fa89a-b0e5-467b-8a24-b0d8c8b869ef Gather the ingredients.
a37fa89a-b0e5-467b-8a24-b0d8c8b869ef With the help of a sharp knife, cut the fish into large chunks about 1-inch thick. Generously sprinkle the pieces of fish with salt on both sides.
a37fa89a-b0e5-467b-8a24-b0d8c8b869ef In a deep saucepan, mix the infused oil ingredients. Slowly heat the oil mixture over medium heat until you begin to see a gentle simmer.
a37fa89a-b0e5-467b-8a24-b0d8c8b869ef With the help of a food thermometer check that the oil is close to 160 F. Hold this temperature for about 15 minutes and then turn off the heat. Cover the pot and leave the oil to cool off for approximately 45 minutes.
a37fa89a-b0e5-467b-8a24-b0d8c8b869ef Once the oil has cooled, turn the heat back on to medium and heat it up again to 150 F. Once you've reached this temperature, slip in the fish and arrange the pieces in one layer, so the fish is completely covered in oil.
a37fa89a-b0e5-467b-8a24-b0d8c8b869ef Turn off the heat and cover the pot again. Let the fish steep in the oil for another 30 to 45 minutes.
a37fa89a-b0e5-467b-8a24-b0d8c8b869ef After the fish has steeped in the hot oil, use a slotted spoon to remove it and transfer it to clean plastic or glass container.
a37fa89a-b0e5-467b-8a24-b0d8c8b869ef Let the oil cool to room temperature, then strain it through a piece of cheesecloth or fine mesh and pour it over the fish. Make sure you do not include any liquid that the fish gave off during cooking. You want oil only to cover the fish. If your infused oil seems too contaminated with fish bits, use clean olive oil if needed. With just oil covering it, the fish will last in the refrigerator for two weeks.
a37fa89a-b0e5-467b-8a24-b0d8c8b869ef Enjoy!
af33556a-c4be-4692-9383-f1dcbbe56e07 Heat the oven to 400 F (200 C/Gas 6). Butter a 2-quart baking dish.
af33556a-c4be-4692-9383-f1dcbbe56e07 In a large skillet over medium-low heat, cook onion and celery in 4 tablespoons of butter until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in flour, pepper, and dry mustard. Continue cooking, stirring, until smooth and just bubbly. Add Worcestershire sauce and gradually stir in milk. Cook, stirring, until thickened. Add about half of the cheese to the sauce mixture; stir until melted. Add flaked tuna and peas. If desired, stir in the pimientos. Taste and add salt, as needed.
af33556a-c4be-4692-9383-f1dcbbe56e07 Spoon half of the hot rice into the prepared baking dish and spread about half of the remaining cheese over the rice; top with half of the hot tuna mixture, then repeat layers. Melt remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and toss with the bread crumbs. Sprinkle crumbs over the top.
af33556a-c4be-4692-9383-f1dcbbe56e07 Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the bread crumb topping is lightly browned and the casserole is bubbly around the edges.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Gather the ingredients.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Hard boil the eggs. Allow them to cool in cold water. Peel and cut the eggs into quarters or slice into thick slices and set aside.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Cut the lettuce head in half. Rinse the lettuce under cold water and allow to drain. While it is draining, prep the vegetables.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Quarter the tomatoes (so you have 8 pieces). Peel and slice the cucumber. Remove the stem and seeds from the peppers and slice them into long, thin strips. Thinly slice the onion and grate the carrot.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Open the cans of tuna, white asparagus, and artichoke hearts and drain each one well.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Break up the lettuce into small pieces for a salad. Make a bed of lettuce on a large platter.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 On top of the bed, place the tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, peppers, and carrots.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Spread the tuna around the bed of lettuce, breaking it up into small chunks with a fork.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Place the reserved egg slices, asparagus, artichoke hearts, olives, and baby corn ears (if using) on top.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Dress with oil and vinegar and sprinkle with salt to taste.
dc27b648-69d1-45f2-b8a3-7c712ef668d3 Serve cold with crispy artisan bread if you like.
904e9c1f-665f-4b55-88a9-d5721a7da6da Gather the ingredients.
904e9c1f-665f-4b55-88a9-d5721a7da6da Heat oven to 350 F.
904e9c1f-665f-4b55-88a9-d5721a7da6da Spray a 2 1/2- to 3-quart casserole dish with cooking spray.
904e9c1f-665f-4b55-88a9-d5721a7da6da Combine the noodles, soup, peas, cheese, tuna, and milk. Add salt and freshly ground black pepper. Spoon into the prepared baking dish.
904e9c1f-665f-4b55-88a9-d5721a7da6da In a small bowl, toss the breadcrumbs with the melted butter and sprinkle over the top of the casserole.
904e9c1f-665f-4b55-88a9-d5721a7da6da Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until hot and bubbly and the breadcrumbs are browned.
904e9c1f-665f-4b55-88a9-d5721a7da6da Serve and enjoy.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Gather the ingredients.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Preheat the oven to 375 F.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Lightly butter a 2-quart casserole.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Melt the butter in a saucepan or saute pan over low heat; cook the mushrooms, celery, and chopped onion until tender and onion is translucent.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Blend in the flour and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Remove from the heat and gradually stir the milk into the flour mixture.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Add salt and cayenne pepper; return to heat and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc In a bowl, combine tuna with the cooked rice and all but 2 tablespoons of the shredded cheese. Add the sauce mixture and gently blend.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Turn the rice and tuna mixture into the prepared casserole.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter; toss the melted butter with the cracker crumbs or bread crumbs.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Sprinkle crumbs and remaining cheese over casserole. Sprinkle with paprika.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, until hot and bubbly.
34b5f31f-65b0-48d2-a762-964372c13bcc Serve and enjoy!
4fccf115-a085-45d8-957d-23882da38ed4 Gather the ingredients.
4fccf115-a085-45d8-957d-23882da38ed4 Place the cided cucumber into a bowl and sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt and stir then leave for 5 minutes. Rinse quickly under running water and dry on kitchen paper. Keep to one side.
4fccf115-a085-45d8-957d-23882da38ed4 Boil potatoes in lightly salted water for 3 minutes maximum. Drain and dry with kitchen paper, then season with a tiny sprinkle of salt and pepper. The potatoes must be very dry before they are used.
4fccf115-a085-45d8-957d-23882da38ed4 Use a sharp knife to cut through the grain lines of the tuna to create even slices, then cut into cubes.
4fccf115-a085-45d8-957d-23882da38ed4 In a bowl, mix the tuna and all the diced vegetables, chopped parsley, and mayonnaise. Do this carefully so as to not break up the vegetables.
4fccf115-a085-45d8-957d-23882da38ed4 Place a 3-inch pastry ring in the center of a serving plate and spoon vegetable and fish mixture into it. Press down firmly.
4fccf115-a085-45d8-957d-23882da38ed4 Press a small indentation in the center of the tartare and place a large tablespoon of sour cream into it. Smooth the sour cream with a spatula or knife.
4fccf115-a085-45d8-957d-23882da38ed4 Loosen the ring and remove it very carefully. Lightly whisk together the vinaigrette ingredients and drizzle lightly on and around the tartare. Decorate with the tomatoes and fresh herbs (if using) and a little extra pepper. The tartare also works really well with slices of avocado for a more substantial dish.
4fccf115-a085-45d8-957d-23882da38ed4 Serve the tartare immediately, or if serving later, cover very lightly with plastic wrap. Eat on the same day, this will not keep longer.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 Gather the ingredients.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 Place the veal in a large, nonreactive bowl with the bay leaves, cloves (if using), sage, and celery; pour the wine over. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 24 hours, turning the meat occasionally.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 The next day, transfer the meat to a Dutch oven. Strain the spices and celery out of the wine, then add the wine to the Dutch oven, plus enough water to cover the meat.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 Add a little salt and simmer the meat for 1 hour.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 In the meantime, wash, scale, and bone the anchovies.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 When the hour is up, add the anchovies to the pot and continue simmering for another 30 minutes; the liquid should be reduced by half.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 Place the eggs in a small pot with 1 inch of cold water to cover. Bring the water just to a rolling boil, then cover the pot, remove it from the heat, and let sit for 10 minutes to hard-boil the eggs. Drain the eggs, rinse them under cold water, then let them sit in cold water for a few minutes until cool enough to peel.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 Separate the yolks from the whites. (The whites will not be used in this recipe; you may discard them or set them aside for another purpose.)
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 Rinse, dry, and finely mince the capers.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 When the meat is fork-tender, remove it from the heat. Strain the broth into a bowl.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 Transfer the anchovy fillets to a food processor; add the tuna, hard-boiled yolks, olive oil, vinegar, and lemon juice and process until creamy. Dilute the sauce to taste with some of the reserved broth and process again. Stir in the minced capers.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 When the veal has cooled, slice it thinly and lay the slices out on one or more platters. Spread the sauce over the meat and garnish the platters with the lemon slices, capers, and parsley. Cover with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator before serving.
1b52b6b3-047d-4f02-99e7-7233e3734ad3 Enjoy!
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Gather the ingredients.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Heat the oven to 350 F/180 C. Lightly butter a 2-quart baking dish or spray with cooking spray.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Cook the noodles in boiling salted water following package directions.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Drain in a colander and rinse under hot water.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Meanwhile, melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Add the sliced mushrooms and saute until golden brown and tender.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Add the flour. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Gradually add the milk and continue to cook, stirring, until thickened.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Stir in the mayonnaise, frozen peas, tuna, and drained pimiento. Bring to a simmer and continue cooking, stirring, for 1 minute longer.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Combine the sauce mixture with the noodles and stir to blend ingredients thoroughly.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Turn the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d In a small bowl, make the topping by combining the breadcrumbs with the melted butter.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Sprinkle the buttered breadcrumbs over the casserole.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Bake for 25 minutes, or until the casserole is bubbly and topping is browned.
b5c0c42b-47ad-4dfc-bc06-35658930d19d Serve and enjoy!
847ea21e-5310-450c-b4b3-3b7129410140 Gather the ingredients.
847ea21e-5310-450c-b4b3-3b7129410140 Drain the peppers and pat dry with a paper towel. Finely chop the olives. Dice the green onions and include a part of the green stock. Finely chop 1 sprig of the parsley.
847ea21e-5310-450c-b4b3-3b7129410140 Drain the tuna. In a small bowl, break the tuna into flakes using a fork.
847ea21e-5310-450c-b4b3-3b7129410140 Add the chopped green onions and parsley to the tuna. Sprinkle with vinegar and sweet paprika. Drizzle oil on top and mix thoroughly.
847ea21e-5310-450c-b4b3-3b7129410140 Carefully open each pepper and spoon in the tuna mixture. Arrange on a serving plate. Garnish with the parsley sprig, if desired.
11caf697-37dc-46b7-9d89-74f05b1abf11 Gather the ingredients.
11caf697-37dc-46b7-9d89-74f05b1abf11 Whisk together the mayonnaise, sour cream, cream, and lemon or lime juice.
11caf697-37dc-46b7-9d89-74f05b1abf11 In a separate bowl, stir together the onions and cilantro. Set this garnish and the cream sauce aside for the moment.
11caf697-37dc-46b7-9d89-74f05b1abf11 Heat oil in a small pan and sauté the tuna, stirring often, until tuna is heated through and very slightly browned. Take the pan off the heat.
11caf697-37dc-46b7-9d89-74f05b1abf11 If using soft tortillas, heat a griddle over high heat and place them on it. Heat the tortillas, turning once or twice in the process, until they are very hot. For hard taco shells, place them on a baking sheet and heat until crispy.
11caf697-37dc-46b7-9d89-74f05b1abf11 Place 1/4 of the tuna mixture onto each tortilla, then top each with some of the onion-cilantro mix, and a drizzle of cream sauce.
11caf697-37dc-46b7-9d89-74f05b1abf11 Serve tacos immediately. Offer Mexican table sauce, bottled hot sauce, or other condiments of your choice.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Gather the ingredients.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Preheat oven to 350 F. Butter a 2-quart casserole.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Cook macaroni in boiling salted water according to package directions until tender, drain and rinse.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Melt 4 tablespoons of the butter in a large saucepan or Dutch oven; add chopped onions and bell pepper and sauté over low heat for about 3 to 4 minutes, until tender.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Add flour, salt, and pepper; cook, stirring, for about 1 to 2 minutes.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Add milk and condensed soup and stir over low heat until the sauce is smooth and thickened.
