fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Add cooked drained macaroni, peas, flaked tuna, and about half of the cheese to sauce mixture, stirring constantly.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Pour the mixture into the prepared casserole; top with remaining shredded cheese.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and toss with the breadcrumbs until thoroughly coated.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Scatter the crumbs over the cheese layer.
fbbacb6d-b4c3-401b-accc-9c7a2557810f Bake the casserole for 30 to 40 minutes, or until the crumb topping is nicely browned.
04a73893-78cc-485c-a901-41f2eb2e9cef Buy a piece of fish you can later cut, across the grain of the meat, into squares or rounds of at least two inches across. You may need to buy more fish than you need to get the presentation right. Use the excess in either a tartare or a stir-fry.
04a73893-78cc-485c-a901-41f2eb2e9cef Wrap the fish tightly in plastic and put it in the freezer for an hour or more. After an hour, check to see if it is hardbut not solid. When it reaches that state, take it out and get your sharpest knife.
04a73893-78cc-485c-a901-41f2eb2e9cef Slice the fish across the grain as thin as you can. I shoot for a cut of about 1/8-inch. Do not pound it to make it flatter. (That's carpaccio, not crudo).
04a73893-78cc-485c-a901-41f2eb2e9cef Coat the slices in the olive oil and set in a sealed container in the refrigerator over a bed of ice for at least 20 minutes, or up to an hour.
04a73893-78cc-485c-a901-41f2eb2e9cef To serve, take the fish out of the fridge. On the plate, pour some olive oil (which you did not use in the marinade) on the plate and arrange the slices over it. Each guest should get a quarter of the lemon and a tiny bowl of the sea salt, or you can salt the fish right before serving.
8d0272aa-0d41-47d4-8573-0741c76f1782 Cook the noodles in boiling salted water following the package directions. Drain well and set aside.
8d0272aa-0d41-47d4-8573-0741c76f1782 Heat oven to 350 F.
8d0272aa-0d41-47d4-8573-0741c76f1782 Lightly butter a 2 to 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
8d0272aa-0d41-47d4-8573-0741c76f1782 In a large saucepan, melt 3 tablespoons of butter over medium-low heat. Add the green onions and saute for 1 minute. Stir in flour and continue cooking, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually add the milk; cook, stirring, until thickened.
8d0272aa-0d41-47d4-8573-0741c76f1782 Add the seasonings to the milk along with the artichoke hearts, olives, pimientos, mushrooms, and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese. Cook the sauce, stirring, until the Parmesan cheese has melted. Add the flaked tuna; taste and add salt, as needed. Stir in noodles.
8d0272aa-0d41-47d4-8573-0741c76f1782 Spoon the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
8d0272aa-0d41-47d4-8573-0741c76f1782 Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter; toss with the bread crumbs until well coated. Add 1 or 2 tablespoons of grated Parmesan cheese to the breadcrumbs. Sprinkle the crumbs over the casserole.
8d0272aa-0d41-47d4-8573-0741c76f1782 Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until hot and bubbly and the topping is browned.
22925fee-8c58-4511-8b7b-aee7830a9474 Heat oven to 350 F.
22925fee-8c58-4511-8b7b-aee7830a9474 Arrange the split muffins on a cookie sheet which has been lined with foil or a silicone baking mat.
22925fee-8c58-4511-8b7b-aee7830a9474 In a medium bowl, combine tuna with celery, 2 to 4 tablespoons green onion, and mayonnaise; blend all ingredients well. Stir in salt and pepper to taste.
22925fee-8c58-4511-8b7b-aee7830a9474 Spoon tuna mixture evenly over the muffins. Top each sandwich with a thin slice of tomato. Bake for 8 minutes; top with cheese slices then bake for about 2 minutes longer, or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle each sandwich with green onion and a freshly ground black or seasoned pepper.
41c60092-338a-4e35-87bc-b4adca755784 Heat the oven to 375 F. Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
41c60092-338a-4e35-87bc-b4adca755784 In a large bowl, combine the soup and water.
41c60092-338a-4e35-87bc-b4adca755784 Add 1 cup of chow mein noodles, finely chopped onion, pepper, tuna, and celery. Toss lightly.
41c60092-338a-4e35-87bc-b4adca755784 Turn the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle remaining 1 cup chow mein noodles over the top.
41c60092-338a-4e35-87bc-b4adca755784 Bake for 30 minutes and serve hot.
c53d5c87-f9f2-490a-882e-99ed4fcdbb02 Cook the pasta in boiling salted water following package directions; drain, rinse, and set aside.
c53d5c87-f9f2-490a-882e-99ed4fcdbb02 In a large bowl, combine the tuna, finely chopped onion, minced garlic, bell pepper, dill, and lemon juice.
c53d5c87-f9f2-490a-882e-99ed4fcdbb02 In a small bowl or cup, combine 3/4 cup of the mayonnaise and the sour cream.
c53d5c87-f9f2-490a-882e-99ed4fcdbb02 Put the pasta in the bowl with the vegetables, add the mayonnaise mixture, and gently toss to combine. Add more mayonnaise if necessary to reach desired consistency.
c53d5c87-f9f2-490a-882e-99ed4fcdbb02 Add the sliced tomatoes and stir gently. Taste and add salt and pepper to taste.
f2195ae0-317c-4cd7-9900-b859d7d2958b Gather the ingredients.
f2195ae0-317c-4cd7-9900-b859d7d2958b Grill tuna on the grill, stovetop grill pan, or broil for just 3 to 4 minutes on each side. The tuna should be rare to medium rare for best flavor.
f2195ae0-317c-4cd7-9900-b859d7d2958b Cook the new potatoes in boiling salted water until just tender, about 10 to 15 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water and then slice.
f2195ae0-317c-4cd7-9900-b859d7d2958b Cook green beans in boiling salted water until just tender but still vibrant green, about 2 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water.
f2195ae0-317c-4cd7-9900-b859d7d2958b Arrange spinach leaves, hard cooked eggs, and potato slices on the salad plates. Layer the sliced grilled tuna, green beans, red onion, and chopped olives to make a mound, repeating layers until ingredients are used. Garnish the plate with tomato wedges.
f2195ae0-317c-4cd7-9900-b859d7d2958b Combine dressing ingredients in a blender or screw-top jar and use processor or shake until well blended.
f2195ae0-317c-4cd7-9900-b859d7d2958b Serve the salad drizzled with the dressing or serve it on the side.
f7f389df-8207-4664-a7c5-0b2a2bf12001 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
f7f389df-8207-4664-a7c5-0b2a2bf12001 Grease a 1 and 1/2-quart casserole or baking dish.
f7f389df-8207-4664-a7c5-0b2a2bf12001 Put 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium heat; add onions and peppers.
f7f389df-8207-4664-a7c5-0b2a2bf12001 Cook until onions are softened. Add flour, milk, and soup; stir until thickened.
f7f389df-8207-4664-a7c5-0b2a2bf12001 Add pimiento, vegetables, tuna, mixed vegetables, chopped eggs, and cooked macaroni.
f7f389df-8207-4664-a7c5-0b2a2bf12001 Taste and add salt and pepper. Place in the prepared casserole or baking dish.
f7f389df-8207-4664-a7c5-0b2a2bf12001 Toss the breadcrumbs with the 2 tablespoons of melted butter.
f7f389df-8207-4664-a7c5-0b2a2bf12001 Sprinkle the crumbs evenly over the top and bake for about 30 minutes, or until nicely browned.
bdeaf4cd-8989-45a8-88d0-c4a928d5418a Heat oil in a large skillet and add rice and garlic. Cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes until rice is coated with oil and starts to turn a bit golden in spots.
bdeaf4cd-8989-45a8-88d0-c4a928d5418a Add wine, pepper, and 1 cup chicken broth to the skillet. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and cook mixture for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring frequently, until liquid is absorbed.
bdeaf4cd-8989-45a8-88d0-c4a928d5418a Add about 1/2 cup of the remaining broth, stirring the rice until liquid is absorbed.
bdeaf4cd-8989-45a8-88d0-c4a928d5418a Continue until the rice is tender, and the risotto is the consistency you want.
bdeaf4cd-8989-45a8-88d0-c4a928d5418a Add lemon juice, spinach, lemon peel, and tuna. Cook and stir gently until spinach is wilted.
bdeaf4cd-8989-45a8-88d0-c4a928d5418a Stir in butter until melted along with 1/2 cup cheese. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and serve.
bd60039e-70ae-4046-9cdb-e76d4dd62b54 Gather the ingredients.
bd60039e-70ae-4046-9cdb-e76d4dd62b54 This recipe assumes that steamed rice is cooked and available for use. If not, please make rice according to your rice cooker's instructions, or make steamed rice stovetop with this recipe available here.
bd60039e-70ae-4046-9cdb-e76d4dd62b54 Take two servings of rice and place in a medium-size bowl. Fan the rice to cool slightly and sprinkle Sushinoko brand powdered sushi vinegar over the rice to season. Using the edge of the rice paddle, "cut" the rice diagonally and toss to mix. Note, this motion prevents the rice from becoming smashed.
bd60039e-70ae-4046-9cdb-e76d4dd62b54 On individual servings plates, spread sushi rice out.
bd60039e-70ae-4046-9cdb-e76d4dd62b54 Garnish sushi rice with roasted white sesame seeds.
bd60039e-70ae-4046-9cdb-e76d4dd62b54 In a small bowl add drained canned tuna. Squeeze a small amount of fresh lemon juice over the tuna and toss. Break up any large chunks of the tuna.
bd60039e-70ae-4046-9cdb-e76d4dd62b54 Garnish the rice with sesame seeds with tuna flakes, and cucumber matchsticks.
bd60039e-70ae-4046-9cdb-e76d4dd62b54 Chiffonade shiso leaves. Stack the leaves together, roll up, then slice into thin pieces. You should end with thin pieces of shiso that resemble ribbon. Garnish the sushi with shiso.
bd60039e-70ae-4046-9cdb-e76d4dd62b54 Finally, add a pinch of the sakura denbu to the center of each chirashi sushi plate. Serve immediately.
f69281e7-2386-41bf-8727-c34394f58f1d In a bowl, combine the tuna, celery, mayonnaise, lemon juice, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and a dash of pepper. Mix with a fork until well blended.
f69281e7-2386-41bf-8727-c34394f58f1d Spread the tuna salad mixture on 4 slices of the bread. Cover with remaining 4 slices of bread then cut each sandwich in half diagonally.
f69281e7-2386-41bf-8727-c34394f58f1d In a bowl, whisk eggs with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 cup milk.
f69281e7-2386-41bf-8727-c34394f58f1d Carefully dip the sandwich halves in the egg mixture.
f69281e7-2386-41bf-8727-c34394f58f1d Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
f69281e7-2386-41bf-8727-c34394f58f1d Fry the sandwich halves in hot butter until nicely browned on both sides.
a20467e7-8dd0-4af5-9a3a-b066a1ba9953 Spoon rice into small Japanese donburi style bowls which are slightly larger than traditional rice bowls. Make sure the rice has cooled to almost room temperature.
a20467e7-8dd0-4af5-9a3a-b066a1ba9953 Chop the tuna so that it is almost minced. In a medium bowl, gently combine minced tuna, 2 tablespoons Kewpie mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon Sriracha chili sauce, 1/4 teaspoon sesame oil, 1/8 teaspoon shichimi togarashi, and 5 to 6 drops Rayu chili oil, until all of the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
a20467e7-8dd0-4af5-9a3a-b066a1ba9953 Split the mixture into two portions, generously spreading it over the rice in donburi bowls.
a20467e7-8dd0-4af5-9a3a-b066a1ba9953 Top each spicy tuna donburi with sliced green onions, roasted sesame seeds, if using, and a drizzle of soy sauce.
00c580a0-4fe9-4720-b528-4b27a7289785 Place chickpeas in a blender or food processor along with 1/8 cup of olive oil. Blend to roughly puree the chickpeas. Transfer to a mixing bowl.
00c580a0-4fe9-4720-b528-4b27a7289785 Add tuna, grated carrots, onion, garlic, cilantro, parsley, sea salt, and chile flakes. Stir well to combine.
00c580a0-4fe9-4720-b528-4b27a7289785 Shape mixture into small patties and then cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
00c580a0-4fe9-4720-b528-4b27a7289785 Remove patties from the fridge and then dredge in a little flour, followed by the breadcrumbs.
00c580a0-4fe9-4720-b528-4b27a7289785 Heat about 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a nonstick skillet and fry patties until golden brown on each side. Place patties on a paper towel to drain. If they seem a little moist, then fry them for a second time and then drain. This helps the patties keep their shape.
00c580a0-4fe9-4720-b528-4b27a7289785 To make the dipping sauce, combine yogurt, cucumber, mint and grated garlic in a small bowl. Stir well and then serve with the tuna chickpea patties along with some lemon wedges for squeezing.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Scrub the potatoes to clean off any loose dirt and sand.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Pour water into a large pot, cover and bring to a boil on high heat. Place potatoes in the pot and boil them with skins on until they are cooked, but not too soft. Test the doneness by pricking with a fork to make sure they are cooked, but still firm. Dont overcook the potatoes or youll end up with mashed potatoes when mixing your salad.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Boil the eggs until hard. Cool the eggs.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Drain the water from the pot and add cold water to the pot, covering the potatoes. Change water every few minutes until the potatoes are cool enough to handle with your bare hands. Refrigerate for a few minutes to cool further.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Remove from refrigerator and peel potatoes. Cut into small (approximately 1/2 inch) cubes. Return to refrigerator while you prepare the other ingredients.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Put approximately 1 1/2 cups of mayonnaise into a bowl. Slice 1 of the roasted pepper into strips about 1/3 inch wide, then cut into smaller pieces and add to bowl.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Drain tuna thoroughly, then flake with a fork and add to bowl.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Drain carrots and peas and add to bowl.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Peel 1 egg, chop and add to bowl.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Mix all ingredients together.
38cba1e6-8e11-4e23-8500-0c6c0f00ef32 Add the mayonnaise mixture to the potatoes and mix thoroughly. If necessary, add more mayonnaise. Smooth top of potato salad, preparing for decoration.
51924ac0-a66a-4a4c-8509-390fbe4ed76c Heat the oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4). Butter a 2-quart baking dish.
51924ac0-a66a-4a4c-8509-390fbe4ed76c In a large skillet or saute pan, melt 2 tablespoons of butter; saute the onion and celery until the onion is translucent. Stir in tuna, soup, mayonnaise, milk, mushrooms, parsley, and pimiento.
51924ac0-a66a-4a4c-8509-390fbe4ed76c In the prepared casserole, combine the hot cooked noodles and the tuna mixture.
51924ac0-a66a-4a4c-8509-390fbe4ed76c Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and toss with the bread crumbs.
51924ac0-a66a-4a4c-8509-390fbe4ed76c Top the casserole with the buttered bread crumbs.
51924ac0-a66a-4a4c-8509-390fbe4ed76c Bake the casserole for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the topping is lightly browned and the filling is hot and bubbling around the edges.
04d4737b-36bb-496b-b9a5-157407337294 Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 F.
04d4737b-36bb-496b-b9a5-157407337294 Cut the bell peppers in half vertically and remove the stem, seeds, and white membrane.
04d4737b-36bb-496b-b9a5-157407337294 Boil the pepper shells in salted water for 5 minutes. Drain well.
04d4737b-36bb-496b-b9a5-157407337294 In a mixing bowl, combine the onion, 1/2 cup bread crumbs, beaten egg, milk, salt and pepper, lemon juice, and tuna.
04d4737b-36bb-496b-b9a5-157407337294 Fill the pepper shells with the bread crumb mixture.
04d4737b-36bb-496b-b9a5-157407337294 Mix the melted butter with the remaining 1/2 cup bread crumbs; sprinkle over stuffed peppers. Place in a shallow baking dish and bake for 15 minutes. If desired, top with shredded cheese 5 minutes before the peppers are finished baking.
04d4737b-36bb-496b-b9a5-157407337294 Serve and enjoy!
35ac0ac6-e559-4dc6-b1ff-0ff6340c6d22 Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
35ac0ac6-e559-4dc6-b1ff-0ff6340c6d22 Coat a 1 1/2- to 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray and set aside.
35ac0ac6-e559-4dc6-b1ff-0ff6340c6d22 In a large bowl, combine the cooked spaghetti, tuna, and pimiento.
35ac0ac6-e559-4dc6-b1ff-0ff6340c6d22 In a large saucepan, combine soup, milk, and cheese. Heat and stir until cheese is melted.
35ac0ac6-e559-4dc6-b1ff-0ff6340c6d22 Add the tuna and spaghetti mixture and combine thoroughly.
35ac0ac6-e559-4dc6-b1ff-0ff6340c6d22 Transfer to the prepared casserole dish and scatter the crushed potato chips evenly on top.
35ac0ac6-e559-4dc6-b1ff-0ff6340c6d22 Bake for 30 minutes until bubbly and the cheese is melted. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
35ac0ac6-e559-4dc6-b1ff-0ff6340c6d22 Serve and enjoy!
5ea45cb4-b840-4a55-848d-4b37454c9f6a Gather the ingredients.
5ea45cb4-b840-4a55-848d-4b37454c9f6a In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium-low heat; blend in the flour, salt, and pepper. Stir and cook for about 2 minutes, or until smooth and bubbly.
5ea45cb4-b840-4a55-848d-4b37454c9f6a Gradually stir in the milk while stirring constantly. Continue cooking, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and begins to bubble.
5ea45cb4-b840-4a55-848d-4b37454c9f6a Add the drained tuna and cooked peas. Continue heating and stirring until hot.
5ea45cb4-b840-4a55-848d-4b37454c9f6a Serve creamed tuna over toast, biscuits, or rice.
403eb5f2-1747-470c-b3b5-93b8ec6497cf Gather the ingredients.
403eb5f2-1747-470c-b3b5-93b8ec6497cf Heat oven to 350 F.
403eb5f2-1747-470c-b3b5-93b8ec6497cf Lightly grease a 3-quart baking dish or spray it with nonstick cooking spray.
403eb5f2-1747-470c-b3b5-93b8ec6497cf Cook the pasta in boiling salted water following package directions. Drain in a colander.
403eb5f2-1747-470c-b3b5-93b8ec6497cf In a large bowl, combine the pasta with the drained flaked tuna, soups, milk, mushrooms, pepper, and drained cooked peas. Gently stir in 1 cup of the cheese.
403eb5f2-1747-470c-b3b5-93b8ec6497cf Turn into the prepared baking dish. Top with the remaining cheese.
403eb5f2-1747-470c-b3b5-93b8ec6497cf Toss the bread crumbs with melted butter until thoroughly coated; sprinkle them evenly over the cheese layer.
403eb5f2-1747-470c-b3b5-93b8ec6497cf Bake the tuna casserole for about 25 to 30 minutes, or until the topping is browned and the edges are bubbly.
d69166c6-02ce-4480-9cb6-e4f6b39e5bfc In a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine the tuna, mayonnaise, dairy-free sour cream, and diced onion, stirring until well mixed.
d69166c6-02ce-4480-9cb6-e4f6b39e5bfc Add sweet pickle relish, dill pickle relish, garlic powder, and salt and pepper, stirring until well combined. Cover and store in the refrigerator for 15 to 30 minutes before serving.
d69166c6-02ce-4480-9cb6-e4f6b39e5bfc Serve with crackers, atop salad greens, or in a sandwich or wrap.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Gather the ingredients.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to the package directions until just al dente, reserving 1/2 cup of the pasta cooking water.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Cook bacon until crisp in a large saucepan over medium heat.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Drain on paper towels, crumble, and set aside.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Drain off all but 1 tablespoon fat from the pan.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Beat the eggs in a large bowl.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Add cream and beat again.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce In the saucepan you used to cook the bacon, add butter and oil and melt together over medium heat. Sauté the bell pepper, garlic, and onion in the fat until tender.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Drain the pasta and add immediately to the pan with the peppers.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Add the tuna and cook, stirring, until heated through.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Add the egg mixture to pan. Cook and stir, lifting pasta with tongs to allow the sauce to coat the pasta thoroughly.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Add the reserved pasta water, cheese, reserved bacon, and parsley, and stir until well-coasted and cheese has melted.
61037c70-ae74-457c-b857-eff88d3d4dce Serve immediately and enjoy!
7e096ce1-657d-406a-a3df-a33aa9ead0f0 Place the tuna in a large bowl.
7e096ce1-657d-406a-a3df-a33aa9ead0f0 Add 2 tablespoons of the mayonnaise, the mustard, relish, celery and onion. Mix well.
7e096ce1-657d-406a-a3df-a33aa9ead0f0 Taste and add more mayonnaise if you prefer a creamier salad, and/or lemon juice for a tangier flavor.
7e096ce1-657d-406a-a3df-a33aa9ead0f0 Season with the pepper, and mix again.
7e096ce1-657d-406a-a3df-a33aa9ead0f0 Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
e06cf1c3-4718-443d-8fda-f3456388ebb9 Heat oven to 350 F.
e06cf1c3-4718-443d-8fda-f3456388ebb9 Grease a 2 1/2 to 3-quart baking dish.
e06cf1c3-4718-443d-8fda-f3456388ebb9 Cook the spaghetti following the package directions in salted water. Drain and set aside.
e06cf1c3-4718-443d-8fda-f3456388ebb9 In a large saucepan over medium-low heat, melt 4 tablespoons of the butter. Add the mushrooms and saute, stirring, until mushrooms are browned and tender. Add the green onions and continue cooking for 1 minute. Stir in the flour until well blended. Gradually stir in the milk. Continue cooking, stirring constantly, until thickened. Add salt to taste and pepper. Stir in the flaked tuna and peas.
e06cf1c3-4718-443d-8fda-f3456388ebb9 Combine the tuna sauce mixture with the drained spaghetti until well blended. Turn the mixture into the prepared casserole. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the casserole.
e06cf1c3-4718-443d-8fda-f3456388ebb9 Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and toss with the bread crumbs. Sprinkle the buttered crumbs over the Parmesan layer.
e06cf1c3-4718-443d-8fda-f3456388ebb9 Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, until lightly browned and bubbly.
ee33cf26-c7dc-4a78-95ac-09f77615bb0c To make tuna salad mixture, mix chopped onion, tuna, mayonnaise, and salt in a bowl. Alternatively, use your favorite tuna salad recipe. If you prefer spicy tuna salad, add some karashi mustard to the tuna salad mix.
ee33cf26-c7dc-4a78-95ac-09f77615bb0c Cover the bamboo mat with a piece of plastic wrap to prevent the seaweed or any stray rice from sticking to the mat. This also makes for easy cleanup. Place one nori sheet on top of the bamboo mat.
ee33cf26-c7dc-4a78-95ac-09f77615bb0c Spread 1/4 portion of sushi rice on top of the nori sheet. In the center, spread a line of the tuna salad horizontally across the rice.
ee33cf26-c7dc-4a78-95ac-09f77615bb0c Roll up the bamboo mat, pressing forward to shape the sushi into a cylinder. Press the bamboo mat firmly and remove it from the sushi. Repeat the process and make more tuna salad rolls.
ee33cf26-c7dc-4a78-95ac-09f77615bb0c Wipe a knife with a wet cloth before slicing sushi. Cut the sushi roll into bite-size pieces. Garnish with gari shoga and serve with soy sauce.
19bd11f1-dabb-4f60-8cb9-7a78eb164639 Gather the ingredients.
19bd11f1-dabb-4f60-8cb9-7a78eb164639 About 1 to 2 hours before grilling, place the tuna in a glass bowl.
19bd11f1-dabb-4f60-8cb9-7a78eb164639 Combine the Dijon honey mustard, olive oil, soy sauce, and rice wine or white vinegar in a small bowl.
19bd11f1-dabb-4f60-8cb9-7a78eb164639 Pour over tuna and turn to make sure all pieces are well coated.
19bd11f1-dabb-4f60-8cb9-7a78eb164639 Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate until it's time to grill.
19bd11f1-dabb-4f60-8cb9-7a78eb164639 Spray a clean grill or grilling pan with non-stick cooking spray or brush it with vegetable oil.
19bd11f1-dabb-4f60-8cb9-7a78eb164639 Grill the tuna over hot coals for about 5 to 7 minutes, or until nicely charred on the outside and still a bit pink in the middle.
19bd11f1-dabb-4f60-8cb9-7a78eb164639 Slice, serve, and enjoy!
13b0c94f-655a-4a40-a4ae-ff5b7c709c77 Gather the ingredients.
13b0c94f-655a-4a40-a4ae-ff5b7c709c77 Drain the tuna.
13b0c94f-655a-4a40-a4ae-ff5b7c709c77 Transfer the tuna to a medium bowl and flake it with a fork.
13b0c94f-655a-4a40-a4ae-ff5b7c709c77 Finely chop the celery and hard-boiled egg and add them to the tuna along with the mayonnaise, and chopped dill pickle. If desired, add 1 or 2 tablespoons of finely chopped onion, chopped parsley, or Dijon mustard.
13b0c94f-655a-4a40-a4ae-ff5b7c709c77 Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed, and more mayonnaise, if desired.
13b0c94f-655a-4a40-a4ae-ff5b7c709c77 Toast or grill the bread or rolls, if desired.
13b0c94f-655a-4a40-a4ae-ff5b7c709c77 Line the bread or rolls with lettuce leaves and spread the tuna salad on the lettuce. Add a slice or two of thinly sliced tomato, if desired.
13b0c94f-655a-4a40-a4ae-ff5b7c709c77 Serve the tuna sandwiches with sliced dill pickles and potato chips or French fries.
15c64579-7870-4a79-9c9b-1432600eed03 Bring a pot of salted water to boil. You're going to boil the potatoes for about 4 minutes, then remove them with a slotted spoon, drain, rinse and dry them and then slice them in half. (Leave the water in the pot, though; you'll use it for blanching the green beans in a few moments.)
15c64579-7870-4a79-9c9b-1432600eed03 Heat a skillet with a little bit of oil until it's quite hot, then place the sliced potatoes in the pan, cut side down.
15c64579-7870-4a79-9c9b-1432600eed03 Let them cook for a minute or two until the potatoes are lightly browned, then remove them from the pan and transfer to a bowl. Toss with Kosher salt and set aside.
15c64579-7870-4a79-9c9b-1432600eed03 Bring the water back to a boil, and add the green beans. Blanch for two minutes, then drain and either shock them a bowl of ice water or just rinse with very cold water to stop the cooking. Then drain and dry them with paper towels and set aside. (Don't leave them in the ice water bath or they'll become waterlogged.)
15c64579-7870-4a79-9c9b-1432600eed03 Combine the oil, vinegar, mustard, garlic, anchovies and chopped chives in a blender. Process until smooth. Season to taste with Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. (The anchovies are salty, so you might not need much additional salt.)
15c64579-7870-4a79-9c9b-1432600eed03 Place the salad greens in a bowl. Drizzle two tablespoons of the dressing and toss to coat. Shake off any excess dressing. Now arrange the greens on four serving plates or one large platter. Distribute the potato halves equally, with the browned sides facing up.
15c64579-7870-4a79-9c9b-1432600eed03 Toss the green beans and tomatoes with enough dressing to lightly coat them, and arrange them on the serving plates or platter.
15c64579-7870-4a79-9c9b-1432600eed03 Now divide the tuna and place it in the center of plates. Arrange the hard-boiled egg quarters, then garnish with the fresh parsley and serve.
7f509e3a-1eea-44dc-91af-ea18469c538b In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese and whipped salad dressing and beat until smooth. Stir in the drained tuna, onions, carrot, and lemon juice and blend well to combine. At this point, you can refrigerate this mixture up to 3 days before you make the sandwiches.
7f509e3a-1eea-44dc-91af-ea18469c538b Spread the softened butter thinly on each slice of the bread and spread the tuna filling on half of the slices. Put the bread slices together to make sandwiches.
7f509e3a-1eea-44dc-91af-ea18469c538b Wrap the sandwiches in freezer wrap and place in a gallon freezer bag. Label the sandwiches with the recipe name and the date you made them and freeze.
7f509e3a-1eea-44dc-91af-ea18469c538b To thaw, let the sandwiches thaw overnight in the refrigerator, or add to brown bag lunches (use an insulated lunch box only please!) in the morning and let the sandwiches thaw until lunchtime. Make sure that the sandwiches are eaten within 2 hours of being completely thawed.
39b6b58a-daf4-4f8f-b7a3-8497bd73776b Melt butter in a saucepan; blend in flour and seasonings. Gradually add milk. Cook over low heat, stirring until thick.
39b6b58a-daf4-4f8f-b7a3-8497bd73776b Arrange potatoes, tuna, and chopped onion in a greased 1 1/2-quart casserole; add sauce. Bake at 350 F for 50 to 60 minutes.
0d4ad6c4-9f31-4e72-b48d-b27431f2a466 Gather the ingredients.
0d4ad6c4-9f31-4e72-b48d-b27431f2a466 In a large zip-top bag, combine the soy sauce, chopped scallions, lemon juice, sesame oil, and fresh ginger. Swish everything around in the bag until it's well combined.
0d4ad6c4-9f31-4e72-b48d-b27431f2a466 Add the tuna steaks, turning within the bag to coat them completely with the marinade. Press the excess air out of the bag, seal, and marinate in the refrigerator for about 20 minutes.
0d4ad6c4-9f31-4e72-b48d-b27431f2a466 Place the sesame seeds on a plate or a shallow dish. Remove the tuna steaks from the marinade bag, brushing the scallions off the steaks and reserving the marinade. One at a time, coat the steaks in sesame seeds on all sides, pressing the seeds into the steak so they'll stick.
0d4ad6c4-9f31-4e72-b48d-b27431f2a466 Spray the grill plates lightly with nonstick spray and place the steaks on the grill, closing the cover so the top grill rests evenly on the steaks. Do not press down. Grill for about 3 minutes for a rare, pink interior. Grill longer if you prefer your tuna cooked through. Remove from the grill and keep warm.
0d4ad6c4-9f31-4e72-b48d-b27431f2a466 If you are using an open grilling surface, carefully flip the tuna steaks with a pair of tongs after 3 minutes and cook for 3 minutes on the other side.
0d4ad6c4-9f31-4e72-b48d-b27431f2a466 While the tuna cooks, pour the marinade into a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the cornstarch, stirring with a whisk. Simmer for about 3 to 4 minutes, until the sauce thickens.
0d4ad6c4-9f31-4e72-b48d-b27431f2a466 To serve, slice the tuna steaks on the diagonal into thin slices. Fan the slices on a plate and drizzle with the sauce.
e57d163e-1042-4fe7-972b-ef769a03c01f Cook pasta according to package directions.
e57d163e-1042-4fe7-972b-ef769a03c01f For the last minute of cooking, add the broccoli florets.
e57d163e-1042-4fe7-972b-ef769a03c01f Drain noodles and broccoli.
e57d163e-1042-4fe7-972b-ef769a03c01f Rinse immediately under very cold running water and drain well.
e57d163e-1042-4fe7-972b-ef769a03c01f In a large bowl, combine the pasta and broccoli with the tuna, tomatoes, olives, and scallions.
e57d163e-1042-4fe7-972b-ef769a03c01f In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise, olive oil, vinegar, mustard (if using), salt and pepper.
e57d163e-1042-4fe7-972b-ef769a03c01f Beat with a whisk for a creamy-textured dressing.
e57d163e-1042-4fe7-972b-ef769a03c01f Just before serving, pour dressing over tuna-pasta salad and mix well.
e57d163e-1042-4fe7-972b-ef769a03c01f Enjoy!
4cec7049-0e7b-46dc-a278-7085f68fa056 Gather the ingredients.
4cec7049-0e7b-46dc-a278-7085f68fa056 Chop sushi or sashimi-grade tuna and mix with mayonnaise and ichimi togarashi in a bowl.
4cec7049-0e7b-46dc-a278-7085f68fa056 Put a nori sheet on top of a bamboo mat and spread 1/4 portion of sushi rice on top of the nori sheet. Sprinkle sesame seeds on top of the sushi rice.
4cec7049-0e7b-46dc-a278-7085f68fa056 Place 1/4 portion of tuna mixture lengthwise on the rice.
4cec7049-0e7b-46dc-a278-7085f68fa056 Roll up the bamboo mat, pressing forward to shape the sushi into a cylinder.
4cec7049-0e7b-46dc-a278-7085f68fa056 Press the bamboo mat firmly and remove it from the sushi.
4cec7049-0e7b-46dc-a278-7085f68fa056 Repeat this process to make more rolls.
4cec7049-0e7b-46dc-a278-7085f68fa056 Wipe a knife with a wet cloth before slicing sushi. Cut the rolled sushi into bite-sized pieces.
4cec7049-0e7b-46dc-a278-7085f68fa056 Serve and enjoy!
9aaf5921-a8e2-460f-8121-e03bc223a261 Heat oven to 350 F.
9aaf5921-a8e2-460f-8121-e03bc223a261 Grease a 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
9aaf5921-a8e2-460f-8121-e03bc223a261 Cook pasta in boiling salted water following package directions; transfer to a colander to drain. Rinse with hot water and set aside.
9aaf5921-a8e2-460f-8121-e03bc223a261 In a medium saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat. Cook green onions and garlic for about 1 minute. Add flour and stir until blended and bubbly. Add the milk and chicken broth and cook, stirring, until thickened. Add 1 cup of the Parmesan cheese, sherry, pepper, and nutmeg. Stir in the tuna and peas, stir in the drained pasta, then taste and add salt, as needed.
9aaf5921-a8e2-460f-8121-e03bc223a261 Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese over the top.
9aaf5921-a8e2-460f-8121-e03bc223a261 Toss bread crumbs with the melted butter until well blended and sprinkle the crumbs over the Parmesan layer.
9aaf5921-a8e2-460f-8121-e03bc223a261 Bake the casserole for 25 minutes, or until browned and bubbly.
cb35a3da-727b-4619-a173-ce1e5793a1b1 Grease a 3-quart baking dish. Heat oven to 350 F.
cb35a3da-727b-4619-a173-ce1e5793a1b1 Cook pasta in boiling salted water following package directions; drain, rinse, and set aside.
cb35a3da-727b-4619-a173-ce1e5793a1b1 In a large skillet or sauté pan over medium-low heat, melt butter. Add celery and onion; cook, stirring frequently until vegetables are tender. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute longer.
cb35a3da-727b-4619-a173-ce1e5793a1b1 Stir the flour into the sauteed vegetable mixture along with the Creole seasoning and pepper. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gradually stir in the chicken broth and sherry. Bring to a simmer and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Stir in milk and about 1 1/2 cups of the cheese. Continue cooking until the mixture begins to simmer again and cheese has melted.
cb35a3da-727b-4619-a173-ce1e5793a1b1 Break tuna up and stir into the sauce along with the peas.
cb35a3da-727b-4619-a173-ce1e5793a1b1 Combine the sauce mixture with the drained pasta. Spoon into the prepared baking dish.
cb35a3da-727b-4619-a173-ce1e5793a1b1 Crush the crackers and combine with the remaining 1/2 cup of shredded cheese. Sprinkle over the casserole.
cb35a3da-727b-4619-a173-ce1e5793a1b1 Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until bubbly and lightly browned.
07bddcca-6d9d-4b6c-9dfd-bf056461da05 Cut peppers in half lengthwise; remove tops and seeds. Cook peppers in a small amount of boiling salted water for about 5 minutes; drain. Sprinkle peppers inside with a little salt; place in a shallow baking dish.
07bddcca-6d9d-4b6c-9dfd-bf056461da05 In a bowl, combine rice with tuna, celery, onion, pimiento, 1/2 teaspoon salt and dash pepper. Gently stir in mayonnaise until well blended.
07bddcca-6d9d-4b6c-9dfd-bf056461da05 Spoon tuna rice mixture into pepper shells. Pour about 1/2 cup of water into the baking dish around tuna and rice stuffed peppers. Sprinkle potato chip crumbs over top of each stuffed pepper.
07bddcca-6d9d-4b6c-9dfd-bf056461da05 Bake tuna and rice stuffed peppers at 350 F for 30 minutes.
2270a6a2-d025-4380-9116-499e8dc4bdf3 Combine the first 5 ingredients in a jar or covered container; shake to mix well.
2270a6a2-d025-4380-9116-499e8dc4bdf3 Put tuna in a food storage bag; add about 4 tablespoons of the mustard mixture.
2270a6a2-d025-4380-9116-499e8dc4bdf3 Seal the bag and let marinate for about 20 minutes.
2270a6a2-d025-4380-9116-499e8dc4bdf3 Brush the grill with olive oil and heat.
2270a6a2-d025-4380-9116-499e8dc4bdf3 Remove the tuna from the marinade and pour the marinade in a small saucepan.
2270a6a2-d025-4380-9116-499e8dc4bdf3 Bring marinade to a full boil; remove from heat and set aside.
2270a6a2-d025-4380-9116-499e8dc4bdf3 Grill the tuna over high heat for about 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or until done as desired.
2270a6a2-d025-4380-9116-499e8dc4bdf3 Drizzle with the hot marinade, if desired.
a8ee04aa-b638-4b8f-aff0-51f821fa3a8e In a bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, rice vinegar, garlic, and ginger.
a8ee04aa-b638-4b8f-aff0-51f821fa3a8e Lay the tuna fillets on a plate, season with salt and fresh-ground black pepper to taste, and spoon over half of the glaze, turning to coat evenly.
a8ee04aa-b638-4b8f-aff0-51f821fa3a8e Let the tuna fillets marinate for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
a8ee04aa-b638-4b8f-aff0-51f821fa3a8e Add the honey to the remaining half of the glaze and mix well.
a8ee04aa-b638-4b8f-aff0-51f821fa3a8e Heat an outdoor grill on high or make a hot fire in a charcoal grill.
a8ee04aa-b638-4b8f-aff0-51f821fa3a8e When the grates are hot, lightly oil them and place tuna fillets on the grill. Cook for about 2 minutes and turn them over, brushing the glaze over the cooked side. Grill 2 minutes more for medium-rare to medium.
a8ee04aa-b638-4b8f-aff0-51f821fa3a8e When the fish is cooked, transfer it to a plate and using a clean brush, spread the honey lime glaze over the other side of the fillet.
a8ee04aa-b638-4b8f-aff0-51f821fa3a8e Serve immediately with any remaining glaze.
5c784cc9-9068-40f9-944e-a138c55afe0d Gather the ingredients.
5c784cc9-9068-40f9-944e-a138c55afe0d Combine the tuna, chopped eggs, 3 tablespoons of mayonnaise, red onion, dill relish, and dill weed. Add more mayonnaise if needed and season with salt and pepper to taste.
5c784cc9-9068-40f9-944e-a138c55afe0d Serve this tuna salad in sandwiches or serve on lettuce leaves for a fabulous lunch.
5c784cc9-9068-40f9-944e-a138c55afe0d Enjoy.
4b67fc08-8edf-4b7c-9912-d86014d9cd34 Gather the ingredients.
4b67fc08-8edf-4b7c-9912-d86014d9cd34 Combine tuna, bell pepper, and green onions in medium bowl.
4b67fc08-8edf-4b7c-9912-d86014d9cd34 In small bowl, combine cheese, mayonnaise, sour cream, mustard, lemon juice, and basil leaves and blend well.
4b67fc08-8edf-4b7c-9912-d86014d9cd34 Add to tuna mixture and blend.
4b67fc08-8edf-4b7c-9912-d86014d9cd34 Serve and enjoy!
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Gather the ingredients.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Cut the nori in half to 4-by-7 1/2 inches.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Cut tuna into thin and long sticks 1/2-inch thick and 7 1/2-inch long.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Put the bamboo sushi mat flat on your work surface with the bamboo slats left to right, so you can roll the mat away from you.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Put a nori sheet on top of the bamboo mat (makisu) with one of the seaweed's long sides close to the front edge of the sushi mat (the edge near you).
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Spread about 3/4 cup of sushi rice on top of the nori sheet.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Place tuna horizontally on the rice.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Roll up the bamboo mat, pressing forward to shape the sushi into a cylinder. Roll from the front end of the mat guiding with the sushi mat toward the other end.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Tighten the rolls like roll cakes, pulling the mat to tighten, and pressing the bamboo mat firmly.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Remove the roll from the mat.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Repeat until all the rolls are made.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Wipe a knife with a wet cloth before slicing sushi. Cut the rolled sushi into bite-size pieces.
dd474d0e-de6b-4377-b193-f6370e069161 Serve right away with soy sauce and wasabi. Enjoy!
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Put water and about 1 teaspoon of salt into a large saucepan.
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Add the diced potatoes, carrots, celery and chopped onion.
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Cover and bring to a boil.
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes; remove from heat and set aside.
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Melt the butter in a small stock pot.
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Blend in the flour and stir until smooth.
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly. Continue cooking, stirring constantly, until the sauce is smooth and thickened.
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Add the cheddar cheese and stir until it's melted.
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Add the cooked vegetables with their liquid, the tuna, corn, and Tabasco to taste and continue cooking until the chowder is piping hot.
1f88475a-0e41-4f46-87e4-69f5ffa596a8 Add salt and pepper to taste and serve garnished with green onions or parsley, if desired.
f089164b-3a0b-4980-88b3-185b8c4aa61f Gather the ingredients.
f089164b-3a0b-4980-88b3-185b8c4aa61f Preheat oven to 400 F.
f089164b-3a0b-4980-88b3-185b8c4aa61f In a medium bowl, combine flaked tuna, cheese, chopped egg, mayonnaise, pickle relish, onion, sliced olives, if using, and salt; mix well.
f089164b-3a0b-4980-88b3-185b8c4aa61f Spoon tuna mixture into hot dog rolls; wrap each roll in foil. Place foil-wrapped sandwiches in the oven.
f089164b-3a0b-4980-88b3-185b8c4aa61f Bake for 10 minutes; serve hot.
f089164b-3a0b-4980-88b3-185b8c4aa61f Enjoy!
fea285d8-9ea5-46ee-9cb7-161dd6f4bf41 Cook the rice according to the directions. (As a general rule, one cup of rice can be gently simmered, covered, in 2 1/4 cups water for about 25 minutes, until the water is absorbed.) Allow the rice to cool thoroughly before mixing the salad.
fea285d8-9ea5-46ee-9cb7-161dd6f4bf41 Place the cooled rice in a large bowl with the tuna and vegetables.
fea285d8-9ea5-46ee-9cb7-161dd6f4bf41 In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise with the oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper and add it to the rice. Gently stir to mix everything well. Refrigerate the salad for about two hours before serving.
5014fbf1-22a7-44fa-8532-d3c8ab2b37e3 Combine olive oil, lemon juice, 3 tablespoons of the cilantro, garlic, shallots, cayenne pepper, cumin, black pepper, and salt. Mix well.
5014fbf1-22a7-44fa-8532-d3c8ab2b37e3 Place tuna steaks in a large resealable bag or a glass baking dish. Pour marinade over top. Turn to coat and then refrigerate for 30 minutes.
5014fbf1-22a7-44fa-8532-d3c8ab2b37e3 Brush the cooking grate of your grill with oil and then preheat.
5014fbf1-22a7-44fa-8532-d3c8ab2b37e3 Place tuna steaks on grill over high heat. Grill for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until they reach the desired doneness.
5014fbf1-22a7-44fa-8532-d3c8ab2b37e3 Remove from grill and serve with remaining cilantro
7dbe1b1c-4af0-447d-8c71-0d2ffdcdec99 Gather the ingredients.
7dbe1b1c-4af0-447d-8c71-0d2ffdcdec99 Preheat the oven to 400 F.
7dbe1b1c-4af0-447d-8c71-0d2ffdcdec99 In a small bowl combine the salt, oregano, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, chili powder, and black pepper.
7dbe1b1c-4af0-447d-8c71-0d2ffdcdec99 To a medium bowl, add the melted butter and the shrimp. Toss to coat. Add the spice mixture and toss again until the shrimp are coated in the seasoning.
7dbe1b1c-4af0-447d-8c71-0d2ffdcdec99 Set a large skillet, preferably cast-iron, over high heat. Lightly coat the pan with a little butter, oil, or pan spray. When hot, add the shrimp in a single layer and sear for about two minutes on each side. The seasoning will blacken and the shrimp will turn pink and opaque. Remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside.
7dbe1b1c-4af0-447d-8c71-0d2ffdcdec99 Add a single layer of tortilla chips to the cast iron pan and sprinkle some of the cheese on top. Add the rest of the chips and top with a little more cheese, peppers, cooked shrimp, and finally the remaining cheese.
7dbe1b1c-4af0-447d-8c71-0d2ffdcdec99 Bake the nachos until the cheese is melted and hot, 8 to 10 minutes.
7dbe1b1c-4af0-447d-8c71-0d2ffdcdec99 Remove from oven and top with chopped cilantro, if desired. Serve immediately.
0e6861b5-3edb-4056-a191-25a1d3fecf6c Gather the ingredients.
0e6861b5-3edb-4056-a191-25a1d3fecf6c After deveining and peeling the shrimp, pat them completely dry with paper towels. Season with half of the salt and pepper the shrimp and set aside. You can remove the tails if you wish.
0e6861b5-3edb-4056-a191-25a1d3fecf6c Heat the butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Once the butter is melted, add the shrimp to one side of the skillet and the asparagus to another. Sprinkle with the remaining salt and pepper and the dried basil.
0e6861b5-3edb-4056-a191-25a1d3fecf6c Cover, and cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until the asparagus is bright green and just tender and the shrimp is opaque. You can gently stir or toss the shrimp and asparagus as it cooks so they cook evenly.
0e6861b5-3edb-4056-a191-25a1d3fecf6c Add the garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, and parsley. Toss and continue cooking for another minute.
0e6861b5-3edb-4056-a191-25a1d3fecf6c Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.
db74ff8e-cf8c-4e6e-baca-2037156fa4e1 Gather the ingredients. Fill a large bowl with ice and place in the refrigerator while you prepare the broth.
db74ff8e-cf8c-4e6e-baca-2037156fa4e1 Add the water to a large pot, followed by the carrot, celery, onion, garlic, lemon, parsley, thyme, and bay leaves. Boil over high heat, then lower the heat to a simmer and cook for 10 to 30 minutes or until the vegetables are slightly softened and the broth is fragrant.
db74ff8e-cf8c-4e6e-baca-2037156fa4e1 Add the shrimp to the cooking liquid and turn off the heat. Leave the shrimp in the hot water, stirring occasionally, until they are pink and the tails have curled. This will take about 2 to 2 1/2 minutes. The larger the shrimp, the longer it will take.
db74ff8e-cf8c-4e6e-baca-2037156fa4e1 Remove the shrimp from the cooking liquid and promptly add them to the bowl of ice to cool quickly.
db74ff8e-cf8c-4e6e-baca-2037156fa4e1 Once they feel cool to the touch, remove the vein of the shrimp if you wish, then remove the shell down to the tail. Leave the tail on the shrimp. Place the shrimp on the serving platter, cover, and place in the refrigerator.
db74ff8e-cf8c-4e6e-baca-2037156fa4e1 While the shrimp continue to chill in the refrigerator, prepare the cocktail sauce.
db74ff8e-cf8c-4e6e-baca-2037156fa4e1 Add the ketchup, chili sauce, horseradish, lemon juice, lemon zest, garlic powder, hot sauce, and Worcestershire sauce to a bowl. Whisk together until completely combined.
db74ff8e-cf8c-4e6e-baca-2037156fa4e1 Serve the shrimp alongside the cocktail sauce and additional lemon slices.
3e7a52ef-d089-48f9-aeb1-32fad174e9c2 Gather your ingredients.
3e7a52ef-d089-48f9-aeb1-32fad174e9c2 Whisk together the garlic powder, paprika, Sriracha, salt, pepper, lime juice, and olive oil in a bowl. Throw in the shrimp and toss until they are completely coated.
3e7a52ef-d089-48f9-aeb1-32fad174e9c2 Grill the shrimp on high heat until cooked through, about 2 minutes per side. You can grill on an indoor griddle if you don't have an outdoor grill, or simply cook the shrimp in a large saute pan.
3e7a52ef-d089-48f9-aeb1-32fad174e9c2 Gather the coleslaw ingredients.
3e7a52ef-d089-48f9-aeb1-32fad174e9c2 Add the mayonnaise, sour cream, salt, pepper, garlic clove, Sriracha, and lime juice to your blender or food processor. Blend until completely smooth. Taste and adjust the salt and pepper as needed.
3e7a52ef-d089-48f9-aeb1-32fad174e9c2 Toss the dressing with the coleslaw in a large bowl until completely coated. Cover and refrigerate if you aren't using right away.
3e7a52ef-d089-48f9-aeb1-32fad174e9c2 Place the shrimp on top of the tortillas then add the coleslaw, cotija cheese, and cilantro. Then squeeze a little lime juice over the top. Dig in and enjoy!
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc Gather the ingredients.
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels until they are as dry as possible. Salt and pepper generously.
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc In a shallow dish, stir together the flour, garlic powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and 1/2 teaspoon of the pepper. Dredge the shrimp in the flour, coating both sides. Shake off the excess.
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc In another dish whisk together the eggs and the soy sauce. Dip the flour-coated shrimp in the beaten egg mixture, coating both sides completely so you cant see any flour.
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc In a third shallow dish, mix the shredded coconut and the panko breadcrumbs together until they are evenly dispersed. Add the rest of the salt and pepper to this mixture.
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc Transfer the shrimp to a baking sheet while you continue to bread the rest of the shrimp.
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc Add the shrimp in an even layer to the bottom of your air fryer. Coat with olive oil spray and cook on 400 F for 8 minutes, flipping them halfway through. You will need to cook them in two batches.
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc While the shrimp are air frying, prepare the sauce. Whisk together the sweet chili sauce, apricot preserves, and mayonnaise in a small bowl.
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc Remove the shrimp from the air fryer once they are golden brown.
821d35d8-efb2-47bc-aade-04c99df4bfdc Serve the shrimp with the sauce immediately. Top with chopped scallions and a squeeze of lime juice if you wish.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Gather the ingredients.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Cut off the root end of the green onions and slice them thinly, keeping the white and light green parts separate from the dark green parts. Set aside.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil to the Instant Pot inner pot and select the sauté button. When the oil is hot and shimmering, add the sliced andouille sausage. Cook the sausage slices for about 3 minutes, or until lightly browned, stirring frequently. With a slotted spoon, remove the sausage to paper towels to drain and set aside.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Add the diced chicken to the pot along with the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of vegetable oil; cook for 2 to 3 minutes, or until lightly browned, stirring frequently. With a slotted spoon, remove the chicken to a plate and set aside.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Add the chopped yellow onion to the pot along with the bell pepper and celery. If necessary, add more vegetable oil. Cook for about 3 minutes, or until the onion is translucent, stirring frequently.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Add the minced garlic, Creole seasonings, and thyme to the vegetables and cook for 1 minute longer. Cancel the sauté function.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Add the bay leaf and chicken stock. Stir, scraping the bottom to ensure there are no browned bits stuck to the pan. Taste and add salt if needed.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Add the tomatoes (with their juices) along with the rice and the white and light green parts of the sliced green onions. Return the sausage and chicken to the pot. Stir to combine the ingredients.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Lock the lid in place and turn the steam release knob to the sealing position. Select the manual or pressure cook button (high pressure) and set the timer to 7 minutes. When the time is up, do a quick release following the manufacturer's instructions. When the float valve drops, remove the coverthe pot will automatically switch to the keep warm setting.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Add the shrimp to the pot and stir to combine the ingredients. Cover the pot and let it stand on the warm setting for 10 minutes. The shrimp should be cooked through.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Remove the cover and stir in about half of the reserved dark green parts of the sliced green onions.
33434850-85e8-4852-9fe7-5164ec7eee16 Garnish servings with the remaining dark green parts of the green onions and chopped parsley, if desired.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Gather your ingredients.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Cut the romaine hearts in half lengthwise. Brush them with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Place the romaine hearts directly on the grill and quickly char them. You don't want the lettuce to be completely wilted, just a nice, quick char. Place them on a plate to cool.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Gather your charred corn ingredients. If you are using corn on the cob, follow the directions in the variations section. Place the olive oil, salt, pepper, and corn in a sauce pan. Heat on high heat.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Cook the corn until charred. Shake and toss the pan every few minutes so that both sides of each kernel are cooked.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b While the corn is cooking, make the dressing.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Combine all of the dressing ingredients (except the olive oil) in a blender or food processor and blend until completely smooth. Drizzle in the olive oil as you are blending. Add more water if the dressing is too thick.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Place the peeled shrimp onto skewers. Use a few tablespoons of the dressing to brush over both sides of the shrimp.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Add them to the grill and grill for a few minutes on both sides, or until cooked through. Brush with more dressing as you are grilling. Just make sure to keep that portion of dressing separate so you don't cross-contaminate the salad.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Roughly chop the romaine.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Add the romaine and the other chopped vegetables, including the corn, to a bowl. Add 1/4 cup of the dressing and toss together until the salad is lightly dressed.
80049091-0bd2-43d8-8652-6d998f22317b Divide the salad among four bowls, and top each salad with the shrimp, cotija cheese, avocado, and an extra drizzle of dressing. Serve immediately, and enjoy!
f6d9c8cc-5a88-49b1-9971-bda4954f4799 Gather the ingredients.
f6d9c8cc-5a88-49b1-9971-bda4954f4799 In a medium bowl whisk together honey, soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, onion salt, and red pepper.
f6d9c8cc-5a88-49b1-9971-bda4954f4799 Place shrimp in a large bowl and pour half the marinade mixture on top. Toss well to coat the shrimp fully. Cover with plastic wrap and allow the shrimp to marinate in the refrigerator for at least an hour or up to 12 hours. Cover and refrigerate remaining marinade.
f6d9c8cc-5a88-49b1-9971-bda4954f4799 Heat olive oil in a large heavy-bottomed skillet or cast iron over medium-high heat until oil is shimmering.
f6d9c8cc-5a88-49b1-9971-bda4954f4799 Place shrimp in the skillet and cook one side until pink, about 1 minute. Then flip shrimp and pour the remaining marinade over the shrimp. Cook about 1 minute more then remove to a serving plate along with the sauce.
f6d9c8cc-5a88-49b1-9971-bda4954f4799 Serve over rice, garnished with chopped green onions. Serve with green vegetables on the side, if desired.
41583b10-eab7-4078-8ed9-521536924674 Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water according to package instructions. For the final 5 minutes of cooking, place a steamer over the boiling water and gently steam the broccoli, haricot verts, and peas until they are bright green and just-tender about 4 minutes. (If you do not have a steamer, bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add the broccoli, beans and peas and cook for 4 minutes.) Drain and set aside in the pan covered with a kitchen towel.
41583b10-eab7-4078-8ed9-521536924674 Heat the butter in a large frying pan, add the garlic and gently fry for one minute taking care not to burn. Add the shrimp and cook for 4 minutes turning frequently. Once pink and cooked through, spoon the shrimp into a bowl to reserve and cover with a kitchen towel.
41583b10-eab7-4078-8ed9-521536924674 Once cooked, drain the pasta, reserving ¼ cup of the pasta water and set aside. Transfer the pasta to the frying pan, add the broccoi, haricot verts, peas, and reserved pasta water. Return the pan to medium heat and gently stir to reheat the pasta and vegetables. Add the cherry tomatoes, shrimp and parmesan and stir through the pasta. Finally, tear the basil into small pieces and stir through.
41583b10-eab7-4078-8ed9-521536924674 Serve the pasta immediately in four warmed pasta bowls and sprinkle with the lemon zest and red pepper flakes. Serve at once.
afcca26c-f407-43ac-b821-2d23175d4d4a Gather the ingredients.
afcca26c-f407-43ac-b821-2d23175d4d4a Combine the chili powder, paprika, Italian seasoning, cayenne, cumin, garlic powder, brown sugar, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
afcca26c-f407-43ac-b821-2d23175d4d4a In a medium bowl mix the seasoning mixture with the shrimp and mix well. Set aside to marinate for 30 minutes.
afcca26c-f407-43ac-b821-2d23175d4d4a Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high. Arrange the shrimp in a single layer and cook for 2 minutes. Flip and cook for another 2 minutes.
afcca26c-f407-43ac-b821-2d23175d4d4a Add the garlic, stir, and cook for 30 seconds.
afcca26c-f407-43ac-b821-2d23175d4d4a Garnish with lime wedges to serve.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Gather your ingredients and start by making the pesto.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Place the basil and garlic into a food processor and pulse several times.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 With the motor running continuously, slowly add the olive oil through the top funnel to form a thick (but not oily) paste. You may need less olive oil than the recipe states.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Add the Pecorino and Parmesan and pulse two or three times.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Finally, add the pine nuts (pignoli) and stir. Taste and add a tiny pinch of salt if needed. Scoop the pesto into a bowl, cover with a tea cloth, and put to one side.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Cook the tagliatelle according to the packet instructions in a large volume of boiling lightly salted water (approximately 8 to 10 minutes). The pasta should be slightly firm (al dente).
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 While the pasta is cooking, check over the shrimp to make sure they are clean and there is no black vein remaining down the back. If there is, wipe with a paper towel.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Heat the oil in a non-stick skillet to hot, but not smoking. Add the shrimp and fry until the shrimp are pink through to the middle. Remove from the pan and keep warm.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Add the halved cherry tomatoes to the pan you cooked the shrimp in, sprinkle with a tiny pinch of salt, and cook over a medium for 3 to 4 minutes to soften the tomatoes. Keep warm.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Drain the pasta reserving a cup of the cooking water.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Toss the pasta in a large warmed bowl. Stir the pesto through one tablespoon at a time until you have the strength of taste you want; pesto is a very strong flavoured, so be careful not to drown the pasta. If the pasta feels a little dry, add a bit of the cooking water and stir through.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Add the shrimp and cherry tomatoes, stir again.
97d97160-9daa-4ee3-8314-17ee753eb439 Serve immediately in warmed pasta bowls. The shrimp pesto is also good cold and served as a summer salad.
f5fbba17-512b-4f7f-b5a6-8883e52a839c Gather the ingredients.
f5fbba17-512b-4f7f-b5a6-8883e52a839c Preheat the oven to 400 F or the grill to medium-high (about 400 F). If using frozen shrimp place the package under cold water for 10 minutes to thaw.
f5fbba17-512b-4f7f-b5a6-8883e52a839c Bring 2 quarts of water to a roaring boil and add the potatoes and the corn. Reduce the heat and bring to simmer. Cook for 10 minutes on simmer and drain into a colander. Set aside.
f5fbba17-512b-4f7f-b5a6-8883e52a839c While the potatoes and corn are simmering prepare 4 sets of 12 x 24 inch long aluminum foil sheets. Fold each in half, forming a square. If using industrial aluminum foil simply prepare sheets measuring 12 x 12 inches. Slightly fold up the edges of the sheets.
f5fbba17-512b-4f7f-b5a6-8883e52a839c In a large bowl combine the drained potatoes and corn, the sausage, the thawed shrimp, the onion, and the garlic. Drizzle with the 4 tablespoons of melted butter, season with salt, pepper, and Old Bay seasoning. Mix very well to coat all ingredients.
f5fbba17-512b-4f7f-b5a6-8883e52a839c Divide the shrimp boil ingredients between the four aluminum foil sheets.
f5fbba17-512b-4f7f-b5a6-8883e52a839c Neatly fold into packets.
f5fbba17-512b-4f7f-b5a6-8883e52a839c Place them onto a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. If grilling, place the packets directly onto the grill surface and cook for 15 minutes, flipping once after about 8 minutes.
f5fbba17-512b-4f7f-b5a6-8883e52a839c Serve the packets slightly opened up, garnished with chopped parsley, a pinch of Old Bay seasoning and a few lemon wedges. Serve the 1 stick melted butter as a side for optional drizzling over the shrimp boil or dipping.
46aa1f6b-e14b-4a57-83dd-7418cb26825d Remove the shells from the shrimp. With a sharp knife, make a shallow cut down the back of a shrimp and pull the dark vein out. If the vein doesn't come out easily, scrape it out with the tip of the knife. The vein is the digestive system of the shrimp, so it should be removed. Repeat with the remaining shrimp. Rinse well, chop large shrimp coarsely. Leave small to medium shrimp whole, if desired. Transfer the shrimp to a large bowl.
46aa1f6b-e14b-4a57-83dd-7418cb26825d To the bowl with the shrimp, add the lobster, scallops, or crabmeat along with the sherry, lemon juice, and nutmeg. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for about 45 minutes to 1 hour.
46aa1f6b-e14b-4a57-83dd-7418cb26825d Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the flour and continue cooking for about 3 minutes while stirring constantly. Gradually whisk in about 1/4 cup of the half-and-half. Gradually add the remaining half-and-half, whisking constantly. Add the salt and continue cooking until bubbling and thickened.
46aa1f6b-e14b-4a57-83dd-7418cb26825d In a bowl, whisk the heavy cream with the egg yolk. Add to the thickened sauce while whisking constantly. Stir in the cheese and continue cooking until the cheese has melted.
46aa1f6b-e14b-4a57-83dd-7418cb26825d Add the seafood to the sauce and cook for about 10 minutes, or until the seafood is thoroughly cooked.
46aa1f6b-e14b-4a57-83dd-7418cb26825d Spoon the seafood Newburg over toast points, puff pastry shells, or hot cooked rice or noodles. Or serve the seafood over freshly baked biscuits.
46aa1f6b-e14b-4a57-83dd-7418cb26825d Sprinkle with paprika or garnish with fresh chopped parsley, as desired.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Gather the ingredients.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Prepare the cabbage by first removing the hard core. The core of the cabbage is shaped like a cone. If the cabbage is standing upright, the "mouth" of the "cone" is at the bottom. The opposite end of the cone ends about an inch or two below the top side of the cabbage. First, cut off the cone-shaped core. Position the cabbage with the base on top. Using a sharp, pointed knife held at a slight angle, cut into the core of the cabbage stopping about an inch or two from the opposite end. Rotating the cabbage little by little, repeat until you have cut around the base of the cire. If you did the procedure correctly, you should be able to pull out the entire core without much resistance.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Next, boil the cabbage until softened. Drop the cabbage into a pot with the hole pointing upward. Pour boiling water into the pot (I pour the boiling water directly into the hole) until the cabbage is completely submerged.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Place a heavy heatproof plate to keep the cabbage underwater.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Boil until softened. Depending on the size of the cabbage, this can take anywhere from 7 to 15 minutes.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Scoop out the cabbage, plunge in iced water and drain.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Separate the cabbage leaves taking care not to tear them. You need 12 to 16 whole cabbage leaves (you won't be able to use the small ones; keep them for another use). Using a small, sharp knife, cut off the thick white portion in the middle of each leaf. Start at the middle of each leaf and cut all the way down using as though paring a potato. The cabbage leaves are now ready to be used as wrappers.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Blanch the onion leaves in boiling water for a few seconds to wilt. Rinse well.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Peel and finely chop the shallots (or onions) and carrots.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Crush, peel, and finely mince the garlic.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Place the ground pork and minced shrimp in a bowl and add the chopped shallots, carrots, garlic, and cilantro. Season with fish sauce and ground pepper.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Lay a cabbage roll flat, the core end nearest you. Place 1 to 2 tablespoonfuls of filling at the center of the cabbage leaf.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Take the edge nearest you, fold over the filling.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Take the side edges and fold in.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Roll the whole thing outward to close and seal.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Take an onion leaf and use it to tie the cabbage roll. Repeat until all the cabbage leaves are stuffed and tied.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c In a large cooking pot, bring the broth to a boil. Drop the cabbage rolls one by one. Wait until the broth is boiling once more then lower the heat, cover, and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.
12e3b2c6-f0f8-4579-973d-f1ac81093e0c Serve hot and enjoy!
aa313c84-05f6-4770-bb19-9631a22130e0 Gather the ingredients.
aa313c84-05f6-4770-bb19-9631a22130e0 Prepare the white or brown rice ahead of time. If you have a rice cooker, use the keep warm setting when it is done cooking. If you are using a stove top, start making the rice five or ten minutes before you start the rest of the cooking.
aa313c84-05f6-4770-bb19-9631a22130e0 Whisk together the vinegar, sugar, and water in a saucepan on medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Remove the vinegar mixture from the heat and pour it over the sliced radishes and place in a covered container in the refrigerator while you finish cooking the shrimp. You can also make this up to a week in advance. The flavor will intensify the longer it has to soak.
aa313c84-05f6-4770-bb19-9631a22130e0 Toss the shrimp (tails off) in the corn starch until completely coated. Then shake the excess corn starch off of the shrimp and set them on a plate while you prepare the sauce.
aa313c84-05f6-4770-bb19-9631a22130e0 Whisk together the greek yogurt, mayonnaise, chili sauce and Sriracha in a medium sized mixing bowl and set aside while you cook the shrimp.
aa313c84-05f6-4770-bb19-9631a22130e0 Heat a non-stick skillet (a regular skillet will work as well) on medium heat and coat generously with cooking spray (a tablespoon of vegetable oil will also work). Place the shrimp in the hot pan and cook for 2 minutes per side or until cooked through and crisp. If you aren't concerned with calories you can also deep fry them in a deep fryer.
aa313c84-05f6-4770-bb19-9631a22130e0 Toss the shrimp in the chili mayonnaise sauce and serve it immediately on top of the hot cooked rice. Top with the drained pickled radishes, scallions, and sesame seeds.
b2595ef3-dfad-4ac7-a682-68fc253c28df Gather the ingredients.
b2595ef3-dfad-4ac7-a682-68fc253c28df If using uncooked baby shrimp, boil 3 to 5 minutes then drain. Be sure to pat dry.
b2595ef3-dfad-4ac7-a682-68fc253c28df Place dried coconut into a frying pan to toast it. Turn on the heat to medium-high and stir the coconut continuously, "dry frying" until it turns golden (1 to 2 minutes). Place toasted coconut in a mixing bowl.
b2595ef3-dfad-4ac7-a682-68fc253c28df If using dried shrimp, place it in a food processor and process into powder-like bits. A pestle & mortar works well for this too. Add the powdered shrimp to the coconut in the mixing bowl.
b2595ef3-dfad-4ac7-a682-68fc253c28df Grind up the peanuts, reducing them to very small pieces (you can also chop/crush them finely with a knife), and add them to the bowl.
b2595ef3-dfad-4ac7-a682-68fc253c28df Put garlic and galangal/ginger into the food processor and process, or finely mince/grate. (Remove any fibrous or "stringy" bits from the galangal/ginger.) Add to the bowl.
b2595ef3-dfad-4ac7-a682-68fc253c28df Now add the chili powder, chili, and fish sauce. Stir well. Note: At this point you can do a taste-test, adding more chili if you'd prefer it spicier, or more fish sauce if you'd prefer it saltier. If you'd like some sweet notes, add 1/4 tsp. white sugar. You should be able to taste a little of each flavor.
b2595ef3-dfad-4ac7-a682-68fc253c28df To plate appetizer, arrange 4 or more leaves (spinach, lettuce, banana leaf segments - diamond shape look nice) on a platter. Spoon some of the filling onto each leaf. Top with more toasted coconut and serve with wedges of lime.
09126883-b5a2-46fe-9da9-4f27f8c6ae0d Heat a skillet over medium high heat.
09126883-b5a2-46fe-9da9-4f27f8c6ae0d Once hot, add in the cooking oil and red curry paste. Whisk for about 30 seconds.
09126883-b5a2-46fe-9da9-4f27f8c6ae0d Pour in the coconut milk and continue whisking. Add in the mushrooms and the red peppers and continue cooking for 3 minutes.
09126883-b5a2-46fe-9da9-4f27f8c6ae0d Add the shrimp to the curry and cook for another 2 minutes. Stir in the basil and serve over cooked rice.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 Gather the ingredients.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 In a skillet over medium heat, brown the sliced sausage in 2 to 3 teaspoons of vegetable oil; remove the sausage to a plate and set aside.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 In a large stockpot or Dutch oven, combine the chicken broth and tomatoes. Place the pot over medium heat to bring to a simmer.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium-high heat, combine the 1/2 cup of oil and the flour. Cook, whisking constantly until the roux is medium to deep brown. Don't let the mixture burn, or you will have to start over with fresh oil and flour.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 To the skillet with the roux, add the chopped onion, celery, and bell pepper; cook, stirring constantly with a spoon until vegetables are softened. Stir the vegetable and roux mixture into the simmering tomato and broth mixture.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 Put the skillet back on the heat and add 2 more teaspoons of oil; reduce to medium heat. Add the okra and cook, stirring, until lightly browned and not stringy or sticky.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 Transfer the cooked okra to the simmering pot along with the Creole or Cajun seasoning, the bay leaf, and cooked sausage. Cover and cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, for 1 hour.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 Add the prepared shrimp and cook for about 10 minutes longer, until the shrimp is cooked through.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed.
f5a0c558-f586-4b45-9ba2-a7ca36fb5ab9 Serve the gumbo over a mound of hot boiled long-grain white rice. Sprinkle with chopped fresh parsley or green onions.
d38ce920-cdae-4650-8a83-b6ecd8995ecd Cook the pasta according to package directions, making sure to salt the cooking water generously. Drain and place in a shallow serving bowl.
d38ce920-cdae-4650-8a83-b6ecd8995ecd Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in large skillet over medium-low heat. Sauté the garlic for 2 minutes, until softened (do not allow it to brown). Turn the heat to medium-high, add the shrimp, and scallions and pepper flakes, if using, and cook, stirring frequently, until the shrimp just turn pink and cook through, about 4 minutes. Remove to a bowl.
d38ce920-cdae-4650-8a83-b6ecd8995ecd Dont wipe out the pan! Return it to medium-high heat, add the broth, bring to a simmer then add the lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper. Return the shrimp mixture to the pan, then pour the whole thing over the cooked pasta, toss well, and serve it up (adding in any fresh minced herbs you like).
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab Gather ingredients.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab First, clarify the butter. Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan over low heat. Let it simmer until the foam rises to the top. Once the butter stops making crackling noises and there is no longer any foam rising to the top, remove from the heat and let it cool slightly. Most of the solids will be on the bottom. Skim off any foam with a spoon. Strain through a cheesecloth-lined strainer.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab After clarifying the butter, you will have about 4 to 5 tablespoons for the roux.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab Chop the onions, celery, bell pepper, and garlic. Set aside.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab Put the clarified butter in a Dutch oven or large heavy saucepan. Heat over medium-low heat and add the flour.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab Cook, whisking constantly, until the roux is golden brown, about the color of peanut butter.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab Add the chopped vegetables to the roux and continue cooking, stirring frequently, until the onions are translucent, about 10 to 12 minutes.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab Add the clam juice or shrimp stock and tomatoes, along with 1 tablespoon of the Creole seasoning, bay leaf, and ground black pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 to 45 minutes or until the vegetables are softened.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab If the sauce mixture seems too thick, thin it with a little more clam juice, shrimp stock, or some chicken broth.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab Taste and add more Creole seasoning and salt, as needed.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab Add the shrimp and continue cooking for about 3 to 4 minutes or until the shrimp are cooked through.
6de3d02d-c5f5-4abd-ad0d-b4da652b67ab For each serving, put a big scoop of rice in the center of a deep plate or shallow bowl. Spoon the shrimp étouffée around the rice. Sprinkle with a little fresh chopped parsley or green onion tops. Serve with a simple tossed salad and crusty French bread or rolls.
52d3f5d7-4bd0-478e-8197-590f5ce50b4f Pour stock plus lemongrass and lime leaves in a deep soup pot over medium-high heat. If using fresh lemongrass, also add the upper stalk pieces for extra flavor. Bring to a boil.
52d3f5d7-4bd0-478e-8197-590f5ce50b4f Add garlic, galangal or ginger, chili, and mushrooms (if using). Reduce heat to medium and simmer 2 to 3 minutes, or until mushrooms are soft.
52d3f5d7-4bd0-478e-8197-590f5ce50b4f Add the shrimp, any other seafood you're using, tomato, and baby bok choy (if using). Simmer over medium heat 3 to 4 minutes, or until shrimp turns pink and plump and mussels have opened. Scallops, crab, and fish should all be firm to the touch and no longer translucent.
52d3f5d7-4bd0-478e-8197-590f5ce50b4f Reduce heat to medium-low and add the coconut milk, fish sauce, soy sauce, lime juice, and sugar. Stir well to combine and gently simmer until hot (do not boil at this point). Taste-test the soup for salt and spice, adding more fish sauce instead of salt (about 1 more tablespoon), or more chili as desired. If too sour, add more sugar. If too spicy for your taste or if you'd like it creamier, add more coconut milk. If too salty, add another squeeze of lime juice.
52d3f5d7-4bd0-478e-8197-590f5ce50b4f Serve in bowls with fresh coriander sprinkled over. For an extra hit of flavor, you can also add some Thai chili sauce, Nam Prik Pao, either store-bought or homemade.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a Gather the ingredients.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a Melt the butter in a Dutch oven or large saucepan over medium-low heat; add the chopped green onion and celery. Sauté, stirring, until tender.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a Blend the flour into the butter and vegetables until well incorporated. Continue cooking, stirring, for about 2 minutes.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a Warm the milk in another saucepan over medium heat.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a Slowly stir the warmed milk into the butter and vegetables. Continue cooking, stirring until thickened.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a Add the freshly ground black pepper, tomato paste, and heavy cream.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a If desired, puree the soup in a blender or food processor (see the tips) at this point and then return it to the saucepan.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a Stir in the shrimp, crab, and the sherry. Bring it to a simmer.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a Serve hot, garnished with parsley, cilantro, and/or chopped green onion tops.
8ded07bc-cffc-4cbd-9e54-6c4777ac586a Enjoy!
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 Gather the ingredients.
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 If using old rice, pour 1 to 2 tsp. coconut oil or other vegetable oil onto your fingers and then run fingers through the rice, separating any chunks back into grains. Set aside.
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 In a cup, stir the soy sauce/fish sauce together with the curry powder. Set aside.
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 Drizzle 1 to 2 tbsp. oil in a wok/large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add shallots, garlic, and chili, stir-frying until fragrant (1 minute). Add shrimp at this point (if using). Whenever the wok/pan becomes dry, add a little stock (1/2 to 1 tbsp. at a time to keep ingredients sizzling).
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 Push ingredients aside and crack an egg into the wok, stirring quickly to cook (like making scrambled eggs).
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 Add the carrot (if using) and peas. Stir-fry 1 minute in the same way, adding more stock if needed.
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 Add the rice, pineapple chunks, cashews, and raisins/currents.
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 Drizzle the fish/soy sauce mixed with curry powder over and gently stir-fry to combine over medium-high to high heat until the rice "dances" (begins to make popping sounds)about 3 minutes.
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 Remove from heat. Do a taste-test for saltiness, adding more fish sauce or soy sauce until desired taste is achieved. If you happen to over-salt the dish, add a squeeze or two of lime juice.
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 To serve, scoop rice onto a serving platter or individual plates and top with spring onions and coriander.
f2f72cb6-6876-4e6d-a6e9-de0174e00631 Enjoy!
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 Gather the ingredients.
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 Chop the shrimp into 3 to 4 pieces each and transfer to a bowl.
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 Add the marinade ingredients to the bowl and marinate for 15 minutes.
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 Heat the wok over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon oil.
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 When oil is hot, pour 1/2 the beaten egg into the wok and scramble until just cooked through. Transfer egg to a plate and wipe out wok.
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 Heat the wok over medium-high heat and add 2 tablespoons of oil.
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 When oil is hot, stir fry the onion, peas, and shrimp on high heat for 2 to 3 minutes, remove and set aside.
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 Add another tablespoon of oil to the pan, reduce heat to medium, and stir fry the rice with soy sauce and oyster sauce.
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 Add the other ingredients and combine thoroughly.
9de581cf-32b5-495d-b370-4898737b61c7 Serve garnished with more sliced green onions.
87090752-64f2-42bd-8a09-4dba5906f79f Gather the ingredients.
87090752-64f2-42bd-8a09-4dba5906f79f Place the pineapple on a cutting board. Holding it securely with one hand, cut it lengthwise into halves. Scoop out the flesh from both halves, leaving about an inch of flesh attached to the skin.
87090752-64f2-42bd-8a09-4dba5906f79f Take the pineapple flesh and dice. Measure a cup; reserve the rest for another dish or for munching.
87090752-64f2-42bd-8a09-4dba5906f79f Save any juices that drip off.
87090752-64f2-42bd-8a09-4dba5906f79f Heat the cooking oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the shrimps. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Stir fry just until the shrimps change color. Scoop out and transfer to a bowl. Set aside.
