87090752-64f2-42bd-8a09-4dba5906f79f Add the garlic, ginger, chili, shallots, tomatoes and bell peppers to the hot oil. Drizzle in about a tablespoonful of fish sauce and stir fry for half a minute. Add the ham and continue stir-frying for another half a minute.
87090752-64f2-42bd-8a09-4dba5906f79f Add the rice to the vegetables and ham. Drizzle in more fish sauce and the pineapple juice. Stir fry for a minute.
87090752-64f2-42bd-8a09-4dba5906f79f Finally, add the pineapple chunks, shrimps and cashew nuts. Continue stir-frying for another minute. Taste the rice, adjust the seasonings if needed.
87090752-64f2-42bd-8a09-4dba5906f79f Ladle the rice into the hollowed pineapple halves. Sprinkle with scallions. Serve at once.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 In a large Dutch oven bring to a boil the water with bay leaves, lemon juice, onion wedges, salt, pepper, and parsley.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 Wash shrimp and add it (unpeeled) to stock; boil for 2 minutes.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 Peel shrimp. Return shells to the stock in the Dutch oven and set aside for later use.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 Put shrimp and crab meat in the refrigerator for the time being.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 Saute the sliced okra in 2 tablespoons bacon grease or butter in a large heavy skillet or sauté pan.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 When okra is soft, transfer to a stew pot and add the tomatoes. Stir well.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 Clean skillet and heat remaining 2 tablespoons bacon grease, butter, or duck fat. Sauté the chopped onion, green pepper, and red pepper until softened; add to the stew pot with the tomatoes and okra.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 In a saucepan, warm the roux; strain the reserved shrimp stock and stir about 2 quarts of the stock into the roux.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 When well-blended, add to the large stew pot with the other ingredients.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 Bring to a boil and simmer for 1 1/2 hours, adding more strained stock if needed.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 Taste and add salt, pepper, thyme, and parsley to taste. Simmer for 1 to 2 hours longer; add the reserved shrimp and crab meat and cook for 15 minutes longer.
3ee09afd-de07-46c2-aca7-4c4e49dbc784 Serve with hot boiled rice, if desired.
25ebaa9a-163b-46b3-b24a-050dc21e031f Cook the pasta in boiling salted water following the package directions. Drain the pasta in a colander and rinse with cold water. Set aside.
25ebaa9a-163b-46b3-b24a-050dc21e031f In a large serving bowl, combine the mayonnaise, seasonings, and mustard; whisk to blend thoroughly.
25ebaa9a-163b-46b3-b24a-050dc21e031f Add the chopped celery, diced tomatoes, and green onions. Mix well.
25ebaa9a-163b-46b3-b24a-050dc21e031f Add the cooked shrimp and pasta to the bowl. Gently combine until well blended.
25ebaa9a-163b-46b3-b24a-050dc21e031f Refrigerate the salad for at least an hour or two before serving.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Gather the ingredients.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Soften the mushrooms by soaking in hot water for 20 to 30 minutes. Squeeze out any excess water. Cut off the stems and slice finely.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Cut the pork into matchsticks. Add the soy sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch. Marinate for 15 minutes.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Rinse the shrimp under warm running water. Pat dry with paper towels. Chop finely. Toss with the rice wine and cornstarch. Marinate for 15 minutes.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Rinse the mung bean sprouts and drain thoroughly. Wash the red bell pepper and dice. Wash and dice the garlic chives. Wash and shred the carrots and cabbage.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b In a small bowl, mix together the sauce ingredients. Set aside. Heat the wok over medium-high to high heat. When the oil is hot, add 2 tablespoons oil. When the oil is hot, add the garlic and stir-fry until aromatic. Add the pork.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Stir-fry until it turns white and is about 80 percent cooked through. Remove from the wok and drain on paper towels.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Add 2 tablespoons oil. When the oil is hot, add the ginger. Stir-fry until aromatic. Add the shrimp. Stir-fry until they turn pink. Remove from the wok and drain.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Add 2 tablespoons oil. When the oil is hot, add the vegetables, one at a time, beginning with the mushrooms, then the red bell pepper, cabbage, garlic chives, shredded carrot, and mung bean sprouts.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Add the sauce to the wok. Add the pork and shrimp back into the pan. Heat through. Remove and cool.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Clean out the wok. Preheat the oil for deep-frying to 360 degrees Fahrenheit while preparing the spring rolls.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Lay a spring roll wrapper in front of you so that it forms a diamond shape.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Use your index finger to wet all the edges with water or a cornstarch/water paste. Place approximately 2 tablespoons of filling near the bottom. Rollover once, tuck in the sides and then continue rolling. Seal the top.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Deep-fry the spring rolls in 3 to 4 batches, cooking until they are golden brown and crispy (about 3 minutes). Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
f3397020-c615-4d4b-a925-8f1e58471e6b Serve the spring rolls with the plum sauce and hot mustard for dipping.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf Gather the ingredients.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf Peel and devein the shrimp.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf In a small bowl, toss shrimp with garlic and basil. Refrigerate while linguine is cooking.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf Cook linguine in boiling salted water following the package directions.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf Spray a 1 1/2-quart baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Spoon half the tomatoes into the baking dish; top with linguine.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf Preheat oven to 350 F.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf In the same pot that you cooked the linguine in or a skillet, melt butter with olive oil over medium heat. Add sliced green onions; cook for 1 minute. Add shrimp mixture, peas, wine, salt and pepper, and the remaining tomatoes; cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf Pour the shrimp mixture over linguine in the baking dish then top with the mozzarella cheese.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf Bake for 20 minutes.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf Serve with freshly grated Parmesan cheese, if desired.
d9b5815d-0f20-4a11-8ac0-50cce79d2ddf Enjoy!
d708f0eb-8ce5-4e28-a4d5-d45334dad30e Gather the ingredients.
d708f0eb-8ce5-4e28-a4d5-d45334dad30e Soak the shrimp in warm, lightly salted water for 5 minutes.
d708f0eb-8ce5-4e28-a4d5-d45334dad30e Rinse in cold water, drain and pat dry with paper towels.
d708f0eb-8ce5-4e28-a4d5-d45334dad30e Lightly coat the shrimp with the tapioca starch or cornstarch.
d708f0eb-8ce5-4e28-a4d5-d45334dad30e In a small bowl, mix the salt with the freshly ground peppercorns and set aside.
d708f0eb-8ce5-4e28-a4d5-d45334dad30e Heat the oil to 360 F in a deep fat fryer, heavy saucepan with deep sides, or a second wok (it is easiest not to deep-fry and stir-fry the shrimp in the same wok). Carefully add the shrimp to the hot oil, 4 to 5 at a time, and deep-fry until they turn bright orange (about 40 seconds). Make sure the temperature does not fall below 350 F.
d708f0eb-8ce5-4e28-a4d5-d45334dad30e Carefully remove the shrimp with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Continue deep-frying the remainder of the shrimp.
d708f0eb-8ce5-4e28-a4d5-d45334dad30e Heat a wok over medium heat. Add the salt and pepper mixture and the deep-fried shrimp. Stir-fry briefly to coat the shrimp in the mixture (20 to 30 seconds).
d708f0eb-8ce5-4e28-a4d5-d45334dad30e Serve hot and enjoy!
5b840dfb-f39b-4a5e-8ef2-9a584e87c03f In a bowl, stir together the vinegar and sugar until the sugar is dissolved. Fold in the strawberries, cover, and chill for at least one hour. Remove from the fridge when you're ready to start cooking.
5b840dfb-f39b-4a5e-8ef2-9a584e87c03f Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute the shallots until softened, then add the leaves and turn until well mixed. Cook just a minute or two until all the leaves have wilted but are still fully green. Remove greens to a strainer and keep warm. (See cook's notes below)
5b840dfb-f39b-4a5e-8ef2-9a584e87c03f Dry the scallops and shrimp well and sprinkle with the coarse salt. Heat a skillet or saute pan over medium-high heat until quite hot. Add the grapeseed or light olive oil, let the oil heat a moment, then carefully add the scallops and shrimp (there will be some spattering.)
5b840dfb-f39b-4a5e-8ef2-9a584e87c03f Let the shrimp sear for about one minute per side until just opaque. Remove and keep warm. Don't move the scallops until you can see a brown edge forming around the bottom (about two to two and a half minutes.) Carefully lift one scallopif the surface has a nice caramelized color, turn it over.
5b840dfb-f39b-4a5e-8ef2-9a584e87c03f Cook for just another minute until the scallops are springy but not quite firm. (See cook's notes below) Remove the scallops and keep warm.
5b840dfb-f39b-4a5e-8ef2-9a584e87c03f Wipe out the pan, and then add the strawberries and vinegar. Remove the strawberries after they are heated through (about 30 seconds) and let the balsamic cook down briefly until thickened to a syrupy consistency.
5b840dfb-f39b-4a5e-8ef2-9a584e87c03f To serve, place the green on a plate, top with the scallops, shrimp, and strawberries, and then drizzle the balsamic reduction over the scallops and shrimp.
94f4a70d-fcd6-40eb-83e8-2aef46b6c46a Gather the ingredients.
94f4a70d-fcd6-40eb-83e8-2aef46b6c46a Add the beer, lemon juice, and salt to a large saucepan or stewpot.
94f4a70d-fcd6-40eb-83e8-2aef46b6c46a Add your steamer basket to the pot, making sure that it sits well above the beer.
94f4a70d-fcd6-40eb-83e8-2aef46b6c46a Add the celery and shrimp to the basket and cover.
94f4a70d-fcd6-40eb-83e8-2aef46b6c46a Bring the beer to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
94f4a70d-fcd6-40eb-83e8-2aef46b6c46a Cook until all of the shrimp turn pink. The top ones tend to change color first, so make sure to move them around and check that all have turned pink.
94f4a70d-fcd6-40eb-83e8-2aef46b6c46a Serve warm or cold as they are or with cocktail sauce or melted butter. As these are served with the shell on, remember to provide a bowl for the shells.
94f4a70d-fcd6-40eb-83e8-2aef46b6c46a Enjoy!
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Rinse the mussels and clams. Clean the shells using a stiff brush. Place in separate large bowls, cover with water and put in the fridge. Leave to soak for a few hours. You may need to change the clam's water a few times if the clams are rather sandy.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Snip off the antennae of the shrimps.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Drain and rinse the clams and mussels several times. Pull out the mussel beards.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Chop the onion.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Halve the tomatoes and squeeze out the seeds. Grate using the largest holes of a box grater.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Halve the bell peppers and remove the seeds. Dice the bell peppers.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Heat half a cup of the seafood broth. Sprinkle the saffron over the hot broth.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Set the paella pan over medium-high heat. Pour in the olive oil. Use a wooden spatula to spread the oil over the entire bottom of the pan.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Saute the chopped onion and grated tomatoes until the onion pieces appear translucent. Add the rice. Stir to coat every grain with oil.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Pour in the seafood broth and the saffron with its soaking liquid. Season with salt and pepper. Stir then leave to boil for ten minutes.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Grate the zest of one lemon. Cut the two other lemons into wedges or slices.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Scatter the lemon zest, diced bell peppers, sweet peas, shrimps, clams and mussels over the rice. Cook for another ten minutes.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Remove the pan from the heat. Cover loosely with a large sheet of foil and leave to rest for ten minutes. Squeeze one lemon (the one without the zest) over the cooked paella.
0e147b74-060a-4be1-a602-71d5163467fc Serve with lemon wedges or slices on the side.
90f28f9f-ab3d-4061-826d-eb51de181b24 Gather the ingredients.
90f28f9f-ab3d-4061-826d-eb51de181b24 Lightly pound chicken between sheets of plastic wrap to an even thickness. Cut the chicken into strips about 1-inch wide. If you are using chicken tenders, omit this step.
90f28f9f-ab3d-4061-826d-eb51de181b24 To devein the shrimp, draw the tip of a small, sharp knife down the back of a shrimp. Remove the dark vein or coax it out with the knife. Repeat with the remaining shrimp. Rinse the shrimp under cold running water and then pat them dry with paper towels.
90f28f9f-ab3d-4061-826d-eb51de181b24 In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter with the olive oil.
90f28f9f-ab3d-4061-826d-eb51de181b24 When the butter stops foaming, add the garlic, basil, parsley, salt, and seasoning. Reduce the heat to medium-low and add the chicken and shrimp.
90f28f9f-ab3d-4061-826d-eb51de181b24 Cook the shrimp and chicken mixture, stirring, for about 10 to 15 minutes, until cooked through. If the shrimp are small, add them a few minutes after adding the chicken. The shrimp will be opaque and pink when done, and the chicken will be white and opaque throughout.
90f28f9f-ab3d-4061-826d-eb51de181b24 Spoon the chicken and shrimp mixture over hot cooked pasta or rice for serving. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley, if desired.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f Put the diced potato in a saucepan and cover with water. Add about 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook just until the potato is tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside to cool.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f Melt 3 tablespoons of the butter in a skillet or saute pan over medium-low heat. When the butter is hot, saute the mushrooms and onion until the mushrooms are tender and the onion is translucent, or about 5 to 8 minutes. Stir in shrimp and remove from the heat.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f Meanwhile, make a white sauce. In a saucepan over medium-low heat, melt remaining 3 tablespoons butter; stir in flour, salt, and pepper. Cook for 1 minute, while whisking constantly. Gradually add milk, whisking constantly. Add the sherry. Continue to cook, stirring, until thickened.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f With a slotted spoon, add the shrimp and mushroom mixture to the sauce along with the cubed cooked potatoes, the parsley, and the cooked peas and carrots. Add more liquid from cooking the mushrooms, as needed for thickness and flavor. Taste and adjust seasonings.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f Spoon the shrimp mixture into a 1-quart baking dish (an 8-inch round layer cake pan or 9-inch pie plate). Set aside.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f Heat the oven to 425 F.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f Roll out the pastry to about 11 inches in diameter. Fit the pastry over the shrimp filling. Trim and tuck the overhang under; flute as desired.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f Combine the egg white with 2 teaspoons of water and whisk to blend.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f Brush the pastry lightly with the egg wash mixture and then sprinkle with sesame seeds, if desired.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f With a sharp knife, cut several vents in the top of the crust to let steam escape.
24720b8a-af0d-4d1d-b46b-2b2e1fd0e92f Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until the crust is nicely browned and the filling is bubbly.
c0c76491-920a-43a0-92e9-009bd55856ab Gather the ingredients.
c0c76491-920a-43a0-92e9-009bd55856ab In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. If using mushrooms, saute, stirring, until golden.
c0c76491-920a-43a0-92e9-009bd55856ab Blend the flour and seasonings into the butter. Cook, stirring, for about 2 minutes.
c0c76491-920a-43a0-92e9-009bd55856ab Gradually add half-and-half and sherry to the roux; cook until the sauce is smooth and has thickened, stirring constantly.
c0c76491-920a-43a0-92e9-009bd55856ab Beat the egg yolks in a small bowl.
c0c76491-920a-43a0-92e9-009bd55856ab Whisk about one-third of the hot cream sauce mixture into the egg yolks. Add the egg yolk and sauce mixture back to the saucepan and whisk to blend.
c0c76491-920a-43a0-92e9-009bd55856ab Heat to 175 F or until the cream sauce coats the back of a spoon.
c0c76491-920a-43a0-92e9-009bd55856ab Add shrimp and heat through, stirring constantly. Serve the shrimp and sauce over puff pastry shells, rice, angel hair pasta, or toast points.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a Gather the ingredients.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a Remove the shells from the shrimp. Run the tip of a small, sharp knife down the length of the back of each shrimp and remove the dark vein (this is the shrimp's digestive tract, so it should be removed). Pick it out or scrape it out with the tip of the knife. Rinse the shrimp under cold running water and set aside.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a Cook the angel hair pasta in boiling salted water following the package directions. If you're using fresh pasta, you might want to wait to cook it at the last minute. Drain in a colander.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a Meanwhile, heat the butter and olive oil in a medium saucepan or sauté pan over medium heat.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a When the butter and oil are hot, add the minced garlic and cook until lightly golden and aromatic. Scoop the garlic out with a slotted spoon and discard.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a Add the shrimp to the garlic oil; sprinkle with the salt, pepper, and 1 tablespoon of the parsley.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a Cook over medium heat until shrimp is opaque and turns pink.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a Remove the pan from the heat and add the drained angel hair pasta, Parmesan cheese, and the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of parsley. Toss to blend.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a Serve immediately with a Caesar salad or simple green salad, warm rolls or garlic bread, and more Parmesan cheese, if desired.
7663def1-9ef2-4c92-b098-5924f160d38a Enjoy!
0da36123-705a-433d-9aca-136f6ba695bf Steam rice according to your rice cooker's instructions or on the stovetop.
0da36123-705a-433d-9aca-136f6ba695bf While the rice is cooking, boil green beans and slice on the diagonal into bite-sized pieces. Set aside.
0da36123-705a-433d-9aca-136f6ba695bf In a small bowl scramble eggs and add a pinch of salt. Heat medium size pan with olive oil and cook a thin layer of egg to make kinshi tamago (thin omelet). Remove from pan and let cool on cutting board. Cut into thin strips and set aside.
0da36123-705a-433d-9aca-136f6ba695bf Boil a small pot of water to cook the baby broccolini.
0da36123-705a-433d-9aca-136f6ba695bf Thaw cooked frozen shrimp, remove tails if desired, and then slice in half vertically to create 6 halved pieces of shrimp. Set aside.
0da36123-705a-433d-9aca-136f6ba695bf Mix in sushi rice vinegar powder with cooked rice. You may or may not use all of the cooked rice, as it will depend on how thick you make your rice layers, as well as the diameter of the cake pan. Be sure to use diagonal cutting motions with the side edge of the rice paddle (pre-moistened with water) to mix with the warm rice. This helps to prevent the rice from getting mashed.
0da36123-705a-433d-9aca-136f6ba695bf Line cake pan with a large sheet of plastic wrap. It will help you to remove the sushi with ease. If you are using a springform pan (with removable bottom), there's no need to line the pan with plastic wrap, but instead, make sure the pan is wet with water, to prevent the rice from sticking too much from the side of the pan.
0da36123-705a-433d-9aca-136f6ba695bf Add a layer of rice on the bottom of the pan. Top with pink sakura denbu shredded codfish. Layer more rice on top and then garnish with sliced green beans. Layer with the last layer of rice. Garnish top with thinly sliced egg, baby broccolini, shrimp, ikura (salmon roe caviar), and any optional garnishes.
0da36123-705a-433d-9aca-136f6ba695bf Remove from pan onto a plate and serve immediately.
0f2c5135-40a0-47c9-b1e9-db4209dcd581 Gather the ingredients.
0f2c5135-40a0-47c9-b1e9-db4209dcd581 Preheat the oven to 325 F.
0f2c5135-40a0-47c9-b1e9-db4209dcd581 Butter a shallow 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
0f2c5135-40a0-47c9-b1e9-db4209dcd581 Place shrimp in an even layer in the dish.
0f2c5135-40a0-47c9-b1e9-db4209dcd581 Combine the butter, bread crumbs, cheese, salt, lemon juice, and sherry.
0f2c5135-40a0-47c9-b1e9-db4209dcd581 Sprinkle crumb mixture evenly over shrimps.
0f2c5135-40a0-47c9-b1e9-db4209dcd581 Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until shrimps are cooked.
0f2c5135-40a0-47c9-b1e9-db4209dcd581 Increase the oven setting to broil and broil the shrimp for a minute or two, or just long enough to brown the topping.
0f2c5135-40a0-47c9-b1e9-db4209dcd581 Serve and enjoy!
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Gather the ingredients.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 If using frozen shrimp, defrost in the refrigerator. Rinse the shrimp under cold running water and pat dry with paper towels.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Place the shrimp in a large bowl and add the rice wine or sherry, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1 tablespoon cornstarch, stirring in one direction (this is to make sure the marinade spreads evenly).
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Chop the bok choy stalks diagonally and the leaves across into 1-inch pieces.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Wipe the mushrooms with a cloth or soft brush and cut into thin slices. If using Chinese dried mushrooms, soak in hot water for 20 minutes to soften. Drain the softened mushrooms, remove the stems, and cut into quarters.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Heat the wok and add 2 tablespoons oil. When the oil is hot, add the ginger. Stir-fry for about 30 seconds, until aromatic.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Next, add the shrimp and stir-fry until they turn pink. Remove the cooked shrimp from the pan.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Add a bit more oil if needed so there are about 1 1/2 tablespoons in the wok. Add the bok choy, mushrooms, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir-fry for 1 minute. If the vegetables seem a bit dry at this point, add a small amount of water or rice wine. Add the chicken broth, cover and cook for 2 more minutes.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Return the shrimp to the pan. Add the sugar, soy sauce, and pepper.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Give the cornstarch/water mixture a quick stir and add to the middle of the ingredients, stirring to thicken. Cook, stirring for another minute.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Serve hot with rice, if desired.
47d18086-194a-4844-b57b-27daa9402455 Enjoy!
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Whisk together the salt, cayenne pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Sprinkle the chicken cubes with about a third of the seasoning mix and toss to coat.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 In a separate bowl, do the same with the shrimp, using another third of the seasoning mix.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Begin cooking the pasta.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Place a large, deep, heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 When the skillet is hot, add 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and swirl to coat the pan.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Add the chicken to the skillet and quickly sear it on two sides, about 3 minutes, then add the shrimp and brown each side 30 seconds.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Remove the chicken and shrimp to a bowl.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the pan and toss in the kielbasa sausage, tomatoes, bell pepper, and onion.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Sprinkle the sausage and vegetables with the remaining third of the spice blend and cook over high heat until the vegetables are browned and softened.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Add half of the chicken stock and continue cooking over high heat until most of the stock has evaporated.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Add the garlic and wine, stirring for 2 minutes.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Add the remaining chicken stock, along with the reserved chicken and shrimp.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Stir, scraping up the browned bits from the bottom of the skillet, and simmer another 3 minutes or until the liquid is slightly reduced.
82ca386d-6ddf-459d-907e-46ad889ee145 Serve the jambalaya over the cooked fettuccine.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Gather the ingredients.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Peel the shrimp, leaving the tails on, and put them in a colander. Rinse the shrimp under cold running water, then pat dry with paper towels.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Put about 3 inches of vegetable oil in a deep, heavy saucepan or deep fryer. Heat the oil to 360 F.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f To keep the fried shrimp warm as you fry subsequent batches, heat the oven to 200 F. Place a rack in a baking sheet and set aside. Have paper towels ready for draining the shrimp.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f In a medium bowl, whisk the milk with the egg until well blended.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Put the shrimp in the milk and egg mixture and let stand for 3 to 4 minutes.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Combine the flour, cornmeal, and baking powder in another bowl; blend well. Stir in salt and a dash of freshly ground black pepper.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Dip the shrimp into the flour and cornmeal mixture to coat thoroughly. Shake off excess.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Place coated shrimp in the hot oil and cook in small batches until golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Drain on paper towels and then move to the rack on the baking sheet. Place the pan in the oven to keep them warm while you fry the remaining shrimp.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Sprinkle the fried shrimp with salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste.
18613fea-a7ed-44be-b590-987ea7bcf81f Serve and enjoy!
673c3897-a11b-4a30-8645-9bedd19de5b5 Gather ingredients.
673c3897-a11b-4a30-8645-9bedd19de5b5 In a large saucepan add the shrimp to the hot roux and cook for a few minutes. Set aside.
673c3897-a11b-4a30-8645-9bedd19de5b5 In a large skillet, heat up the oil and cook the okra and onions until the onions are transparent and fragrant and the okra is just becoming tender.
673c3897-a11b-4a30-8645-9bedd19de5b5 Add tomatoes and garlic to the okra and onion mixture. Cook a few more minutes, adding the water, salt, and pepper.
673c3897-a11b-4a30-8645-9bedd19de5b5 Combine the shrimp and roux mixture with the okra mixture in the bigger pan. Simmer the stew for about 10 minutes. Add oysters, crab meat, and crab claws and simmer for an additional 15 minutes.
673c3897-a11b-4a30-8645-9bedd19de5b5 Add the parsley and green onions and simmer for another 15 to 20 minutes.
673c3897-a11b-4a30-8645-9bedd19de5b5 Once the stew is ready and thick, serve with a side of cooked rice and add garnish with additional parsley and green onions.
673c3897-a11b-4a30-8645-9bedd19de5b5 Enjoy!
4c5f0b61-9821-425b-80c5-a93627e52f0d Heat a large cast-iron pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
4c5f0b61-9821-425b-80c5-a93627e52f0d When the pot has heated, add the oil.
4c5f0b61-9821-425b-80c5-a93627e52f0d When the oil is hot, add the flour and cook, whisking almost constantly (that is, about every 15 seconds), for 10 minutes.
4c5f0b61-9821-425b-80c5-a93627e52f0d Reduce the heat to low and continue to cook, stirring almost constantly, for 5 to 10 minutes longer until roux is medium color the color of peanut butter.
4c5f0b61-9821-425b-80c5-a93627e52f0d Add the bell pepper, onion, and celery and cook, stirring often, for another 10 minutes. Add the salt, the three types of pepper and bay leaves and stir to combine seasonings with the roux.
4c5f0b61-9821-425b-80c5-a93627e52f0d Add the stock and water. Raise heat and bring to a boil, whisking constantly.
4c5f0b61-9821-425b-80c5-a93627e52f0d Reduce heat to medium, add the Andouille slices, and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4c5f0b61-9821-425b-80c5-a93627e52f0d Add the shrimp and simmer 5 minutes longer.
4c5f0b61-9821-425b-80c5-a93627e52f0d Serve a scoop of rice on top of each bowl of gumbo, then sprinkle with the green onions and parsley. (Cook the rice while the gumbo is simmering for the final 30 minutes.)
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Gather the ingredients.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce With the tip of a sharp knife, make a shallow cut down the back of each shrimp. Peel the shrimp, remove the dark veins.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Rinse the shrimp under cold running water.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Bring a small saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the shrimp and cook for about 2 minutes, or until they are pink and opaque.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Drain and transfer the shrimp to a bowl. Cover and refrigerate.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce To make the roux, wipe the saucepan out with a paper towel and add the flour and oil, mixing well. Place the saucepan over medium-high heat and cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Reduce the heat to medium-low and continue cooking for 8 to 12 minutes, or until the mixture turns a light reddish-brown. Stir constantly to prevent scorching.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Transfer the roux to the crock pot.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Add all but the shrimp to the crockpot. Cover and cook on low for 7 to 9 hours.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Add the cooked shrimp to the gumbo and mix well. Cover and continue to cook on low for 15 to 20 minutes.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Meanwhile, cook the rice in the chicken stock or water, following the package directions.
fcdee065-e398-4ebe-8137-97af2c76f0ce Serve the gumbo over the hot cooked rice along with crusty French baguettes, cornbread, or biscuits.
7c20bc44-b578-4eb8-a3af-7fe327eb866e Make the lobster sauce first, and keep it warm.
7c20bc44-b578-4eb8-a3af-7fe327eb866e Run the shrimp under warm running water until thawed. Pat dry with paper towels. Shell and devein if necessary.
7c20bc44-b578-4eb8-a3af-7fe327eb866e Marinate the shrimp in the rice wine or sherry, salt and cornstarch for 15 minutes.
7c20bc44-b578-4eb8-a3af-7fe327eb866e Heat the wok over medium-high to high heat. Add the oil.
7c20bc44-b578-4eb8-a3af-7fe327eb866e When the oil is hot, add the ginger and green onion. Stir-fry until aromatic (about 30 seconds).
7c20bc44-b578-4eb8-a3af-7fe327eb866e Add the shrimp and stir-fry until they turn pink.
7c20bc44-b578-4eb8-a3af-7fe327eb866e Push the shrimp up to the sides of the pan and add the sauce in the middle. Bring to a boil and then mix in with the shrimp. Serve hot.
1dfe6056-424e-4fe5-80c6-ac776c9a2bcd Gather the ingredients.
1dfe6056-424e-4fe5-80c6-ac776c9a2bcd Cook the pasta according to the directions on the package.
1dfe6056-424e-4fe5-80c6-ac776c9a2bcd While the pasta cooks, in a skillet, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook 3 minutes, watching to make sure the garlic doesn't brown.
1dfe6056-424e-4fe5-80c6-ac776c9a2bcd Add the shrimp, parsley, lemon juice, and salt, and cook until the shrimp are pink and curled, 2 to 3 minutes a side.
1dfe6056-424e-4fe5-80c6-ac776c9a2bcd Drain the pasta and toss together with the shrimp mixture and the Parmesan cheese.
1dfe6056-424e-4fe5-80c6-ac776c9a2bcd Serve and enjoy.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Gather the ingredients.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Soak about 45 toothpicks in water.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Fill a large bowl with ice and cold water.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Peel the shrimp, leaving just the tails on if preferred.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 With a sharp knife, make a shallow cut down the back of the shrimp. Pull or scrape out the dark vein.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Rinse each shrimp with cold water and place it in the ice water as you work with the remaining shrimp.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 With the help of scissors or a very sharp knife, cut the bacon crosswise into thirds.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Lay the shrimp out on a work surface and pat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle them with garlic powder and Kosher salt.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Wrap each shrimp in a piece of bacon and secure it with a toothpick. Arrange the wrapped shrimp on a broiler rack. Repeat with the remaining shrimp and bacon pieces.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Broil the wrapped shrimp, turning occasionally, 3 to 4 inches from heat for about 6 to 10 minutes total, or until bacon is crisp around the edges and well browned.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Serve immediately or transfer the shrimp to a warming tray or slow cooker for self-serving. Have a plate available for guests to discard the used toothpicks.
008f229e-16b9-4a5b-8d20-ce02177b38c2 Enjoy!
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Gather the ingredients.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Soften the mushrooms by soaking in hot water for 20 to 30 minutes. Squeeze out any excess water. Cut off the stems.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Soak the shrimp in warm, lightly salted water for 5 minutes and pat dry.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Mince the mushrooms, shrimp, and green onion. Combine with the ginger and pork.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Stir in the oyster sauce, rice wine, sesame oil, and sugar. Mix the filling ingredients thoroughly.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Lay a gyoza wrapper in front of you. Wet the edges using your finger or a pastry brush and a little water.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Put 2 to 3 teaspoons of filling in the middle, taking care not to get too close to the edges.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Gather up the edges of the wrapper, lightly pressing against the filling to adhere, and gently pleat so that it forms a basket shape, keeping the top open and the filling exposed.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Line a steamer basket with parchment paper or cabbage leaves.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Steam over boiling water until the filling is cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes.
01e0e5cf-adba-4be0-9633-ce0ba93d0ad6 Serve with soy sauce and enjoy!
a2ff7a1b-e0a2-48d7-b95b-fe37e005dee2 Gather the ingredients.
a2ff7a1b-e0a2-48d7-b95b-fe37e005dee2 Peel and devein the shrimp; rinse well.
a2ff7a1b-e0a2-48d7-b95b-fe37e005dee2 Bring 3 quarts of water with 1 tablespoon of salt to a boil over high heat.
a2ff7a1b-e0a2-48d7-b95b-fe37e005dee2 Add the shrimp and reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover the pan and simmer for about 5 minutes, until the shrimp are opaque and pink. Make sure not to overcook.
a2ff7a1b-e0a2-48d7-b95b-fe37e005dee2 Drain immediately and transfer to a bowl. Cool completely, dry with a paper towel, and chop coarsely.
a2ff7a1b-e0a2-48d7-b95b-fe37e005dee2 Mix the chopped shrimp with the celery, bell pepper, lemon juice, and mayonnaise.
a2ff7a1b-e0a2-48d7-b95b-fe37e005dee2 Add salt and pepper to taste. Taste and adjust the mayonnaise and seasonings, as desired.
a2ff7a1b-e0a2-48d7-b95b-fe37e005dee2 Serve on a bed of lettuce or mixed greens and a slice of avocado or tomato wedges, if desired.
bbc02e24-969c-49fc-ab38-d51560656da7 Gather the ingredients.
bbc02e24-969c-49fc-ab38-d51560656da7 Mix together the shrimp, celery, onion, pickle, black pepper, and cayenne.
bbc02e24-969c-49fc-ab38-d51560656da7 Fold in the mayonnaise and lemon juice.
bbc02e24-969c-49fc-ab38-d51560656da7 Stir in the fresh bread crumbs, starting with half a cup and adding more as needed until most of the excess liquid is absorbed.
bbc02e24-969c-49fc-ab38-d51560656da7 Serve over greens, with crackers, or in sandwiches.
bbc02e24-969c-49fc-ab38-d51560656da7 Enjoy!
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f Gather the ingredients.
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f To split the lobster tails in half, place them on a cutting board, backside down. Use a large, sharp knife to cut down through the center to the shell the whole length.
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f Fold the shell back (like you are opening a book), breaking through the shell. If the shell doesn't break, you can use kitchen shears to cut through it. The flesh should now be exposed.
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f Pat the lobster tails dry with paper towels.
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f Preheat the grill for medium-high heat.
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f Combine the olive oil (or butter), lemon juice, dill, and salt in small mixing bowl until the salt has dissolved.
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f Brush the mixture onto the flesh side of lobster tails.
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f Place the lobster tails onto the grill and cook for 5 to 7 minutes, turning them once during the cooking process. Depending on the size of the lobster tail, it may need to cook longer.
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f Lobster tails will be done once meat reaches an internal temperature 140 F. The shells should turn a bright pink and the flesh should be opaque all the way through the center.
962f3b77-4d2f-4c34-ab3f-014eac2ac03f Remove the lobster tails from the heat. Serve and enjoy!
9fecb570-9e21-4cfd-9dfc-2f0ad8c3ff7c Gather the ingredients.
9fecb570-9e21-4cfd-9dfc-2f0ad8c3ff7c Cut each lobster tail in half. Wash thoroughly. Drain. Cut tails into pieces 1 1/2 inches in length, leaving shells on.
9fecb570-9e21-4cfd-9dfc-2f0ad8c3ff7c Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon of salt and the flour on lobster.
9fecb570-9e21-4cfd-9dfc-2f0ad8c3ff7c Mix garlic with black bean mixture in a bowl. Stir well.
9fecb570-9e21-4cfd-9dfc-2f0ad8c3ff7c Heat oil for deep-frying to smoking hot. Put in lobster pieces. Deep-fry until shells are red. Drain. Remove.
9fecb570-9e21-4cfd-9dfc-2f0ad8c3ff7c Reheat 1 tablespoon of oil in the wok. Stir-fry black bean mixture 30 seconds. Remove.
9fecb570-9e21-4cfd-9dfc-2f0ad8c3ff7c Reheat 2 tablespoons of oil in wok. Stir-fry ginger and scallion until there is an aroma, about 30 seconds. Add pork. Stir-fry on high heat until color changes. Add 1 tablespoon of sherry, soy sauce, black bean mixture, and stock. Bring to boil.
9fecb570-9e21-4cfd-9dfc-2f0ad8c3ff7c Add lobster to meat mixture. Add 1 tablespoon sherry. Cover. Cook 3 minutes.
9fecb570-9e21-4cfd-9dfc-2f0ad8c3ff7c Remove lid. Bring to boil. Thicken gravy with dissolved cornstarch. Season with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add scallions. Slowly pour in beaten egg. Stir-fry about 10 seconds. Remove.
5fbdaa5f-a931-488f-98a6-5c1f0bb536a7 Gather the ingredients.
5fbdaa5f-a931-488f-98a6-5c1f0bb536a7 Melt the butter in a large pan, once melted add the flour, a pinch of salt and pepper and the paprika. Stir well.
5fbdaa5f-a931-488f-98a6-5c1f0bb536a7 Slowly whisk in the milk, followed by the chicken stock, the white wine, and continue stirring until a smooth and slightly thickened to a cream-like consistency. (This stirring can take several minutes but spending the time at this stage of the bisque is critical to the success of the dish. Be careful not to let the mixture boil as this may cause the bisque to curdle.)
5fbdaa5f-a931-488f-98a6-5c1f0bb536a7 Add the onion, the carrots and simmer (again, do not boil) for 10 minutes. Add the cooked lobster meat and stir. Taste the bisque and adjust the seasoning to your liking.
5fbdaa5f-a931-488f-98a6-5c1f0bb536a7 Stir in the Cognac and finally, the cream. Heat through until piping hot.
5fbdaa5f-a931-488f-98a6-5c1f0bb536a7 Serve in hot bowls with a crusty baguette on the side.
5fbdaa5f-a931-488f-98a6-5c1f0bb536a7 Enjoy!
86e7fab7-5c5d-49f6-a7bb-33970f5f2413 Gather the ingredients.
86e7fab7-5c5d-49f6-a7bb-33970f5f2413 In a blender or food processor combine butter and basil. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste and blend to mix. (If you are using salted butter you might not need to add salt.)
86e7fab7-5c5d-49f6-a7bb-33970f5f2413 Transfer the mixture into a small bowl, cover and refrigerate.
86e7fab7-5c5d-49f6-a7bb-33970f5f2413 Prepare lobster tails by splitting in half. To do this use a large, sharp knife. Place the lobster tails on a cutting board backside down. Cut down through the center to the shell the whole length. Fold back, breaking through the shell. (You can use kitchen shears to cut through the shell if you need to.)
86e7fab7-5c5d-49f6-a7bb-33970f5f2413 Brush flesh lightly with oil and place cut side down on a preheated grill over medium heat. Grill for 5 to 7 minutes depending on the size of the lobster tails.
86e7fab7-5c5d-49f6-a7bb-33970f5f2413 Remove from grill, brush heavily with basil butter, and serve.
86e7fab7-5c5d-49f6-a7bb-33970f5f2413 Enjoy!
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Split the live lobster in half.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Sprinkle with salt and pepper, and brush with olive oil.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Bake it in a 425 F oven for about 18 minutes. Baste during the cooking with additional olive oil.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 When the lobster is cool enough to handle, remove the meat from the body and claws, and dice it.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Combine the wine, broth, shallots, and tarragon.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Cook until the mixture is reduced to practically a glaze.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Add this to the bechamel sauce, and stir in the cream mixed with the egg yolks.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Allow this to heat without boiling.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Add the mustard and taste for seasoning. When the sauce is well thickened, add the lobster meat, and heat through.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Fill the lobster shells with this mixture, and sprinkle with the grated Parmesan cheese.
59eca86a-d3c3-4482-8e8c-e3fc78f2adb3 Brush with melted butter, and brown in the oven at 375 F.
dc05b8a8-c563-4ee5-ad0e-aa22e0a02a3a Heat butter over medium heat; add sliced green onion, bell pepper, and celery. Sauté, stirring until celery is tender.
dc05b8a8-c563-4ee5-ad0e-aa22e0a02a3a Stir in flour until blended; add Creole seasoning.
dc05b8a8-c563-4ee5-ad0e-aa22e0a02a3a Stir in milk and continue cooking, stirring constantly, until thickened and bubbly.
dc05b8a8-c563-4ee5-ad0e-aa22e0a02a3a Stir in the Parmesan cheese until melted.
dc05b8a8-c563-4ee5-ad0e-aa22e0a02a3a Add lobster and salt and pepper, to taste. Heat through; stir in parsley, if using.
dc05b8a8-c563-4ee5-ad0e-aa22e0a02a3a Spoon the creamed lobster mixture into hot baked puff pastry shells or over toasted English muffins and garnish with a little more Parmesan cheese and parsley, if desired.
e8b1ec82-b6b1-4a9a-aba3-bad358890b55 Gather the ingredients.
e8b1ec82-b6b1-4a9a-aba3-bad358890b55 Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat, and blend in flour.
e8b1ec82-b6b1-4a9a-aba3-bad358890b55 Stir the mixture for about 2 minutes.
e8b1ec82-b6b1-4a9a-aba3-bad358890b55 Gradually stir in the half-and-half, and stir until the sauce thickens over medium heat.
e8b1ec82-b6b1-4a9a-aba3-bad358890b55 Stir in a small amount of the hot cream sauce into the beaten egg yolks. This tempers the eggs so that they will not scramble.
e8b1ec82-b6b1-4a9a-aba3-bad358890b55 Whisk the now tempered egg yolk mixture into the hot pan sauce. Continue cooking, over medium heat, stirring constantly for about 1 to 2 minutes.
e8b1ec82-b6b1-4a9a-aba3-bad358890b55 Add the lobster, sherry, lemon juice, and salt. Continue to cook over medium heat until lobster is heated through, but do not boil or sauce will scald.
e8b1ec82-b6b1-4a9a-aba3-bad358890b55 Serve in hot puff pastry shells or over toast points.
e3ea2c3e-d934-4b6d-bc99-7e38a1e315fa Put the clams, mussels, and cornmeal in a large bowl, and add enough cold salted water to cover. Let this stand for about 30 minutes to purge the clams and mussels of any sand.
e3ea2c3e-d934-4b6d-bc99-7e38a1e315fa Lay a 12-inch piece of cheesecloth on a flat surface. Arrange the celery, parsley, thyme, and peppercorns in the center. Gather the ends of the cheesecloth together and tie it tightly with string (this is called a bouquet garni). Place the bouquet garni in a very large pot (about 16 to 20 gallons).
e3ea2c3e-d934-4b6d-bc99-7e38a1e315fa Fill the pot about halfway with water and bring it to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the lobsters head first, and cover the pot. Boil the lobsters until the shell is bright red, about 8 minutes. Using tongs, remove the lobsters to a large bowl.
e3ea2c3e-d934-4b6d-bc99-7e38a1e315fa Add the potatoes and onion to the pot. Ladle off excess water, leaving enough to cover the vegetables. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Layer the sausages and corn over the vegetables. Cover and cook until the potatoes are just tender, about 10 minutes more.
e3ea2c3e-d934-4b6d-bc99-7e38a1e315fa Rinse the clams thoroughly. Arrange the clams over the corn and sausages. Place the lobsters on top of the clams. Cover the pot and boil until the clams have opened (about 10 minutes). Remove the pot from the heat.
e3ea2c3e-d934-4b6d-bc99-7e38a1e315fa Using tongs, remove the seafood, corn, potatoes, and chorizo to large platters or rimmed baking sheets. Mound the seafood in the center, discarding any unopened clams and mussels (these are not safe to eat). Surround the seafood with the potatoes, corn, and sausages. Sprinkle the vegetables with salt and pepper. Cover with foil to keep warm.
e3ea2c3e-d934-4b6d-bc99-7e38a1e315fa Discard the bouquet garni from the pot and strain the cooking liquid through a fine sieve into a bowl. Add the butter, swirling to melt. Divide the broth among six small cups to serve with the seafood.
e3ea2c3e-d934-4b6d-bc99-7e38a1e315fa Squeeze the lemons over the clambake and serve right away.
9a0b74c3-ca38-49a5-9fcd-76aaa49e56bd Heat butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat; add green onion, celery, and bell pepper. Sauté until celery is tender, stirring frequently. Add flour and stir until blended. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes.
9a0b74c3-ca38-49a5-9fcd-76aaa49e56bd Add the Creole seasoning and chicken broth; stir to blend. Stir in corn kernels. Cook, stirring, until thickened and bubbly. Stir in heavy cream, lobster, and tomato. Taste and add salt and pepper, to taste. Stir in sherry and heat through.
9a0b74c3-ca38-49a5-9fcd-76aaa49e56bd If desired, top each serving with a little crumbled cooked bacon or extra chunks of lobster.
9a0b74c3-ca38-49a5-9fcd-76aaa49e56bd Serve with crackers or hot buttered biscuits.
6b7442d6-776c-420e-9c23-6b59777878eb Gather the ingredients.
6b7442d6-776c-420e-9c23-6b59777878eb Heat the oil on medium heat in a large saucepan, and saute the onions until softened (about 5 minutes).
6b7442d6-776c-420e-9c23-6b59777878eb Add the tomatoes, garlic, pepper, and ginger to the pot and stir. Allow to cook until the tomatoes reduce (about 15 minutes).
6b7442d6-776c-420e-9c23-6b59777878eb Add the okra to the pot, followed by the prawns, squid, and fish. Add the stock and stir. Reduce the heat and allow to simmer for 5 to 10 minutes or until the okra is just tender, then remove from heat to prevent overcooking.
6b7442d6-776c-420e-9c23-6b59777878eb Preheat the oven to 400 F. Place the lobster tails flesh side-up on a baking sheet and brush generously with butter.
6b7442d6-776c-420e-9c23-6b59777878eb Bake for 12-15 minutes (depending on size), then remove from the oven, and brush with a little extra butter.
6b7442d6-776c-420e-9c23-6b59777878eb Transfer the okra stew into a serving dish, garnish with the spring onions, then top with the lobster tails.
6b7442d6-776c-420e-9c23-6b59777878eb Enjoy!
59655014-29b3-4627-8964-ee3caf49e88f In a small bowl, combine the lobster and sherry and set aside.
59655014-29b3-4627-8964-ee3caf49e88f In a medium saucepan over low heat, melt the butter.
59655014-29b3-4627-8964-ee3caf49e88f Blend in the flour and cook, stirring constantly, until it is smooth and bubbly.
59655014-29b3-4627-8964-ee3caf49e88f Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly. Continue cooking and stirring until mixture is thickened.
59655014-29b3-4627-8964-ee3caf49e88f Stir in the steak sauce, seasoned salt, and pepper to taste.
59655014-29b3-4627-8964-ee3caf49e88f Add the lobster and sherry to the cream sauce.
59655014-29b3-4627-8964-ee3caf49e88f Cover and simmer the soup for 5 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
94aa462e-9cda-4dc3-be55-80a01d183608 Split each tail lengthwise and rinse with cold water.
94aa462e-9cda-4dc3-be55-80a01d183608 Place, meat side up, on a foil-lined baking pan.
94aa462e-9cda-4dc3-be55-80a01d183608 Lightly brush each tail with melted butter and sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
94aa462e-9cda-4dc3-be55-80a01d183608 Broil about 4 inches from heat for about 4 to 6 minutes, or until tails curl.
94aa462e-9cda-4dc3-be55-80a01d183608 Remove from the oven and let cool. Cover and chill for an hour or two.
f2d37c4c-da04-4d98-8a78-79019df703ed Gather the ingredients.
f2d37c4c-da04-4d98-8a78-79019df703ed Remove the meat from steamed lobsters and cut it into cubes, or cube the already deshelled lobster meat.
f2d37c4c-da04-4d98-8a78-79019df703ed Pan-fry the meat in a generous amount of butter (4 to 6 tablespoons) until it's lightly browned. Be careful not to burn the butter, or use ghee.
f2d37c4c-da04-4d98-8a78-79019df703ed In a separate pan, heat up the milk, being careful not to boil it.
f2d37c4c-da04-4d98-8a78-79019df703ed Add the lobster meat to the hot milk and cook slowly for 5 to 10 minutes.
f2d37c4c-da04-4d98-8a78-79019df703ed Stir in the heavy cream and bring it nearly to a boil but not over. Lower the heat.
f2d37c4c-da04-4d98-8a78-79019df703ed Add salt and pepper to taste and a little paprika for color. If desired, stir in a dash of sherry for extra flavor.
f2d37c4c-da04-4d98-8a78-79019df703ed Garnish with sliced green onions or chopped parsley.
f2d37c4c-da04-4d98-8a78-79019df703ed Serve hot and enjoy!
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Remove the hard top shell from the lobster bodies and discard. Remove all the inner meat from the body (there is a fair amount, actually!) as well as the green "tomalley" (liver) as well as any of the bright red "coral" (roe) if there is any.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Put all the meat, tomalley, and roe in a bowl, and set aside in the fridge.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Returning to the remains of the lobsters, locate and remove any feathery lungs you find; they are shaped like spear points and are light and grayish. Also, discard the nasty-looking fluid-filled sac at the front of the lobster's head.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Now that the lobster body is cleaned, break up the shellsincluding broken pieces of legs, knuckles, and claws as well if you have theminto little pieces and set aside.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Put the olive oil in a stockpot and heat over medium-high heat for a minute or two. Add the dried chilies and the garlic; turn the heat down to medium. Cook until the garlic browns. Be careful not to burn it.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Add the shells, peppercorns, bay leaves, and whole cloves, and mix well to combine. Turn the heat back up to medium-high and cook for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Set a large pot of salty water on a burner to a boil. This will be your pasta water.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Now add both the cognac and the ouzo to the lobster sauce and mix well for 5 to 10 seconds. Add the tomato puree, tarragon, and parsley, then cover and bring to a simmer.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Let this simmer for 20 minutes, then crush everything in the pot using a potato masher. Do this again at 45 minutes.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 If the sauce gets too thick, add a little water. You want it to be thicker than water, but thinner than what you think of as a sauce; we will thicken it later. Taste for salt and add a little if it needs it.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 At the 55-minute mark, turn off the heat. Pour the sauce through a colander into another large pot. Mash the contents one more time. If you happen to have a food mill or duck press, use it. Discard the shells and other bits in the colander.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Now would be a good time to start cooking your pasta.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Pour half the strained sauce into a food processor. Add the reserved lobster meat, tomalley, and coral, then buzz the mixture until smooth. If you have a lot of leftover meat, reserve some for garnishing the pasta.
d8c1e7a9-0f3f-47fd-ab3b-a6306b6d7252 Pour the contents of the food processor back into the pot with the rest of the strained sauce. If it is still too thin for your liking, add a little tomato paste. Heat gently for 5 minutesit is very important to not let the sauce boil!and serve.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 F.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac To instantly kill the lobster, place the lobster flat on a cutting board and plunge the tip of a sharp knife straight down just behind the lobster's eyes to cut the spinal cord. (Alternatively, you can freeze the lobster for 30 to 60 minutes.)
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Flip the lobster over on its back. Using a sharp knife or kitchen shears, cut the lobster's body cavity open all the way down to the end of the tail but not all the way through.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Remove and reserve the tomalley (yellowish-green colored liver).
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Remove the stomach and intestines, being careful not to rupture them, and discard.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Rinse the lobster cavity and set aside.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac In a mixing bowl, combine the cracker crumbs, melted butter, celery, onion, 1 tablespoon of the Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, lemon pepper, and salt to taste.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Add the tomalley from the lobster and mix gently.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Pack the cracker mixture into the lobster's body cavity.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Sprinkle with the remaining tablespoon of Parmesan cheese and dust lightly with paprika.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Bake the stuffed lobster in an uncovered 2-inch deep baking pan for 30 minutes. If needed, place under the broiler and broil for another 2 minutes to brown the stuffing.
6f1b8894-62e5-4748-aa1e-8b7d48e689ac Serve the stuffed lobster immediately with melted butter on the side, if desired.
ca281e69-7042-4b93-a6ea-cc95a6976248 Fill a large stockpot or kettle about 3/4 full with water and add 2 teaspoons of salt for each quart of water. Bring the water to a boil over high heat.
ca281e69-7042-4b93-a6ea-cc95a6976248 Lower the lobsters, head first, into the boiling water.
ca281e69-7042-4b93-a6ea-cc95a6976248 Cover the pot and bring the water back to a boil. Continue boiling the lobsters for 15 to 20 minutes. They will be bright red when they're done.
ca281e69-7042-4b93-a6ea-cc95a6976248 Rinse the lobsters under cold running water to cool enough to handle. Crack open the shells and remove the meat; chop coarsely.
6f9dd10a-cc1d-44d1-9fc5-77a9c688b6f0 Gather the ingredients.
6f9dd10a-cc1d-44d1-9fc5-77a9c688b6f0 In a large pot, add all soup base ingredients except zucchini and lemon juice and bring to a boil. Boil over medium-high heat for 15 minutes, then add zucchini.
6f9dd10a-cc1d-44d1-9fc5-77a9c688b6f0 Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
6f9dd10a-cc1d-44d1-9fc5-77a9c688b6f0 In order to prevent pieces of spine and bone from getting into the soup, wrap whole fish loosely in a piece of tulle and secure.
6f9dd10a-cc1d-44d1-9fc5-77a9c688b6f0 Add fish, lobster (if using), and cuttlefish (if using), to the soup base. When boil resumes, cook for 20-25 minutes, uncovered.
6f9dd10a-cc1d-44d1-9fc5-77a9c688b6f0 5 minutes before cooking time is up, add lemon juice.
6f9dd10a-cc1d-44d1-9fc5-77a9c688b6f0 Traditionally, the whole fish, other seafood, and vegetables are placed on a large platter, and the soup is served separately in a tureen or individual soup bowls.
a7f49c82-6762-4b55-84ee-2d663e139e42 Boil some water in a large pot for the pasta. Cook the pasta according to packet instructions and have it ready around the same time as the clams or just a bit before.
a7f49c82-6762-4b55-84ee-2d663e139e42 Soak the clams in a bowl of cold water for about 10 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold running water.
a7f49c82-6762-4b55-84ee-2d663e139e42 Heat the oil and butter over medium heat in a large, heavy-based pot. Add the onion and fry for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until translucent. Add the garlic, chili flakes and salt and stir for about 20 seconds.
a7f49c82-6762-4b55-84ee-2d663e139e42 Add the chopped tomatoes and fry for about 7 minutes until their juice starts to evaporate.
a7f49c82-6762-4b55-84ee-2d663e139e42 Turn the heat up to medium-high and add the clams to the pot. Cover with a lid. After about 2 to 3 minutes add the wine to the pot. Cover again and shake the pot from side to side.
a7f49c82-6762-4b55-84ee-2d663e139e42 Cook the clams for a further 5 minutes or until they open. Add the parsley and stir with a wooden spoon. Cover and shake pot again.
a7f49c82-6762-4b55-84ee-2d663e139e42 Drain the pasta and then pour the clam mixture on top. Stir well and serve immediately.
8c1e68ef-cf3e-4ce7-9efa-f50e03e96b5f Remove stems from mushrooms; mince stems and set aside. Place mushroom caps on a lightly oiled rack in broiling pan rounded side down. Set aside.
8c1e68ef-cf3e-4ce7-9efa-f50e03e96b5f Drain clams, reserving liquid.
8c1e68ef-cf3e-4ce7-9efa-f50e03e96b5f In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter.
8c1e68ef-cf3e-4ce7-9efa-f50e03e96b5f Brush some butter on mushroom caps.
8c1e68ef-cf3e-4ce7-9efa-f50e03e96b5f In remaining butter in skillet, simmer the minced stems, garlic, and reserved liquid from clams until mushroom stems are tender, about 4 to 6 minutes.
8c1e68ef-cf3e-4ce7-9efa-f50e03e96b5f Stir in clams and remaining ingredients. Spoon clam mixture into mushroom caps.
8c1e68ef-cf3e-4ce7-9efa-f50e03e96b5f Move the pan to the oven and broil mushrooms for 7 to 9 minutes, or until mushrooms are tender and the stuffing is browned.
c7c20318-e93a-4ee1-aa3c-59c038bfcf19 Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Meanwhile, scrub the clams clean, if they need it, and set them aside in a colander.
c7c20318-e93a-4ee1-aa3c-59c038bfcf19 Peel and mince the garlic. In a large pan or pot with a tight-fitting lid over medium-high heat, add the olive oil. Once the olive oil is hot, add the garlic. It should sizzle immediately. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the pepper flakes, if using. Add the white wine, bring to a boil, reduce heat to maintain a simmer, and cook, stirring when you think of it, until the liquid is reduced by half, about 10 minutes.
c7c20318-e93a-4ee1-aa3c-59c038bfcf19 Turn the heat back up to medium-high, add the clams, cover, and cook until the clams are open and cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes, depending on the size of the clams. When they're done, add the parsley and stir to combine.
c7c20318-e93a-4ee1-aa3c-59c038bfcf19 While the clams cook, add salt to the boiling water (enough so the water tastes a bit salty) and the pasta. Cook until tender to the bite (timing will vary depending on brand. Drain.
c7c20318-e93a-4ee1-aa3c-59c038bfcf19 There are 2 ways to serve the pasta. First, the easy one: Divide the pasta between 4 to 6 serving bowls and top with even amounts of clams and sauce. Second, which requires a bit more effort but I prefer it: Use tongs or a slotted spoon to remove the clams from the pot (just put them in a bowl), add the pasta to the sauce in the pot and stir to toss to coat the pasta thoroughly, divide the pasta between serving bowls, top with the clams and garnish with Parmesan.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 To prepare this recipe you will need a 17-inch (44cm) paella pan. Due to the size of the pan, we recommend that you cook the fideua on a kettle BBQ or a gas paella burner for even heat distribution. Assemble all the ingredients and kitchen equipment on a table near the BBQ, so that you can stay in the area and monitor the cooking.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 Be sure to light the coals about 20 minutes before you will begin cooking. This allows time for the coals to heat and be covered in white ash.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 Rinse shrimp, mussels, and clams under cold running water and set aside.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 Pour fish or shrimp stock into a medium saucepan and warm for use later.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 Rinse fish under cold water and cut into 2-inch cubes. Clean the squid and trim the tentacles. Slice squid into rings.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 De-seed and slice red pepper into thin strips. Cut each tomato into 8 pieces. Peel garlic cloves and place in a mortar and mash with the pestle.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 Place the paella pan on the BBQ grate or paella burner and add enough olive oil to coat the bottom and allow the pan to heat up. When hot enough, sauté the shrimp and squid in the olive oil.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 Add olive oil as needed to prevent sticking. When the shrimp is pink, it is cooked. Remove shrimp and squid from the pan and set aside. Leave the oil in the pan.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 Put the diced tomatoes, red pepper, and mashed garlic in the olive oil with the two red pepper pods and sauté for two minutes.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 Crush saffron threads with finders. Add the fish stock and saffron threads to the pan and stir. Bring broth to a boil.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 When liquid starts to boil, add the vermicelli and fish and stir. Spread the clams, mussels, and squid around the pan and arrange the shrimp on top. Cook for 15 minutes, or until the pasta is al dente.
264dcc16-ef2e-472b-b271-e1cb18ff5730 Remove the fideua from the barbecue or burner. Cover with aluminum foil and let it "rest" for 5 minutes. Uncover and serve with lemons.
792aa059-217f-4837-bf01-d0aadcbbfe39 Gather the ingredients.
792aa059-217f-4837-bf01-d0aadcbbfe39 In a soup pot, stir-fry the beef, garlic, and gochugaru in the sesame oil for about five minutes.
792aa059-217f-4837-bf01-d0aadcbbfe39 Add anchovy or beef stock or water and soy sauce to the pot.
792aa059-217f-4837-bf01-d0aadcbbfe39 Bring to a simmer.
792aa059-217f-4837-bf01-d0aadcbbfe39 Add soft tofu and return to simmer.
792aa059-217f-4837-bf01-d0aadcbbfe39 Add clams and simmer until the clams are cooked, about 10 minutes, until they shrink, or until the shells open (if using unshucked).
792aa059-217f-4837-bf01-d0aadcbbfe39 Add scallions and take off heat.
792aa059-217f-4837-bf01-d0aadcbbfe39 Serve and enjoy!
b6778597-fc2b-4e91-8c01-24c19fa31a89 Gather the ingredients.
b6778597-fc2b-4e91-8c01-24c19fa31a89 Add the clams to a bowl of salted, cold water (add about 1/4 cup of salt to a 1/2 gallon of water). Allow to sit either on the counter or the refrigerator for 30 minutes. The clams will filter out any sand from their shells while sitting in the water.
b6778597-fc2b-4e91-8c01-24c19fa31a89 Add the butter to a large pot, one thats large enough to fit the clams as well. Heat the butter on medium heat until the butter melts. Add the diced onion, salt, and half of the garlic. Saute until the onions are soft and translucent.
b6778597-fc2b-4e91-8c01-24c19fa31a89 Add the chicken bouillon to the onions and stir to combine. Add in 1/2 cup of water, the white wine, and lemon juice. Add the clams and remaining garlic to the broth.
b6778597-fc2b-4e91-8c01-24c19fa31a89 Cover the pot with a lid. Cook on medium high heat for about 5 minutes, or until the clams have just opened. Discard any clams that have not opened.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Gather the ingredients.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Place shrimp, squid, mussels, and small clams in 4 different bowls of cold water with a little coarse salt added to each and soak for 30 minutes.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Drain the shrimp and rinse under cold running water, then shell them. Place the shrimp in a small bowl and put the shells in a small saucepan.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Pour the 2 cups cold water over shells, place the saucepan over medium heat, and simmer for 30 minutes.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Strain the broth (it should yield about 1 cup), discard the shells, and set aside until needed.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Meanwhile, place a small saucepan with 1/4 cup of the olive oil over medium heat. When the oil is warm, add the garlic and saute for 2 minutes.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Add the tomatoes and white wine. Simmer for 30 minutes, seasoning to taste with salt and pepper.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Pass the contents of the saucepan through a food mill, using the disc with the smallest holes, and into a flameproof enamel casserole dish.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Set the casserole dish over low heat to reduce the liquid for 15 minutes.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Meanwhile, drain the squid and rinse under cold running water.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Place another medium-sized saucepan with 1/4 cup of oil over low heat. When the oil is warm, add the squid and saute for 5 minutes.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Season with salt and pepper and add shrimp broth a little at a time and simmer until the squid is tender, for 10 to 20 minutes, depending on the size of the squid.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Bring a large pot of cold water to a boil and add salt to taste. Once the squid is cooked, add the pasta to the boiling water and cook for 8 to 11 minutes depending on the brand: that is, 1 minute less than for normal al dente.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 As the pasta cooks, drain the mussels and clams, scrub them under cold water, then place in a large skillet with the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil. Place over high heat, cover, and cook for 10 minutes, by which time they should be opened. Discard any that remain unopened.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Add the shrimp to the pan with the squid and cook for 3 minutes. When the pasta is ready, drain it and transfer it to the skillet with the mussels and clams. Add the tomato sauce with the shrimp and squid, then mix very well and let cook for 1 minute more to let the pasta to absorb some of the sauce.
a6bfc3ea-9dc0-456c-ae34-f0a01b43c918 Transfer to a warmed serving platter, sprinkle with the whole parsley leaves, and serve.
8fc9a89f-24cf-4331-80c4-31d3a7b19317 Fry 4 slices chopped bacon in a medium pot until soft and golden, about 4 minutes. Add 1 small chopped onion and 2 cloves chopped garlic and continue cooking until the bacon is nicely browned and the onion is tender, about 4 minutes longer.
8fc9a89f-24cf-4331-80c4-31d3a7b19317 Stir in 3 pounds well-scrubbed Manila clams and add 1 cup beer or water or chicken stock. Cover the pot and steam the clams for 3 to 5 minutes, until they open. Discard any clams that do not open.
8fc9a89f-24cf-4331-80c4-31d3a7b19317 Stir gently to mix with the bacon, garlic, and onion, and serve immediately.
cc502e65-7afc-4ad8-9c5c-f275caa488cf Gather the ingredients.
cc502e65-7afc-4ad8-9c5c-f275caa488cf Turn the Instant Pot to the sauté function. Add 1/2 tablespoon olive oil to the pot. Transfer the diced bacon to the pot and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
cc502e65-7afc-4ad8-9c5c-f275caa488cf Carefully transfer the cooked and crisped bacon to a paper towel lined plate, leaving the rendered bacon fat in the pot.
cc502e65-7afc-4ad8-9c5c-f275caa488cf Add the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of olive oil to the pot and add the diced onions, celery, and garlic. Sauté for about 4 minutes, or until softened, stirring occasionally.
cc502e65-7afc-4ad8-9c5c-f275caa488cf Add the cubed potatoes, clams, clam juice, water, salt, thyme, and pepper to the pot. Secure the lid on the pot and set to manual. Cook on high pressure for 5 minutes. When the cooking is complete, manually release the pressure by moving the valve to venting.
cc502e65-7afc-4ad8-9c5c-f275caa488cf Remove the lid and once again set to the sauté function. (Use a low setting, if possible on your appliance). Add the milk and cream to the pot. Heat, stirring occasionally, to a very gentle boil.
cc502e65-7afc-4ad8-9c5c-f275caa488cf In a small bowl, add the flour. Ladle about 3/4 cup of the liquid from the soup and transfer it to the bowl. Using a fork, stir the flour and liquid together until you get a thick paste. Scrape the thick paste into the pot and stir to incorporate with the rest of the soup. Let the soup simmer for about 4 minutes more to thicken.
cc502e65-7afc-4ad8-9c5c-f275caa488cf Ladle the soup into serving bowls. Top with the crumbled bacon and a few twists of fresh black pepper. Serve with oyster crackers, if desired.
cc502e65-7afc-4ad8-9c5c-f275caa488cf Enjoy!
226c964b-2bb1-4247-a6f1-0e762df6bf6f In a medium bowl with an electric mixer, combine the cream cheese, mayonnaise, and garlic; beat until smooth. Fold in the drained minced clams along with the remaining seasonings. Transfer the dip mixture to a serving bowl or container.
226c964b-2bb1-4247-a6f1-0e762df6bf6f Cover the container and refrigerate the clam dip for about 2 hours, or until it is thoroughly chilled.
226c964b-2bb1-4247-a6f1-0e762df6bf6f Serve the chilled dip with chips, crackers, or fresh sliced vegetables.
8349728c-a876-4ef6-9bf2-53bd94b1233f In a large saucepan, over medium-high heat cook the bacon until almost crisp. Reduce the heat to low, add 1 tablespoon of the butter, the onions, and sauté until soft, about 5 minutes. Be careful not to brown the onions. Add the flour and cook for 2 more minutes.
8349728c-a876-4ef6-9bf2-53bd94b1233f Whisk in water and reserved clam juice, and once combined add the potatoes. Season with the salt and pepper, increase heat to medium, bring to a simmer, and cook uncovered until potatoes are tender.
8349728c-a876-4ef6-9bf2-53bd94b1233f Reduce heat to very low, pour in half-and-half, add the rest of the butter, and clams, and cook until heated through. Do not boil! Turn off heat, adjust seasoning, and serve hot.
